title: Customer Happiness Specialist
description:
**About SureSwift Capital**
---------------------------

  

At SureSwift, we’re building the company we want to work for, and we’d like to give you the opportunity to join our fully remote team of 90+ people around the world.  

  

SureSwift places a high emphasis on a positive work-life balance. We all work remote and focus on building a culture of being known as exceptional operators of excellent SaaS business where everyone thrives!  

  

SureSwift Capital is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are looking to fill this role in our Canadian or US market.**About Mailparser & Docparser**
--------------------------------

  

Mailparser https://mailparser.io/ is a B2B SaaS solution that automatically pulls data from emails to gain workplace efficiencies. Mailparser enables its users to extract all relevant data fields from incoming emails that contain important data in the email body or in the form of attachments using parsing rules they define. Extracted data can be sent back to our customers via various integration options in real-time.  

  

Docparser https://docparser.com/ is a SaaS data capture solution that extracts data from documents (PDFs, MS Word, Image files) and can then send that data automatically to a customer’s system, a spreadsheet, or any number of places via various integration options. Data is extracted quickly and can be sent back to the customer in real-time.**Your Daily Challenges**
-------------------------

  

When we welcome you aboard as a full-time Customer Happiness Specialist, we’ll introduce you to your team, which consists of the Product Manager, fellow Customer Happiness Specialists, and software engineers. These are the people you’ll work closely with day-to-day.  

Once you get settled in and learn more about the team, your day to day activities will look something like this:* Answering help desk tickets and live chat in an accurate, effective, and timely manner
* Meeting with customers via webcam to help navigate and resolve challenges
* Lead weekly webinars for current customers and weekly demos for potential users
* Onboarding new customers and leading onboarding sessions
* Field inbound calls from potential customers and leverage scheduled calls to convert trial users to paid users
* Collaborate with your development team on any tickets that require their input
* Work with your Product Manager and fellow Customer Happiness Specialists to improve the customer experience
* Track and report your success
* Attend weekly team meetings
* Other duties as assigned

**Your Experience and Qualifications**
--------------------------------------

* 3+ years experience in online customer service
* Ownership of Customer Success and Happiness
* Experience using a Help Desk Ticketing System (e.g. Help Scout, Zendesk etc) and Jira
* Previous experience in converting inquiries to paid users is a plus!
* Self-starter, capable of working independently
* Strong organization, multi-tasking, and time management skills
* Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
* Excellent and clear English communication skills, both written and verbal
* Previous SaaS experience is a plus!
* Ability to learn and then educate around new software applications quickly
* Experience working in an entrepreneurial / startup environment
* Experience working with remote teams

**Your Compensation**
---------------------


The annual pay range for this role is expected to be between $35K - $45K USD or $47,566 - $61,157 CAD. Actual base pay could vary based on factors including but not limited to experience, subject matter expertise, geographic location where work will be performed and the applicant’s skill set.  

  

Background checks will be conducted on final candidates.  

  

Thanks for the time you took to read about this opportunity.

title: Monitoring specialist Splunk O
description:
Job Title : Monitoring specialist with Splunk O

Location: Remote

Duration: Long term

Job Type : Contract (We can consider - W2 / C2C )

Responsibilities:

* Maintenance and deployment of Splunk / Dynatrace infrastructure and integrating alerts with ticketing system to maintain minimal service outages.
* Perform installation, implementation, customization, operation, recovery, and performance tuning.
* Understand customer requirement and develop customize scripts to get monitoring data into system.
* Process knowledge on observing, evaluating, and managing the health, performance, and availability of cloud-based applications, architecture, and services.
* Monitor data flowing through multiple locations via various devices.
* Get visibility into user, file, and application behavior to improve the performance of their cloud environment.
* Identify potential vulnerabilities before they become a significant issue.
* Prepare security audit reports for compliance purposes.
* Scale observability capabilities as architecture grows.
* Use monitoring insight to make informed engineering and product decisions.
* Take daily, weekly, and monthly backup of your historical data, tool configuration.
* Utilize scripting & development skills to reduce operational man-hours and reduce time to restore for incidents. This should include implementing practices that support Agile and Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) principles. Provisioning both day to day operations and automation using tools, e.g. Ansible, Jenkins, python, bash, PowerShell.
* Measure and optimize system performance, with an eye toward pushing our capabilities forward, getting ahead of customer needs, and innovating for continual improvement.
* Work with both application and operations teams with a focus on developing the self-healing system for alerts triggered in monitoring tool.
* Should be highly proactive with a keen focus on improving uptime availability of mission critical application. Leverage modern tools and instrumentation to drive reliability and meet Service Level Objectives (SLOs).
* Utilize monitoring tools to track performance and availability of applications and determine trends. Ability to coach others in learning this technology.
* Utilize log forwarding technology to troubleshoot problems and identify trends. Ability to coach others in learning this technology.
* Encourage collaboration and cohesiveness within their team and drive teams outside their immediate organization in implementing SRE principles.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

* Enabling monitoring for various technologies like OS, Database including MSSQL, MySQL, Oracle, db2, and Middleware applications, Storage, venter, backup, hardware and SNMP monitoring.
* Doing health checks of the systems to make sure 100% availability of Splunk / Dynatrace / Zabbix applications.
* Experience in implementing Splunk / Dynatrace core in different projects along with integration between Splunk / Dynatrace and Ticketing tool.
* Proficient in installation and configuration of Splunk / Dynatrace / Zabbix monitoring tool.
* Working knowledge of migration from different monitoring tools to Zabbix along with up gradation of Zabbix version to the latest version
* Working knowledge of migration from different monitoring tools along with up gradation to old version to the latest version
* Hands-on trouble shooting technical issues an identify solutions.
* Strong background in Linux/Unix, windows administration
* Basic idea on Networking concept and experience with Bash, PowerShell, Python.
* Experience using a wide variety of open-source technologies and cloud services.
* Experience with automation orchestration and configuration management tools such as Ansible, Jenkins etc.

Primary Skillset

* Splunk, Azure Monitoring Tool, Splunk O
* Basic knowledge in any one of the middleware application Server (Jboss/WebLogic/WebSphere)
* Should be able to capture/analyze logs with a basic level of troubleshooting.
* Basic understanding and troubleshooting skills including file/disk/process/network management.
* Hands-on experience in interpreting and writing SQL queries.
* Knowledge of ServiceNow ITSM tool

Secondary Skillset

* Dynatrace, Zabbix, Graphana, Knowledge on MSSQL, MySQL Database
* Knowledge of ITSM tools such as Jira, BMC Remedy, HPSM, , Service Desk, etc.
* Should be able to capture/analyze logs with a basic level of troubleshooting.
* Hands-on experience of shell scripting for automations purposes

**Thanks & Regards**

**Rajan**

225 Cedar Hill St, Suite 200, Marlborough, MA 01752

title: Part-Time Resource and Referral Support Specialist
description:
**Title: Part-Time** **Resource** **and Referral** **C****ommunity** **Support****Specialist**  

**Reports To****:** **R****esource** **and Referral** **Community Support** **Manager**


**Salary Range:*****$25 an hour***


**To Apply:** Complete application at our hiring site


**About United 4 Children**



United 4 Children (U4C) makes children a priority. By providing children with healthy meals, creating safe places to learn and play, and providing social-emotional and inclusive services for children with special needs or challenging behaviors – United 4 Children ensures every child has the foundation to thrive. U4C offers high-quality support programs serving children up to 13 so that families can feel at ease knowing their children, regardless of ability, are receiving the best care possible and have every opportunity to succeed.


**United 4 Children’s Values**



At United 4 Children, it is expected that we center our common values in the work that we do individually and together. We hold each other accountable to live out these values in our work and celebrate with each other as we demonstrate the following:


* **Community** – We put the needs and desires of children, families, and caregivers at the center of our work. We partner with educators and fellow nonprofit organizations to create excellent educational and developmental opportunities for every child in the region.
* **Trust** – For over 50 years, we have been honest and earnest in all our interactions. We strive to readily meet community needs particularly where other resources do not exist.
* **Equity** – We seek to understand the disparities facing children, families, and childcare providers. We ensure everyone has access to the resources needed to thrive.
* **Empathy** – We strive to understand the unique experiences of every person we encounter. We respect each person’s journey and seek to support everyone’s specific needs.


**What You Will Do:**


* Support manager in development, implementation, and achievement of Recruitment and Referral team plans based on agency outcomes
* Serve as the first line of communication for providers and families
* Maintain an up-to-date knowledge of resources and services (statewide)
* Connect with providers using (Phone, email, MO ECE website, Parent link, and other related resources)
* Provide relevant resources and referrals to clients when requested, i.e., connection to licensing and accreditation offices, childcare programs, family support, and inclusion services etc.
* Collaborate with other team members in the ECER&R (Resource and Referrals and Community Leadership team)
* To support holistic service integration with clients
* Complete required agency reporting and maintain accurate client files in databases
* Update resource information for client, providers and families
* Availability to work call center Saturday and Sunday 12:00pm-5:00pm
* Actively participate in required meetings and personal professional development
* Maintain other duties as assigned


 **Skills We Are Looking For**

  

* An advanced degree or equivalent work experience in Early Childhood Development, Education, Social Work, Psychology, or related field
* Pass a Family Care and Safety Registry Screening
* Authorized to work in the United States
* Experience and skill working with diverse populations
* Successful implementation of trauma informed strategies
* Conscientious use of justice, equity, and inclusion lens when working with self and others
* Successful at working in multiple teams simultaneously
* Ability to work weekends


*United 4 Children is an equal opportunity employer. United 4 children does not discriminate in employment with regard to age, race, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation (including transgender status, gender identity or expression), sexual stereotyping, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation, and related medical conditions), marital status, physical or mental disability, genetic information (including testing and characteristics), association with anyone who is a member of a protected class, AIDS/HIV status, veteran status, uniformed servicemember status, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local laws. Equal access to programs, services, and employment is available to all qualified persons. Those applicants requiring accommodation to complete the application and/or interview process should contact a management representative.*

title: Mainframe support specialist
description:
**Title: Mainframe System Support Administrator**  
**Location: Remote**  
**Duration: 4+ Months** 

Seeking a **Mainframe System Support Administrator** for an opportunity with our client in Columbia, SC.

**Summary:**

* Provide system/production support and monitoring for applications, batch cycles, releases, projects, installations, etc. Participate in work sessions for system support and problem resolution. May provide coordination in workload transition tasks.
* Working in a 24 X 7 Supporting Team, daily functions include:
* Scheduling Contractor Request Jobs
* Assisting In Release Installations (JCL Explode Processes, ENDEVOR)
* ABEND Research & Resolutions
* Process Review & Documentation

**Top skills:**

* Mainframe Production Support Skills:
* Batch Cycle Support
* ABEND Resolution
* Online Support; Release Management
* Mainframe Tools:
* TSO
* JCL
* IBM Workload Scheduler (IWS/TWS)
* ENDEVOR
* VSAM /IAM File Structures
* Microsoft Office Suite of Tools
* OUTLOOK

**Job/class description:**

* Perform/Support installation, configuration, administration, implementation, scheduling and/or tuning/modification of applications. Provide support for moderate to complex system/production performance concerns. Collaborate with various internal groups and external vendors to ensure all specifications are met and problems are resolved as they arise.
* Assist in analysis of problems/issues. Perform corrective actions whenever possible to fix applications that end abnormally and/or notify technical support for resolution. Communicate with applications on-call persons to repair applications that ended abnormally. Consult with senior level peers on projects of greater complexity.
* Evaluate system performance in real-time as well as via reports for release related issues. Monitor and report on scheduled batch and online applications for successful/unsuccessful execution. Review all abnormal results/issues to production processing from previous cycles and verify that they have been logged/resolved. May run necessary system backups.
* Verify Production and Test environments are up and functioning properly. Perform testing responsibilities as need. Review and/or create documentation for accuracy, future problems, and company standards.
* Participate in work sessions and walkthroughs for quality and production implementations, releases, data conversion projects and/or disaster recovery exercises. Attend implementation meetings to determine impact to system availability and assignment of team resources for these implementations.
* Look for improvement opportunities in the cycles and in procedures. May create new programs to automate the release process where possible. Assist and provide recommendations in applications enhancement projects.

**Required knowledge, skills, and abilities:**

* Comprehends data storage techniques, database philosophy, database management, and programming techniques.
* Strong understanding of the requirements for maintaining production systems and the effect of program changes.
* Understands how to use structured techniques in new program development.
* Strong understanding of development, quality assurance, and integration methodologies.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Able to work well under pressure and as part of a team.
* Pays attention to detail.
* Strong knowledge of relevant operating systems, programming languages, and/or development/productivity tools and their usage in the company.
* Strong Verbal and Written Communication Skills – Documentation of processes and Cycle ABEND / Online Status / Release Installation details to an external audience

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $37.00 - $40.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Mainframe production support: 5 years (Required)
* JCL: 5 years (Required)
* VSAM: 5 years (Required)
* TSO: 4 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Zapier Build Specialist
description:
Job Title: Zapier Integration Specialist

Company: We Build Zaps

Website: www.webuildzaps.com

Location: Remote

About Us:

We Build Zaps is a dynamic and innovative company specializing in creating seamless automation solutions through Zapier integrations. Our mission is to empower businesses across various industries by streamlining workflows and enhancing operational efficiency.

Position Overview:

We are seeking a skilled and motivated individual to join our Zapier Build Team as a Zapier Integration Specialist. As a key member of our team, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and optimizing Zapier integrations for our clients.

Responsibilities:

Design, build, and deploy Zapier integrations to automate workflows and enhance efficiency.

Experience working with open APIs and knowledge of how they function.

Background in Insurance, E-commerce, Sales, or Finance is a significant bonus.

title: Onboarding & Special Projects Specialist
description:
**Onboarding & Special Projects Specialist**

*Job Type: Full-Time*

*Schedule: Monday – Friday*, *8:00am - 5:00pm CST*

24hr Bookkeeper, Inc. provides confidence in client construction financials. Our team is comprised of individuals who are hardworking, self-motivated and quickly adapt to change. We strive to find employees who have QuickBooks Online, construction and bookkeeping experience.

Join our team of hard working, passionate individuals, committed to client success and transparency. 24hr Bookkeeper employees embody the following values: accountability, teamwork, open-minded, curiosity and producing excellence.

The Onboarding and Special Projects Specialist is responsible for cultivating relationships with new clients. This position will work with clients in the construction industry including residential and commercial general contractors, custom builders, designers, spec/model home builders, remodelers, roofers, developers and subcontractors. The Onboarding and Special Projects Specialist will meet with new clients to perform financial projects including financial clean-up, integration, QBO setup, conversion, consulting and transfer to monthly services team. The employee in this position should be a self-starter, motivated and excited by completion of projects, financial clean-up and building client relationships. 24hr Bookkeeper is looking for someone who is a critical thinker, outgoing, assertive, confident and a good listener.

Roles and Responsibilities:

· Review client financials (financial analysis) and identify areas for clean-up needed

· Work in conjunction with sales to identify appropriate scope of work and timelines for potential clients

· Onboard all new clients for special project from sales

· Schedule client project work and assign the necessary resources

· Ensure project milestones are completed timely and efficiently

· Oversee, support and delegate tasks to assigned team members in the special project department

· Review client financials to ensure accuracy

· Onboard clients to the data center team and create processes for successful monthly bookkeeping

· Build client notes to be followed in ClickUp for data center team to take over processing

· Ensure smooth transition to Data Center

· Communicate with Data Center Manager and provide time estimates for clients moving to monthly bookkeeping

Base level expectations: (Update as appropriate)

* Manage all client onboarding for special projects and assist if client moves to monthly
* Complete work on all special projects (conversions, integration, consulting, QBO setup, goals & insights)
* Delegate appropriate tasks to Special Project Team
* Work with the Data Center Manager to identify opportunities for efficiency gain
* Assist with actively seeking software solutions to increase internal efficiencies for teams
* Create client tech stacks for future services and identify potential software opportunities
* Assist with creating solutions for streamlined client bookkeeping
* Create a cohesive and trusting relationship with clients
* Provide impeccable client service

Qualifications:

· Proficient in Microsoft Word and Microsoft Excel (or equivalent Google Docs and Google Sheets)

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills

· Familiar with technology and the ability to work in multiple software/apps

· Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment

· Strong problem-solving skills and ability to handle unfamiliar tasks

· Ability to self-motivate and take on a challenge with a positive attitude

· Ability to follow established company policies and procedures

· Minimum 3 years of QuickBooks Online experience (not QuickBooks Desktop)

· Minimum 1 year of management experience

· Construction knowledge/experience preferred

Benefits:

· 401k

· 401k matching

· Vacation Time

· Sick Time

The top 5 reasons employees work at 24hr Bookkeeper are:

· Client relationships

· Management

· Work/Home life balance

· Remote position

· Family-like atmosphere

Find us on Social Media

· https://24hrbookkeeper.com/ - Company Website

· https://www.instagram.com/24hrbookkeeper/?hl=en - Instagram

· https://www.tiktok.com/@24hrbookkeeper - TikTok

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* management: 1 year (Required)
* QuickBooks Desktop: 1 year (Preferred)
* QuickBooks Online: 3 years (Required)
* Construction: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Data Application Specialist
description:
**ONE Technology Services** is seeking an experienced **Data Application Specialist** with a proven track record in data foundations, warehousing, data architecture, and AI/ML, particularly in the realm of IoT or IIoT systems. The ideal candidate will possess 3-5 years of relevant experience and have a deep understanding of data governance, cloud hosting options (especially GCP), and superior communication and analytic skills.

**What you need / Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's or higher degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
* 3-5 years of experience in data foundations, warehousing, data architecture, and AI/ML, preferably in IoT or IIoT systems.
* Working knowledge of cloud hosting options, with a strong emphasis on GCP.
* Superior communication and analytic skills.
* Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.

**What you'll do:**

* Provide expertise in the ongoing operations, maintenance, and administration of network systems.
* Evaluate and enhance the features and capabilities of data applications, ensuring they align with business requirements and industry best practices.
* Oversee the technical platform, ensuring its robustness, scalability, and adaptability to meet evolving business needs.
* Implement and optimize data applications on cloud platforms, with a primary focus on GCP. Leverage knowledge of AWS and Azure as secondary considerations.
* Demonstrate expertise in IoT protocols to facilitate seamless communication between devices and applications.
* Monitor and optimize system response times and latency to ensure optimal performance for end-users.
* Implement and enforce data security measures, adhering to industry standards and regulations.
* Enable customers to configure and customize the system according to their needs. Develop and maintain APIs for seamless integration.
* Ensure interoperability with other systems and applications to support a cohesive technological environment.
* Design and implement scalable solutions to accommodate growing data volumes and user demands.
* Keep abreast of emerging technologies and adapt existing systems to incorporate innovative solutions.
* Establish and maintain systems with high reliability and minimal downtime.
* Focus on enhancing the user experience, making data applications intuitive and user-friendly.
* Develop comprehensive technical specifications, installation & implementation guides, and user training materials.
* Proactively identify opportunities for product enhancement, and oversee the ongoing maintenance and support of data applications.

**Whom we're looking for:**

* Team spirit.
* Time management, Attention to detail.
* Punctual, responsible, and able to work independently where required.
* Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and executives.

**ONE Technology Services** We specialize in software services involving; custom App development, custom Web development, Staff augmentation, managed and cloud services, technical recruitment services, and IT consultancy.

ONE Technology Services is also a product-based company. Our products Workshop solution and ERP solution for services-based businesses are already well-tested and solving business problems by hitting right at the bull's eye. These products are highly customizable to address the specific needs of our clients. Having 16+ years of working experience with top US and Canadian clients enables us to know exactly how to solve all of our client’s business challenges. We also have various software and APPs that are currently under development.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Work Location: Remote

title: Bilingual Technical Customer Support Specialist - Remote within U.S.
description:
OEC provides software solutions to those who work in the automotive parts and repair industry. Our solutions make it easier for automotive industry professionals to buy and sell parts, conduct repair research & planning, optimize estimates, improve the parts supply chain, and more. OEC partners with many of the world’s largest manufacturers, dealers and suppliers, shops and repairers, and service providers, giving our customers access to a comprehensive network and a streamlined workflow.
  
  

Job Summary
  
Provides technical assistance and customer support through phone and email. Resolves product and system issues through effective communication, troubleshooting and diagnosis, to include resolutions such as brief product overviews and/or referrals to available training resources.
  
To be eligible for this position, candidates must possess the bilingual ability to speak fluently in English and Spanish.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
1. Serves as the first point of contact for customers seeking technical assistance over the phone or email. Will handle roughly 30-35 calls per day.
  
2. Performs remote troubleshooting through diagnostic techniques and pertinent questions.
  
3. Serves as a technical subject matter expert to internal and external customers.
  
4. Installs data uploading and integration tools through remote access of customers computer (EUT/Data pumps).
  
5. Walks customers through the technical problem-solving process.
  
6. Identifies sales lead opportunities to support revenue generation.
  
7. Directs unresolved issues through the escalation process, including providing status updates to customers.
  
8. Participates in project assignments including product launch support, identifying workflow efficiencies and revenue retention initiatives
  
Education
  
Requires a high school diploma or GED (General Educational Development).
  
Experience
  
Requires a minimum of one (1) year of educational training or work experience in the fields of business, computer information systems, customer support, operations, inventory, administration or sales. Must also be able to demonstrate the following skills and abilities:
  
* Moderate experience with Microsoft Outlook and Excel.
* Comfort working with computers (making changes in system folders, remote accessing customer computers and product troubleshooting).
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to input customer information into a CRM (Customer Relationship Management) system.
* Attention to detail when interacting with customer data and systems.


Special Position Requirements
  
* 100% remote (requires reliable internet access with a secure work environment).
* Must understand, write and fluently speak in the English language.
* Must be available to work company holidays if requested.


What makes working at OEC awesome? It varies from employee to employee. For some, it's the flexibility - whether it's remote work or a hybrid or in-person role, OEC takes our teams across multiple time zones and international communities. For others, it's the strong sense of camaraderie and community that celebrates both individuals and team-driven contributions. Or it could be the empowerment and how the team is encouraged to take risks, learn, and grow within a dynamic and supportive environment. But no matter what gets us out of bed in the morning, our whole global community is inspired to be forward thinking and drive innovative solutions for the automotive parts and repair industry.
  
  

OEConnection is subject to certain governmental recordkeeping and reporting requirements for the administration of civil rights laws and regulations. In order to comply with these laws, we invite applicants and employees to voluntarily self-identify their gender, race and ethnicity. Submission of this information is strictly voluntary and refusal to provide it will not subject you to any adverse treatment. The information obtained will be kept confidential and may only be used in accordance with the provision of applicable laws, executive orders, and regulations, including those that require the information to be summarized and reported to the federal government for civil rights enforcement. When reported, data will not identify any specific individual. This information will be maintained separately from your application for employment. If you do not wish to self-identify at this time, you may do so in the future by submitting this form. title: Commerce Automation Specialist II (Remote)
description:
#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.
About the Role:
This role is within CrowdStrike’s Commerce team, whose mission is to enable product-led growth through product trials and direct purchase.
The Commerce Automation Specialist II is an intellectually curious, action-oriented individual responsible for designing and managing workflows that move data through critical points of the buyer's journey.
In collaboration with teams in the eCommerce and Information Technology organizations, the Commerce Automation Automation Specialist II works to gather and implement data requirements for workflows that move data through critical points of the Commerce buyer’s journey. The technical and collaborative nature of this role necessitates problem solving and the willingness to gain an in-depth understanding of data systems alongside the ability to communicate with technical and non-technical team members.
What You'll Do:* Understanding Commerce attribution and operational analytics
* Understanding data engineering processes to manage Commerce data workflows that support data systems / integrations
* Understand data systems that support Commerce services to effectively troubleshoot automation issues
* Technical writing and documentation
* User acceptance testing for new features and fixes
* Communicating technical-level issues and understanding their importance in CrowdStrike’s Commerce business


What You’ll Need:* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration/Systems, Information Systems, Information Technology Management or a related field
* 2 - 3 years experience working with CRM software and integrated systems,
* Basic SQL skills for troubleshooting and data analysis
* Critical thinking, an astute attention to detail, and passion for knowing how systems work
* Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in multi-stakeholder projects
* Ability to efficiently context switch and communicate across disciplines


Bonus Points:* Startup experience
* Prior work managing integrations between data systems and designing data flows
* Issue and project tracking software experience (e.g., Jira); understanding of the software development and data lifecycle
* Project management experience
* Awareness of data management and data quality assurance best practices


#LI-AI1
#LI-Remote
Benefits of Working at CrowdStrike:* Remote-first culture
* Market leader in compensation and equity awards
* Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements
* Comprehensive and inclusive health benefits
* Physical and mental wellness programs
* Paid parental leave, including adoption
* A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities
* Offices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaboration


We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve.
CrowdStrike is committed to maintaining an environment of Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action. If you need reasonable accommodation to access the information provided on this website, please contact Recruiting@crowdstrike.com, for further assistance.
CrowdStrike participates in the E-Verify program.
Notice of E-Verify Participation
Right to Work
CrowdStrike, Inc. is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The base salary range for this position in the U.S. is $80,000 - $120,000 per year + variable/incentive compensation + equity + benefits. A candidate’s salary is determined by various factors including, but not limited to, relevant work experience, skills, certifications and location.
Expected Close Date of Job Posting is:05-05-2024

title: Data Warehousing Specialist
description:
**About Aleto**


Aleto is a startup company specializing in Federal property management.


Aleto is looking to hire someone who will grow with the company. Aleto offers paid vacation, full medical, vision, and dental insurance, and a 401(K) plan.


Aleto is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

**What we are looking for**


Aleto Inc. is seeking to hire a Data Warehousing Specialist at one of its Government Client sites in Washington, DC who will assist the client by managing and analyzing complex data sets to provide them with accurate and critical information to both internal and external users in a timely fashion.

**Selection Process**


If you are selected for an interview, Aleto will contact you to arrange for a meeting via an online platform, such as Google Meets. After all candidates are interviewed, Aleto will notify you of your status. The start date is immediate.

**Data Warehousing Specialist’s Essential Job Duties**


Duties include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

* Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses.
* Automate business requirements into SAS programs and support ad hoc requests.
* Optimize existing SAS/SQL code - Troubleshooting and automation of SAS and/or Python jobs and code.
* Create visualizations, Dashboard, user stories, and reports for requested projects.
* Develop and update technical documentation.
* Maintain/modify SAS/SQL program and/or configuration file changes based on documented requirements.
* Work with project teams to maintain and enhance source SAS code and process flows.
* Perform QA checks to ensure data integrity of reporting and dashboard solutions.
* Support complex Data Analytics and Business Intelligence projects in a Federal government environment.
* Assist in designing, developing, and maintaining a one-stop service center for scheduled and ad-hoc Geocoding requests.
* Facilitate the Automation and Execution of scheduled Data processes.
* Create and generate Data products and summary tabulations from multiple data sources.
* Help prepare Data Requirements, Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), and other technical documentation.
* Support modernization of program scripts for data manipulation and visualization.
* Participate in continuous data quality improvement and process streamlining efforts.

**Data Warehousing Specialist’s Qualifications/Capabilities/Software Knowledge**


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.


Qualifications/Education/Experience:

* Must be authorized to work in the United States
* Must be able to obtain a Public Trust Security Clearance
* Minimum of 3 years experience with a bachelor’s degree or minimum of 6 years' experience in a technical support role with demonstrated execution of tasks and projects relevant to Data Analytics, Data Science, and Business Intelligence.
* Experience in translating business requirements into a technical design for data products and Business Intelligence solutions.
* Prior experience with housing Data is a plus.


Technological Skills:

* Proficient in SAS required, Certifications in SAS desired.
* Experience with SAS EG, Familiarity with SAS Viya or SAS studio is a plus.
* Proficient in writing SQL Queries relational databases such as Oracle, MS SQL
* Proficient in Python is a plus.
* Experience in Tableau and Power BI is a plus.
* Knowledge of STATA and Geocoding is a plus
* Basic understanding of UNIX is a plus


Required Knowledge and Skills:

* Highly developed interpersonal and customer relationship management skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment (remote).
* Proven problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze situations, identify existing or potential problems, and recommend solutions.
* Ability to handle shifting and multiple priorities and demonstrate effective time management and organizational skills.
* Professional demeanor, strong work ethic, discrete, resourceful, and able to maintain confidentiality.

**What we offer**


Aleto is working for you.


Our company offers comprehensive benefits to employees who work 30 hours or more each week. A summary of benefits offered:

* **Medical, Vision, and Dental Insurance:**


Aleto employees are offered single, single-plus-one-dependent, or family medical, vision, and dental insurance plans.

* **Disability Insurance:**


Aleto offers company-paid short-term and long-term disability insurance.

* **Life Insurance:**


Aleto offers company-paid life insurance coverage.

* **Paid Time Off:**


Aleto’s paid time off includes eleven federal holidays. Full-time employees accrue PTO at the rate of 5 hours per pay period (120 hours per year).

* **Retirement Plan:**


Aleto offers full-time employees a 401(k) qualified retirement plan. Employees who have worked at least three months will be eligible to enroll in the plan on the 15th day of the month of the quarter following their hire anniversary date. The company will match 100% on the first 3% of the employee contribution, then match 50% of the next one-percent match of their contribution to the plan for a total of a 4% employer contribution.

**Environment and Physical Conditions**


The environmental factors and/or physical requirements of this position include the following: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to have ordinary ambulatory skills sufficient to visit other locations; and the ability to stand, walk, stoop, kneel, crouch, and manipulate (lift, carry, move) medium weights of at least 20 pounds. Requires arm, hand, and finger dexterity, including the ability to grasp, and visual acuity to use a keyboard. The employee frequently is required to be in one position for long periods of screen use, reach with hands and arms, and talk and hear both in person and over devices. The employee interacts in close spaces and frequently with other workers, vendors, and clients. May be in situations that require conflict resolution. The position works in an office environment with artificial light and air.


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the position.

**Pay:** $90,000 - $100,000 per year

title: Web Tester (contract)
description:
**Web Tester (Contract)**

 *Please note that this is a contract role providing services to Microsoft through external staffing partners of Allegis Global Solutions. If you are selected for this role, you will be employed by AGS and will not be an employee of Microsoft.*

 **Summary:**

The main function of a web tester is to develop, implement, and document all testing activities, including test planning, test documentation, test execution, defect tracking and reporting, including follow-up and issue resolution.

 **Job Responsibilities:**

* Execute test plans, scenarios, scripts or procedures.
* Test system modifications to prepare for implementation.
* Develop testing programs that addresses areas such as database impacts, software scenarios, or usability.
* Document software defects, using a bug tracking system, and report defects to software developers.
* Identify, analyze and document problems with program function, output, online screen or content.
* Monitor bug resolution efforts and track successes.
* Create or maintain databases of known test defects.
* Plan test schedules or strategies in accordance with project scope or delivery dates.

 **Requirements:**

* Associate's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required.
* 8-10 years experience required.
* Experience testing software.
* Experience writing test documentation such as Test Plans, scripts and test results reports.
* Ability to analyze/interpret test results and provide recommendations to improve testing.

 **Additional Details:**

* Location: Remote
* Duration: 3 months
* Pay Range: $21 - 23.50 per hour

 *AGS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer (M/F/Disability/Veterans). We will consider all applications without regard to race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law.*

title: Customer Implementation Specialist
description:
Dapt is seeking a detail-oriented and fast-learning Customer Implementation Specialist to join our team. In this role, you will report to our Head of Customer Success, and directly engage with clients, related stakeholders, and our internal product and development teams to ensure the delivery of our product as quickly and efficiently as possible while ensuring a positive customer experience. You should be a strong, confident communicator and diligent, creative problem-solver able to build rapport with customers and proactively resolve blocking issues in a timely manner.


While experience is valued, we prioritize critical thinking, a willingness to learn, and the ability to process information quickly to find opportunities for improvement.


Self-driven candidates with a curiosity for learning and a “can-do” attitude are strongly encouraged to apply.

*This is a fully remote (work-from-home) position.*

**Primary Responsibilities**

* Serve as the primary point of contact for customers, providing guidance and support throughout the payroll & accounting report delivery process
* Educate customers and related stakeholders on Dapt’s value proposition and capabilities, and the business problems we solve to benefit them directly
* Clarify customer requirements and work cross-organizationally to resolve all blocking issues quickly
* Collaborate with development teams to ensure the timely delivery of reports
* Maintain excellent customer relationships and ensure customer satisfaction
* Act as a liaison between customers and internal teams to ensure effective communication and seamless delivery
* Communicate and collaborate with external partners to gather necessary information and timelines for customer success

**Qualifications**

* 3+ years of experience in a customer-facing role preferred but willing to train the right person
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently and cross-functionally
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to handle multiple tasks and prioritize effectively
* Strong customer service orientation and commitment to customer success
* Ability to Stay Focused and Organized Independently
* Familiarity with project management and software development methodologies is a plus
* Broad industry knowledge with experience in payroll, time tracking, or accounting is a significant plus.

**Required Equipment**

* Dedicated computer w/ camera and microphone or headset
* Reliable internet connection
* Cell phone
* Quiet workspace

**About Us**  

We are a leading startup B2B SaaS solution for tracking job and project costs and have recently secured $1.6M in startup seed funding. Our simple yet robust job costing integration solution saves our clients time and effort by enabling a seamless flow from time tracking to payroll to accounting. We provide companies with the tools to simplify payroll and accounting, meet compliance requirements, and track what is needed to grow and run their business. Most importantly, we do all this without requiring our customers to change how they run their businesses. We adapt to their needs.

**Benefits**  

This is a fantastic opportunity to get in on the ground floor of an innovative and rapidly growing startup. Here are just some of the exciting and rewarding experiences we offer:

* Opportunities for growth and development: As an agile company, we’re open to new ideas and provide employees with additional responsibilities to grow within the company.
* Innovative culture: We dare say we’re the best at what we do. At the forefront of new technologies and business models, you’ll be exposed to cutting-edge ideas and practices.
* Collaborative environment: We boast a collaborative culture, where you’ll have the opportunity to work closely with teammates, partners, and customers to have a direct, measurable impact on the company's success.
* Flexibility: As a flexible and fully-remote company, we offer an outstanding work-life balance.
* Sense of ownership: Because we’re small but quickly growing, you’ll have the opportunity to take on essential projects and feel a greater sense of ownership and responsibility for the company's success.
* Work Location: Remote
* Paid vacation, holidays, and personal leave
* Medical, Dental and Vision Plan
* Tuition Assistance for qualified continuing education
* Ample opportunity for on-the-job learning




CsvSBX80iz

title: Customer Onboarding Specialist
description:
Spark Hire, Inc. is seeking a Customer Onboarding Specialist to help set our customers up for success through the implementation of our product offerings and best practices.

  

Spark Hire, Inc. is known for being the top rated video interviewing platform (based on G2.com reviews) and has recently expanded to become the most comprehensive and flexible hiring solution for small and medium sized organizations in the HR Recruiting Tech space. With the acquisitions of an ATS and Assessment platform, Spark Hire is a complete Talent Acquisition Suite designed to spark conversations between individuals to fill vital roles for organizations.

  

Reporting to the Manager of Customer Success, the Customer Onboarding Specialist will play a key role in ensuring that our users receive the highest level of service during their onboarding and training period. In addition, this role will aid in driving adoption of our product offerings during customers' initial journey with our Video Interview platform.

  

The target compensation for this position is $45-50k annually.

  


Requirements:  

  

**Core Competencies**


The ideal candidate will possess the following abilities:

* Communication - The ability to convey information clearly and effectively inside and outside of the organization to foster understanding and collaboration
* Project Management - Proficiency in effectively managing processes, tasks and resources to successfully implement systems and best practices.
* Relationship Building and Management - The ability to establish, nurture and maintain positive and productive relationships that fosters trust and collaboration
* Problem Solving - The capacity to troubleshoot issues and provide solutions quickly and efficiently to ensure successful outcomes
* Data Analysis and Reporting - The skill to analyze user data and feedback to identify trends and measure success in order to continuously improve and optimize the customer experience

**You may be a good fit if:**

* You have a college degree or similar advanced education
* You have 1+ year of experience working directly with customers
* You have excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
* Experience prioritizing projects for multiple customers at a time
* Experience with Salesforce or CRM is a plus
* Experience in a SaaS environment is a plus
* Experience in training is a plus

 **What You’ll Love About Spark Hire**

* Remote first environment - choose where you work with our remote-first work environment
* Health Benefits - Medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance that starts on day 1
* Flexible Time Off - Employees receive uncapped flexible time off accompanied by 11 paid holidays
* Work/Life Balance - We pride ourselves on having a great work/life balance
* 401(k) - Start saving for your future retirement

  

Spark Hire is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

  

We require all candidates that receive and accept employment offers to complete a background check before being hired.

  

Responsibilities:
  

* Partner with Sales to facilitate a smooth transition from the point of sale to the onboarding stage
* Provide live training for the customers via screen sharing technology
* Proactively identify barriers to success and take necessary steps to course correct
* Provide best practices to increase value and drive product adoption at each step in the process
* Collaborate with Customer Success team members to ensure the long term success of of every account
* Coordinate with team to implement integrations with our 40+ partner platforms
* Successfully transition onboarding customers to Customer Success Managers for further development.

title: Integration Support Specialist
description:
**Job Category:** Customer Service
  
**Requisition Number:** INTEG001496
  
  

Posting Details
  
**Posted:** March 4, 2024
  
Full-Time
  
Locations
  
Showing 1 location
  
Remote
  
Nashville, TN 37215, USA
  
  

Job Details
  
Description
  
  

**JOB TITLE:** Integration Support Specialist
  
  

**DEPARTMENT:** Support
  
  

**REPORTS TO:** Rocael Rueda
  
  

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:** No
  
  

**JOB LOCATION:** Remote
  
  

**TRAVEL:** < 5%>
  
  

**SUMMARY OF POSITION:**  

The integration support specialist is a key point of contact responsible for building long-lasting relationships with our ISV partners. This will require a strong individual who can take ownership and ensure we deliver the best in class experience for our partners. This individual will need to develop a good knowledge of our payment processing systems and capabilities to enable quick responses to partner inquiries. The integration support specialist will work across the organization to research and resolve issues related to new partner onboarding, troubleshoot any/all API related issues across all payment platforms and assist in integration related projects.
  
  

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

Develop a deep understanding of each partner’s unique business model and how they will integrate with i3 Verticals.
  
Create sandbox environment for new partners on i3 processing platforms.
  
Troubleshoot and correct any configuration issues on partner test and production accounts.
  
Perform terminal/device troubleshooting.
  
Work across the organization with a high degree of urgency to efficiently research and resolve issues and/or escalations, minimizing customer impact whenever possible.
  
Work with level 3 (development) to properly escalate identified and verified product bugs.
  
Utilize appropriate internal systems to document issues and resolutions to partners and their customers.
  
Contribute to knowledge content creation.
  
Be available to answer inbound phone calls, attend scheduled meetings, make outbound calls to assist partners during initial integration and ongoing.
  
Work inbound email ticketing system and respond to tickets within SLAs.
  
Assist in projects related to payment platform integration; run test transactions, run scripts, validate expected results, etc.
  
  

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS (EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE):**  

Two years experience in the Payments industry or a related field
  
High attention to detail
  
Ability to communicate clearly and professionally via phone and email
  
Ability to learn quickly and multi-task in a fast paced, ever changing environment
  
Must work well in a team environment
  
Intermediate math skills
  
Strong time management skills
  
Experience with Microsoft Office programs (Outlook, Excel, Word, etc.)
  
High school diploma or equivalent
  
  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment:**  

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these functions.
  
  

While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk and/or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands or fingers, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus. The noise level in the work environment is usually low to moderate.
  
  

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.
  
  

Qualifications
  
Education
  
Required
  
  

High School or better.

title: Integration Specialist (Project Management Office)
description:
**Who We Are:**  

Barrett Distribution Centers is a leader in providing customized third-party logistics, omni-channel distribution, and direct-to-consumer fulfillment services for customers in a variety of industries.
  
  

We are – more than anything else – a trusted consultant to our customers, working tirelessly to find solutions to their business challenges.
  
  

**Who We’re Looking For:**  

We’re always on the lookout for smart, hard-working, and skilled top performers who are interested in joining a fantastic team within a fast-growing company
  
If you’re great at what you do, passionate about doing it, and looking for a new home that rewards excellent work, effort, and collaboration, Barrett is the place for you!
  
  

**Why You’ll Love a Career at Barrett Distribution Centers:**  

* Health, dental, and vision insurance
* Opportunities for advancement – we love to promote from within!
* Ongoing training and leadership development
* Profit-sharing program – all employees benefit when the company succeeds!
* Competitive compensation
* Tuition reimbursement
* 401K savings plan with company match
* PTO
* A second-to-none culture where you’ll be treated like family and allowed to excel


**What You’ll Do:**  

You’ll consistently apply the following core values as you interact with people both inside and outside of our organization:
  
  

1. Always Better
  
2. Utmost Integrity
  
3. Dedication to the Customer
  
4. I am an Owner
  
5. Open and Honest Communication
  
  

You’ll be responsible for knowing and acting in accordance with Barrett’s vision to WOW our customers, partners, and fellow employees with every interaction.
  
  

**The Position:**  

The Integration Specialist, reporting to the Project Management Office (PMO) Sr. Director, is responsible for coding and configuring middleware data mapping, objects, and related processes between Barrett Distribution.
  
  

**Your Day-to-Day:**  

* Develop the code and processes to connect our Client’s retail trading partners to Barrett’s Cleo Clarify Integration system.
* Work collaboratively with the internal technical and project teams to define and develop unique solutions for complex technical challenges.
* Hold primarily responsibility for implementing new Cleo Clarify products and ensuring a seamless transition from legacy versions.
* Coordinate with Clients and internal teams to implement API interfaces, including integrating EDI with external ERP, ecommerce, and warehouse management systems (WMS), so that order, inventory, shipment, and other data flows effectively between all parties.
* Build SQL queries and stored procedures to assist in data capture.
* Create technical documentation such as data mappings, flow diagrams, test cases, and support documentation.
* Troubleshoot and debug code issues and incorporate those learnings into future work to steadily improve code quality.
* Track and report on status, challenges, risks, and opportunities to ensure internal and external teams are up to date and able to make the appropriate course corrections.
* Assist in defining and implementing agile best practices and project management methodologies for technology related projects and routine technical work.
* Follow PMO and IT best practices, standards, and policies and identify new ways of working more efficiently.
* Effectively use productivity and project management systems, such as ClickUp and Planview Clarizen, Visio, OneNote, Excel and Word for technical and status documentation.
* Thrives in a fast-paced, small team environment, with tight timelines and changing priorities.
* Perform other duties and projects as assigned.
* Ability to travel up to 10% of the time for Team Offsite Meetings, Customer Meetings, and Vendor events as needed.


**What You Bring to the Table:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Supply Chain Management, Information Technology, or similar subject area. 8+ years of equivalent work experience may be considered in leu of degree
* Certified Scrum Master (CSM), or SAFe certification preferred
* 3-5 years of progressively responsible experience in an Integration, EDI, or similar technical production or application development role.
* General experience with EDI and/or other data structures (Positional flat file or tilde delimited flat file, XML files)
* Demonstrated experience in the design, code, test, debug, document, and maintenance of moderately complex programs using Cleo products like, Harmony, Clarify 5 or Cleo Integration Cloud.
* SOAP/HTTP experience
* API development experience
* Strong SQL Skills, Oracle Platform preferred
* Experience with all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
* Analytical and detail oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
* Takes the initiative to research and resolve problems.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, able to translate complex concepts into terms and format appropriate for the audience.
* Must demonstrate high level of interpersonal skills with ability to work well under pressure and problem solve across a variety of business processes
* Able to balance competing priorities, complex situations, and tight deadlines. Strong emphasis on organizational skills and attention to detail


The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all job duties performed by the personnel so classified.
  
Barrett Distribution Centers is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, retaliation, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity/expression, mental or physical disability, genetic information, choice of health insurance, marital status, age, veteran status or any other basis protected by law.

title: Implementation and Support Specialist
description:
Purpose of this Position:

To support development of professional learning experiences and resources that support the implementation of curricula developed by Core Knowledge, and to provide consultation and support to existing and potential Core Knowledge schools and districts.

**Supervised By:**

Director of School Engagement and Partnerships

**Qualifications:**

· Bachelor’s Degree in elementary education (K – 8), instructional design, or related field preferred

· Three or more years of education experience

· Educational coaching or leadership experience at a Core Knowledge School a plus

· Understanding of Core Knowledge (CK) as an education reform movement, underlying theories and principles, and implementation at the school or district level

· Knowledge of one or more of the following educational program areas: general education at the preschool, elementary, or middle school level; education research; or educational guidance

· Knowledge of the theories and techniques involved in organizing education programs

· Knowledge of recent developments and current literature in the field of education

· Knowledge of best practice in instructional design

· Knowledge of techniques that support effective design and delivery of synchronous (i.e., webinars) and asynchronous (i.e., on-demand) training

· Knowledge of the principles and practices of evaluation and assessment

· Ability to provide consultative services to individual schools or districts

· Ability to speak effectively before large groups on topics related to the CK approach

· Ability to maintain records, prepare reports, and compose correspondence

· Knowledge (intermediate) and proficiency with word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation software. Familiarity with learning management systems is helpful

· Ability to address projects and issues with a detail-oriented perspective

· Ability to organize, coordinate, and manage multiple projects and deadlines

· Ability to speak and write clearly

Primary Responsibilities/General Duties (Including but not limited to):

**Implementation**

**Workshops, Presentations, and Online Learning**

· Serve as project support for internal and external development of new PL services developed by Professional Learning Manager

· Engage with learners participating in asynchronous or synchronous offerings

· Provide direction and any needed support to internal staff involved in the development of PL materials

· Ensure inclusion or integration of CK publications and products in professional development materials, as appropriate

· Serve as CK consultant delivering workshops

· Conduct presentations at the CK events and at national and state level conferences for education foundations and associations

**Professional Learning Events** 

· Support logistics, and space requirements for all CK events

· Support development and revision instructional materials related to events in order to maintain quality, address current research and trends, instructional strategies, and/or needs of CK schools

· Provide any needed additional support to trainers who deliver presentations at the CK events

· Answer Questions about Core Knowledge approach and curricula

o Respond to customer calls and emails inquiring about Core Knowledge curricula.

o Participate in conference calls with school and state representatives to discuss getting started with Core Knowledge

· Respond to telephone calls and e-mail requests for information regarding Core Knowledge professional development and products

· Consult with administrators and teachers to identify professional development needs and opportunities.

· Redirect calls/emails and notify appropriate staff members

o Transfer incoming calls to appropriate staff

o Alert Publication Sales and Warehouse team of customer order issues.

o Alert department heads or designated point person when specific customer communications and additional information are required.

**OTHER:**

· Occasional night and weekend work may be required.

· Travel required for consulting, school visits, and CK events; may involve traveling by plane, train, or automobile

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 3 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Technical Learning Operations and Knowledge Specialist
description:
We Are Hiring:* **Department:** Technology Business Operations
* **Schedule:** Full Time Monday - Friday 8-5pm CT
* **Location:** Remote


What You Will Do:
**Role Purpose**  

The Technical Learning Operations and Knowledge Specialist plays a key part in enhancing the technical competencies of our associates by developing and delivering training programs that align with our organization’s core values. You will be responsible for conducting training needs assessments, designing engaging curriculum and learning materials, and overseeing all aspects of training methodologies. Additionally you will play an integral role in supporting the enhancement and roll out of our ITIL Knowledge management processes. Your primary objective will be to help boost associate performance and drive professional growth within our organization. You will collaborate with various stakeholders to identify training needs and develop targeted solutions to address gaps. You will also be responsible for evaluating the effectiveness of training programs and recommending necessary adjustments to ensure continuous improvement.
Ideally, you should have a strong passion for learning and development, excellent instructional design skills, the ability to effectively communicate and engage with associates at all levels and familiarity with ITIL Knowledge Management.. Creativity, attention to detail and organizational abilities will be critical in delivering impactful training initiatives. **Functional Responsibilities*** Serves customers as a key point of contact. Manages customer expectations and ensures prompt and complete customer service. Forms productive networks with internal and external customers and the vendor community. Produces project plans, RFP's, and RFI's. Customizes presentations to the interests of the audience.
* Conducts diagnosis of most business problems. Designs, directs and performs analyses to resolve complex first-time project issues including analysis of technical and economic feasibility of proposed system solutions.
* Designs projects with broad implications requiring systems integration of one or more technical platforms. Leads design sessions by presenting logical statements of business problems and designs.
* Participates in the design of technical requirements for the application/solution.
* Serves as a staff resource and mentor regarding understanding of architectural systems.  

Participates in the development of programs that are AT specific and relevant to lines of business and corporate functions.
* Serves as subject matter expert as it relates to training content development and delivery processes.
* Assesses organizational or individual training needs.
* Translate requirements into trainings that will groom associates for the next step of their career path.
* Build annual certification program for AT-Specific processes.
* Evaluates effectiveness of training programs and proactively identifies opportunities for improvement.
* Coordinates training deployment activities for Ascension Technologies.
* Develop or oversee the production of training content and delivery using different learning methodologies.
* Direct structured learning experiences and monitor results  

Acclimate new hires to the the organization and lead orientation sessions.
* Assess training effectiveness to ensure incorporation of taught skills and techniques into daily work behavior.
* Periodically evaluate ongoing programs to ensure that they stay current.
* Stay abreast of the new trends, tools and technology in associate development.

**Leadership/Interpersonal Skills*** Begins to influence department’s strategy
* Makes decisions on moderately complex to complex issues regarding technical approach for project components and completion of own tasks/responsibilities of substantial complexity
* Often operates in ambiguous situations
* Identifies areas for possible improvements and proactively addresses problems within scope of responsibility
* Work is performed without direction. Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments
* Normally receives little instruction on day-to-day work, general instructions on new assignments. Often determines methods/approach to work/projects and establishes own work priorities and timelines
* Work is evaluated upon completion to ensure that results and objectives have been met
* Regularly makes recommendations on new processes, tools and services that can impact multiple projects and other functions
* Majority of contact is within own function or family and collaboration with peer-level professionals outside of own function, family or organization
* Models/mentors and teaches staff within own function or family
* Serves as project/technical lead for ongoing process or short-term project within function or family

**Work Experience*** 3 years of experience preferred
* 3+ years in Education, Training, HR or related field.
* Experience in ITIL ITSM processes, particularly Knowledge management preferred
* Extensive knowledge of instructional design theory and learning principles
* Familiarity with traditional and modern training methods, tools and techniques
* Healthcare and/or IT provider industry experience is helpful
* Adequate knowledge of learning management software
* Proficiency in Google and training design software (i.e. Articulate)
* Demonstrated presentation skills and audience engagement  

Ability to influence and communicate effectively with stakeholders
* Drives continuous improvement

**Complexity of Work*** Within scope of job, requires critical thinking skills, decisive judgment and the ability to work with minimal supervision. Must be able to work in a stressful environment.
* With limited guidance, responsible for working on moderately complex assignments/projects
* Regularly exercises independent judgment on matters of significance including making recommendations on management


What You Will Need:

Education:* High School diploma equivalency with 2 years of cumulative experience OR Associate's degree/Bachelor's degree OR 4 years of applicable cumulative job specific experience required.


Additional Preferences:

#LI-Remote
Why Join Our Team:

When you join Ascension, you join a team of over 134,000 individuals across the country committed to a Mission of serving others and providing compassionate, personalized care to all. Our inclusive culture, continuing education programs, career coaches and benefit offerings are just a few of the resources and tools that team members can use to create a rewarding career path. In fact, Ascension spent nearly $46 million in tuition assistance alone to support associate growth and development. If you are looking for a career where you can grow and make a difference in your community, we invite you to join our team today.
Equal Employment Opportunity Employer:

Ascension will provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all associates and applicants for employment regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship, gender, sexual orientation, gender identification or expression, age, disability, marital status, amnesty, genetic information, carrier status or any other legally protected status or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.  

For further information, view the EEO Know Your Rights (English) poster or EEO Know Your Rights (Spanish) poster.  

As a military friendly organization, Ascension promotes career flexibility and offers many benefits to help support the well-being of our military families, spouses, veterans and reservists. Our associates are empowered to apply their military experience and unique perspective to their civilian career with Ascension.
