title: Project Management Specialist (PMS) (Remote)
description:
**\\*\\*The Project Management Specialist (PMS) position can be home based anywhere within the United States\\*\\***



The Stanford Cancer Institute (SCI) is one of an elite number of National Cancer Institute-Designated Comprehensive Cancer Centers in the country, and is a prominent, dynamic, growing and complex Institute within the Stanford University School of Medicine. The SCI actively works to build synergies and collaborations among faculty with cancer-relevant expertise from four Schools and over 30 departments across Stanford University. We seek a Project Management Specialist to help us enact our mission to reduce cancer mortality through comprehensive programs of cancer research, treatment, education and outreach. Given the SCI’s mission, breadth, and depth, it employs over 320 staff members in a fast-paced, team-oriented, and forward-thinking environment with tremendous opportunities for personal and professional growth. The Cancer Clinical Trials Office (CCTO) is an integral component of the Stanford Cancer Institute since the vital work performed there enables our adult and pediatric cancer centers to translate research from the laboratory into the clinical setting. You will be working with an unparalleled leading-edge community of faculty and staff who are fundamentally changing the world of health care in the cancer arena.



Reporting to Clinical Research Manager for Blood and Marrow transplantation (BMT), the Project Management Specialist will be conversant in the goals, mission and priorities of the Institute, and utilize this knowledge to oversee the study-start-up of our CRG clinical trials and data quality. We are seeking candidates with excellent both written and verbal communication skills and able to follow through with specifically assigned deliverables. Our staff run toward challenges, and you will have a demonstrated history of doing the same with a high degree of professionalism, initiative, and flexibility. Responsibilities include managing activities of assigned projects from project initiation through completion with limited guidance and coordinating all technical activities on assigned projects.



**Duties include:**



* Review project plans and proposals, and work with management to develop project objectives; identify project responsibilities by determining the phases and elements of the project; calculate time frames and sequence the stages of the project.
* Perform project management oversight of small projects or more than one large task within a larger project.
* Oversee, coordinate, and perform technical aspects of project, with guidance, based on type of project manager support required (e.g., engineer, quality, scheduler).
* Review, evaluate, approve, and monitor cost schedule and technical scope baselines.
* Ensure the preparation of required project documentation.
* Contribute to communication plan and change management elements.


* *- Other duties may also be assigned.*



**DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:**



* Knowledge of oncology.
* Familiarity with IRB guidelines and regulations.


**EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE (REQUIRED):**



Bachelor's degree in a related field and two years relevant experience or a combination of education and experience.



**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES (REQUIRED):**


* Polished written and oral communication skills to address a wide variety of audiences.
* Ability to productively contribute to cross-functional teams.
* Depth of knowledge in technical discipline/domain needed to deliver projects.
* Demonstrated project management ability to employ integration, scope time management, cost, quality, human resources, communications, and risk identification.
* Have a thorough knowledge of clinical research concepts, practice, FDA regulations and ICH Guidelines regarding clinical trial development and data management methods.
* In depth knowledge of medical terminology related to the relevant clinical trial.

  


  

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS\\*:**



* Frequently sit, perform desk based computer tasks, grasp lightly/fine manipulation and lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds.
* Occasionally stand/walk, write by hand, twist/bend/stoop/squat and lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh up to 20 pounds.
* Rarely use a telephone, kneel, crawl, climb ladders, reach/work above shoulder, grasp forcefully.


* *- Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.*

  


  

**WORKING CONDITIONS:**



* May be exposed to extreme hot and cold temperatures, be exposed to high voltage electricity, radiation or electromagnetic fields, lasers, noise > 80dB TWA, allergens/biohazards/chemicals /asbestos, or heavy metals or work on roofs at heights greater than 10 ft.
* Travel locally and cross-university.

  

  

**WORK STANDARDS:**



* When conducting university business, must comply with the California Vehicle Code and Stanford University driving requirements.
* Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.
* Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.
* Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University's Administrative Guide, http://adminguide.stanford.edu.


*This role is open to candidates anywhere in the United States. Stanford University has five Regional Pay Structures. The compensation for this position will be based on the location of the successful candidate.*

  

*The expected pay range for this position is $72,000 to $110,000 per annum.*

*Stanford University provides pay ranges representing its good faith estimate of what the university reasonably expects to pay for a position.* *The pay offered to a selected candidate will be determined based on factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilities of the position, the qualifications of the selected candidate, departmental budget availability, internal equity, geographic location and external market pay for comparable jobs.*

title: CloudCheckr Specialist
description:
**Job Title:** CloudCheckr Specialist
**Shift:** First, Monday through Friday
**Status:** Full-Time, Exempt
**Job Summary:**
We are seeking a CloudCheckr Specialist to join our Cloud Operations team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for optimizing cloud costs, providing insights and reporting on cloud usage, and ensuring effective cloud management practices. This role involves close collaboration with internal finance, operations, and technology teams, and external cloud service providers.
We offer a dynamic work environment with opportunities for professional growth and development. Join our team and contribute to optimizing our cloud operations and financial efficiency.
**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and generate reports to track cloud usage, costs, and optimization efforts.


* Understand and apply chargeback models in the cloud environment to allocate costs accurately.


* Manage cloud cost views, user permissions, and account configurations based on specific requirements.


* Automate billing processes, including monthly invoice generation and custom charge configurations.


* Provide training and support to end-users on CloudCheckr functionalities and best practices.


* Collaborate with internal teams to drive cost optimization initiatives, including analyzing usage patterns, recommending cost-saving changes, and negotiating with cloud service providers.


* Develop financial models for cloud cost forecasting and tracking, and support the monthly cloud budgeting and forecasting process.


* Monitor and analyze cloud consumption to identify and address anomalies or spikes in usage.


* Contribute to business case development, cost modeling, and TCO analyses.


* Develop and maintain Power BI reports, dashboards, and data models, ensuring compatibility with data warehouse standards.


* Integrate analytical tools into applications and develop custom visuals as required.


* Maintain up-to-date knowledge on data analytics trends and tools, including proficiency in scripting languages for automation purposes (e.g., PowerShell, bash).


* Work closely with the accounting and finance departments to align cloud costs with business objectives.


* Ensure CloudCheckr configurations comply with security policies and customer requirements, and regularly update documentation for internal processes.


**Required Skills and Qualifications:**
* Proven experience with AWS CloudCheckr or similar cloud cost management tools.


* Strong understanding of cloud computing principles, including IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, and various cloud architectures.


* Experience in financial modeling, cost analysis, and budget management related to cloud services.


* Proficiency in data analytics and reporting tools such as Excel, Tableau, and Power BI, including experience with data source integration.


* Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively across different departments and with external partners.


* Knowledge of scripting languages (e.g., PowerShell, bash) for automation purposes.


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Finance, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.


**Preferred Skills:**
* Experience in negotiating cloud service contracts and pricing.


* Architectural experience in developing reporting solutions.


* Familiarity with database and data warehousing standards.


**Physical Demands**  

  

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform successfully the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this job. Work is primarily performed in an office environment. Regularly required to sit. Regularly required use hands to finger, handle, or feel, reach with hands and arms to handle objects and operate tools, computer, and/or controls. Required to speak and hear. Occasionally required to stand and walk. Exposed to general office noise with computers, printers, and light traffic.
**Screening requirements:** Background Check, Drug Screen  

**Benefits:** Medical Insurance, Dental Insurance, Life Insurance, Vision Insurance, Long-term and Short-term Disability Insurance, 401(k) Plan, FSA Dependent Care Assistance, Paid Vacation Days, Paid Sick Days, Paid Holidays
**Other Benefits:** Employee outings each year, dog-friendly corporate office, wellness incentives, referral bonuses

title: Senior-Level Work-From-Home Customer Service Specialist
description:
Are you ready to embark on a rewarding journey of empowering small business owners while building a successful career from the comfort of your home? Join **Contractor In Charge,** a leading trades contractor company, as our **full-time Senior-Level Work-From-Home Customer Service Specialist**.


Not only will you enjoy a **competitive pay range** **of** **$16-$19 per hour, depending on experience** but you'll also have the opportunity to make a real impact in the lives of entrepreneurs. Additionally, you'll enjoy **great benefits and perks**, including affordable health benefits, an IRA retirement plan, PTO, paid holidays, and flexible work hours. Additionally, we invest in both formal and informal learning development opportunities.

 **WHAT SETS US APART**


Our mission is to help small business owners in the home service trades to understand and know their financials and bookkeeping is being managed and maintained with the highest standards. Our staff has a high degree of experience in the electrical, plumbing, HVAC, and other home service industries-and offers their knowledge to help increase our client's understanding of their business performance. In the industry, we are known for our professionalism and knowledge of the scheduling software and accounting integrations. Our clients are good at what they do, knowing their trades inside and out-and, we let them focus on that by doing the rest for them!


Giving our clients this peace-of-mind requires that we have a skilled and reliable team of our own. In order to attract and retain the best, we offer competitive pay, flexible schedules, and remote work-from-home opportunities.

 **YOUR TYPICAL DAY**


As a seasoned Senior-Level Customer Service Specialist, your wealth of experience in call center operations, customer service, CRM utilization, scheduling software management, and inside sales further enriches your role. You effortlessly embody the qualities of a dynamic learner, demonstrating a keen willingness to adapt and embrace change. Your meticulous attention to detail and impeccable attendance record form the bedrock of your dependability, instilling confidence in our team's reliance on your support. Your commitment to honing your skills and expertise is evident, driven by a resolute focus on building a long-term and thriving career.


Rooted in empathy, your interactions consistently provide our clients with unparalleled care. Your adept communication skills foster a collaborative environment, reaching across colleagues, management, and customers. Exceptional listening skills, coupled with mastery of call control and de-escalation techniques, mark your proficiency in handling customer interactions. Your decision-making prowess, aimed at both client satisfaction and company objectives, is further complemented by your knack for efficient task handling. Even in your commitment to maintaining a reliable private internet connection, your dedication to seamless and uninterrupted service shines through. Your multifaceted abilities seamlessly intertwine, bolstering both individual and collective success within the team.

 **MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS TO BE CONSIDERED:**


To be considered for this exciting opportunity, you should meet the following minimum requirements:

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Typing speed of 50+ WPM along with high-level computer skills
* 3+ years of call center experience with high call volume
* 3+ years of customer service experience in the home service industry (HVAC, plumbing, or electrical), or a similar industry
* Minimum of 1 year of inside sales experience
* An average of 90% or higher QA/KPI scores
* Experience with CRM and scheduling software


Preferred qualifications:

* Previous experience in complex work environments
* Managerial experience

 **SCHEDULE**


This is a full-time, remote position. Enjoy the flexibility of working from home while staying connected with our team and clients!

 **WE WANT TO HEAR FROM YOU!**


Ready to take the next step in your career? Apply now with our quick 3-minute, mobile-friendly initial application. Join our mission to empower small business owners and make a lasting impact in the trades contractor industry. We can't wait to welcome you to our team!

  

12012023CIC

title: Help Desk Specialist
description:
**Job Description**

Join us at ProviderSoft! We are a web-based commercial SaaS company serving clients in the Early Childhood Development field, including Early Intervention, Preschool, and ABA programs.

As a Help Desk Specialist at ProviderSoft, you will be working to ensure that our Clients can successfully use our software system on an immediate basis.

You will need to be intimately familiar with how it is our Clients operate and interact with our software. You’ll be making sure that Clients make use of new and existing functionality to meet their workflow needs. You will be able to work in partnership with Clients to help answer system and workflow questions and assist Clients in achieving their goals within the system. You will be responsible for researching potential issues reported, and providing quick and thorough responses.

Working with our business analysts and developers alike, you’ll be applying your knowledge of the system and our customer’s needs and operations to provide personal, exemplary customer service.

**Responsibilities**

* Provide exemplary customer service to Clients via phone and email
* Create video and wiki materials to aid in the support of all Clients
* Provide and solicit User feedback for new features of the system
* Learn and utilize the internal case management tool for all Client Support
* Assist Client Services Department to implement and communicate with new and ongoing Clients
* Assist Development Department by seeking feedback from Clients on new products and features and communicating system and usability issues
* Assist QA Department by testing interfaces and new development

**Requirements**

* Bachelor's degree preferred, preferable in a related field
* Experience in software support specifically
* Understanding of business requirements and the ability to translate these into functional and efficient support for Clients
* Demonstrate a Customer Service focus and attitude, and good interpersonal skills while maintaining professionalism
* Self-starter with ambition who wants to help grow the company and eventually be considered for an Account Manager role
* Computer and software savvy: familiarity with multiple programs, browsers, recording and screen sharing tools, etc.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
* Attention to detail; willingness to wear multiple hats
* Extreme discipline in working in a telecommuting environment; ability to work independently in an effective and productive manner
* Must have a working computer with reliable and speedy internet connection

**Location**

Your home! ProviderSoft's regular office is a virtual network; we are fully remote. Each member of the team works from home communicating via Teams and coordinating with online project management tools.

If this sounds like your ideal position, send us your resume and cover letter!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40,000.00 - $45,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 2 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Help Desk: 2 years (Required)

* SaaS: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Cimplifi | Seeking Junior IT Support Assoc, Temp to Perm @ $20/hr
description:
Cimplifi is a leading integrated legal services provider, leveraging technology and expertise to simplify the experience of eDiscovery and Contract Analytics for corporate legal departments and law firms. For more than two decades, clients have relied on our expertise and ingenuity to solve complex challenges, bring innovative solutions, and deliver intelligence and insight to help them manage risk, control costs, and get more done, more effectively, and with far less effort and stress.

**POSITION OVERVIEW**

Under the direction and supervision of the Support Operations Manager, the Support Associate assists users with accessing our SSO system and various review platforms, as well as assists with user management in preparation of projects and asset deployment. We are looking for someone who enjoys helping others and being part of a team. Being self-motivated and analytical is vital to this role. An ideal candidate will have the desire to help our clients get their IT issues and questions resolved quickly and accurately. This is a contract remote work position with 40 hour/week schedule, requiring a dedicated workspace allowing for audio and video conferencing on-demand. **Hours will be in Pacific Time Zone but position is fully remote.**

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**

In this capacity, the Support Associate:

* Acts as the point of contact to external users and vendors for various types of support requests;
* Prepares/disables access credentials in anticipation of scheduled projects;
* Assists in asset management, including laptop ordering, tracking, and facilitating returns;
* Performs remote troubleshooting;
* Assists in general administrative email intake and support ticket management.

**EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, AND SKILLS REQUIRED**

* 1-3 years General computer/helpdesk & remote troubleshooting of Microsoft Suite and Citrix applications
* Ability to work fully remote while fulfilling duties well and on time, being accountable to other team members, and keeping them informed
* Excellent verbal, written, and organizational skills with the ability to communicate effectively in a high- paced environment
* Willingness to collaborate with other team members and supervisors to troubleshoot and resolve reported issues in a timely manner
* Strong desire to learn and grow (a growth mindset)
* Adaptability and the inclination to learn new technologies and workflows

**CIMPLIFI CORE VALUES:**

Our Core Values serve as the guiding principles behind all services we deliver. A Cimplifi employee is…

* **Courageous:** We back our best practices with integrity and ethics, making our employees resilient and able to drive honest conversations, and engage in problem-solving in the face of adversity.
* **Reliable:** We consistently respond faster, work harder, think smarter, and work collaboratively to support our clients’ needs, building trust and dependability.
* **Inventive:** We are proactive and resourceful original thinkers, we are capable of creating innovative solutions, and delivering time-tested results due to our training, skills, and industry knowledge.
* **Adaptable:** We are nimble, eager, and prepared for the challenges facing our clients, allowing us to be flexible and responsive to client needs.

Job Types: Contract, Temp-to-hire

Pay: $20.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Health insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Help desk: 1 year (Required)
* Windows: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Digital Advertising Specialist
description:
**Job Title: Digital Advertising Specialist**

**Job Type:** Part-time (1099)

**Hours Per Week:** 10

**Pay**: Hourly depending on experience

**Overview:**

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Digital Advertising Specialist with at least 3 years of experience. The successful candidate will be able to show proof of their success managing and optimizing Google and Microsoft Ads as well as Meta advertising.

**Responsibilities:**

· **Weekly Google and Meta Advertising Optimization:**

o Analyze and optimize PPC and social campaigns.

o Implement strategic adjustments to improve key performance indicators (KPIs)

o Merge best practices for campaign optimization with our established systems for managing niche-market campaigns

· **Monitoring Campaign Budgets:**

o Keep a close eye on campaign budgets to ensure effective allocation and adherence to financial targets.

o Provide insights and recommendations for budget adjustments based on performance data.

· **Identifying Updates or Changes Needed to Campaigns:**

o Proactively identify areas for improvement in ongoing campaigns and propose actionable changes.

o Stay updated on industry trends and platform updates to implement cutting-edge strategies.

· **Setting up and Prepping Campaign Structures:**

o Audience and keyword research, landing page direction, campaign set-up, audience targeting and goal tracking, A/B testing, management of ad budgets, and optimizing for conversions and KPIs.

· **Setting up Meta and Google Ad Accounts:**

o Establish Meta ad accounts and Google ad accounts as needed for new campaigns.

o Ensure proper configuration and integration with other marketing tools and platforms.

· **Monitoring Client Dashboards for Report Accuracy:**

o Regularly review client dashboards to ensure accuracy and reliability of reporting data.

o Address any discrepancies promptly and communicate effectively with internal stakeholders.

· **Prepping Existing Campaigns for Creative Updates:**

o Collaborate with creative teams to prepare existing campaigns for creative updates.

o Ensure seamless integration of new creative into live campaigns.

· **Collaboration with Digital Marketing Manager:**

o Work closely with the Digital Marketing Manager to address any unexpected updates or challenges in ongoing campaigns.

o Maintain open communication and collaborate on strategic decisions to enhance overall campaign performance.

**Professional Competencies:**

· Exceptional quantitative / analytical skills

· Ability to manage multiple accounts and tasks with effective resolution of conflicting priorities

· Ability to communicate professionally via both online platforms and video call

· Must be a team player that is also comfortable working independently

· Driven, forward-thinking individual with the ability to come up with creative digital advertising solutions

· Adaptive to change, flexible

· Positive attitude and team spirit

· Experience in B2B marketing is a plus

· Experience managing campaigns for niche markets is a plus

· Experience with campaigns for luxury consumer products is a plus

**Qualifications:**

· Minimum of 3 years of experience in Google Search advertising.

· Minimum of 3 years of experience in Social Media advertising.

· Experience working in a marketing agency (employee or contract) is preferred.

· Relevant Google Ads certification a plus.

· In-depth knowledge of both Google Ads Editor and Meta Business Manager.

· Proficient in Google Analytics (GA4), Google Data Studio, and/or other comparable data analytics and visualization tools.

· Demonstrated ability to present metrics and explain what is working (and what isn’t).

· Proven track record of successful campaign management and optimization.

· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

· Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

· Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.

If you meet these qualifications and are passionate about driving digital marketing success, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $16.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: No more than 10 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Bookkeeping Specialist
description:
**About Us**

Bookkeeping For Painters is a bookkeeping, tax, and automation firm that has worked exclusively with painting business owners in the United States and Canada since 2016. Our goal is to become the foremost organization exclusively committed to delivering superior accounting services to painting business owners. We consistently provide reliable guidance and innovative strategies to positively impact our clients and the painting industry at large. We prove ourselves to be trusted advisors by helping transform painting businesses using real-time data and smart strategies.

**Compensation:**

* $22-32 Hourly
* 80 hours of Vacation/PTO
* 13 Paid Holidays
* Simple IRA with up to 3% match
* Health Reimbursement (QSEHRA) up to $297/month
* Bonus Opportunities

**Job Overview:**  
Senior Bookkeeping Specialists exhibit a high level of technical proficiency and have the ability to take on more complex client accounts, act as a resource in developing bookkeeping specialists, and may accept advanced bookkeeping projects as opportunities present. This position is a high-touch client support role that entails frequent coordination and collaboration between clients and the Bookkeeping For Painters team.

**Senior Bookkeeping Specialist Duties:**

* Showcase your expertise in maintaining “higher complexity” rated client accounts, which often include weekly update cycles and addressing special client considerations
* Utilize your exceptional skills in A/R or A/P functions to handle specialty client requests with ease and efficiency
* Lead client onboarding or clean-up projects with minimal oversight, demonstrate your ability to take ownership and drive successful outcomes
* Share your knowledge and assist other bookkeeping specialists as they develop their technical capabilities.
* Perform the highest level of Quality Control, executing the "Quarterly" or "Final" Quality Control process with precision.
* Provide insightful and corrective feedback during the QC process to the bookkeeping team helping them enhance their bookkeeping production and identify areas for improvement regarding bookkeeping production and areas of improvement
* Provide insight into client accounts as they pertain to operations considerations, including feedback on difficulty level or special considerations
* Showcase your talent in providing “Client Training” in QBO functions on a per-project basis, tailoring your approach to meet each client's specific needs
* Speciality Knowledge or Accreditation in associated softwares or processes as they relate to bookkeeping production

**Bookkeeping Specialist Responsibilities and Duties:**

**Day-to-Day responsibilities**

In your day-to-day role, you will engage in professional and respectful interactions with clients and team members, expertly coordinate information requests through various channels, and skillfully manage client expectations to ensure their satisfaction.

* Proactively monitor and respond to communication channels daily to ensure timely and effective communication with clients and staff.
* Serve as the primary point of contact, answering the main phone line during set hours and addressing inquiries and requests professionally and promptly

**Weekly responsibilities**

* Clear bank feeds weekly by end-of-day Friday for monthly clients, ensuring accurate and up-to-date financial records.
* Clear bank feeds and reconcile by weekly due dates for weekly clients, maintaining accuracy in financial transactions.
* Clear receipt management system by end-of-day Friday for monthly clients, organizing and recording financial documents.
* Complete job costing process weekly for all clients, performing quality check job costing 2 days prior to client meeting

**Quality Check Protocols**

* Complete self quality control process on time, accurately, and efficiently
* Collaborate with the team to complete the team quality control process on time,

maintaining high standards of accurately, and efficiently

**Communication standards:**

* Demonstrate Professional Written & Verbal communication
* Respectful dialogue with clients and team members
* Coordinating requests for information in a clear and understandable manner, through multiple channels (email, text, phone, task management systems) ensuring effective communication
* Coordinate with clients via phone or zoom meetings as needed, providing exceptional customer service and addressing client needs.
* Assign tasks to clients and team members in a professional and easy-to-understand manner, facilitating smooth workflow and task management.
* Effectively communicating client concerns or requests to internal staff in a timely and respectful way, ensuring seamless collaboration.
* Be mindful of preferred client communication channels and times, adapting
* communication methods to align with client preferences.
* “Actively listening” to client concerns and needs in order to effectively respond, demonstrating empathy and understanding.
* Ability to assess client needs and direct them to appropriate resources or staff for additional assistance
* Effectively communicating client concerns or requests to internal departments
* Managing client expectations as communicated by production and operations teams
* Complete department forms and reports consistently with detail
* Assess client needs and direct them to appropriate resources or staff

**Financial Analysis**

* Have a working knowledge and understanding of financial reports (P&L, Balance Sheet, Statement of Cash Flows, AR & AP Agings Summary)
* Review and analyze financial statements prior to meetings with clients and check for accuracy
* Side-saddle client meetings as needed
* Take notes during meetings, complete after-meeting reports consistently with detail, and proactively follow-up with clients and internal teams as needed
* Prepare reports on time, reviewing the financial information for accuracy
* Prepare Financial Video Reviews

**Skills & Qualifications**

* Problem-solving skills to include analysis, creativity, prioritization, organization, and troubleshooting
* A natural curiosity and a “big picture” mentality
* Basic knowledge and understanding of Financial Accounting
* Basic knowledge and understanding of personal and business tax
* Basic knowledge of payroll and understanding of how to troubleshoot
* Quickbooks Proadvisor Required, Advanced Preferred

**Experience**

* Quickbooks Online
* Quickbooks Desktop (Preferred)
* Clean-up (Preferred)
* Dext
* Bill.com
* Keeper
* Gusto Payroll
* 3rd Party Software Integrations with QBO
* Minimum 3 years experience in bookkeeping and accounting

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $22.00 - $32.00 per hour

Expected hours: 35 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off
* Paid training

Experience level:

* 3 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Language:

* English (Required)

License/Certification:

* Quickbooks Proadvisor Certification (Required)
* QuickBooks Online Advanced Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Finance Systems Specialist
description:
Overview / About us:

Lumanity is dedicated to improving patient health by accelerating and optimizing access to medical advances. We partner with life sciences companies around the world to generate evidence to demonstrate the value of their product, translate the science and data into compelling product narratives, and enable commercial decisions that position these products for success in the market. We do this through strategic and complimentary areas of focus: Asset Optimization and Commercialization, Value, Access, and Outcomes, Medical Strategy and Communications, and Real-World Evidence.  


Responsibilities / Position overview:

We are seeking a finance professional/business analyst to join our team as our Finance Systems Specialist, supporting and optimizing our recently implemented ERP. As the Finance Systems Specialist, you will be responsible for ensuring the effective use of the ERP and other integrated systems. You will serve as the subject matter expert and operational lead of our primary finance systems; NetSuite, NetSuite Planning and Budgeting (Oracle NCPB), and PowerBI, and drive process improvements by supporting, guiding, training, and recommending system and process changes to improve internal controls and drive efficiencies within the finance function.  

As a member of the Enterprise Applications Group, you will work closely with our finance teams and other stakeholders to understand the business needs and develop and implement solutions and best practices for using our financial systems and improving overall finance and business processes. You will support process re-engineering, identifying and deploying new business applications and integrations and assist the Systems Administrator with upgrades and enhancements to existing applications. In this functional-technical role, you are expected to be detail-oriented, analytically driven, and a self-starter **Key responsibilities include:** **Business Process Analysis:*** Partner with the finance team to provide technical solutions to identified business process improvements and enable the finance team to garner greater value from the systems.
* Leverage your financial systems expertise to enable the finance team to achieve their desired outcomes.

**Financial System Configuration and Customization:*** Utilize your in-depth knowledge of NetSuite's financial modules and NetSuite Planning and Budgeting (NSPB) to configure and customize the platform according to business needs.
* Design and implement solutions for financial reporting, forecasting, budgeting, and other relevant activities.
* Support the central and business unit finance teams to leverage NetSuite's reporting capabilities to provide financial reports and dashboards.

**End-User Training and Support:*** Provide training and support to end-users, ensuring they have a clear understanding of system functionalities and are proficient in utilizing the system for their financial tasks.
* Provide financial system and financial reporting expertise to internal client groups through group presentations, demonstrations, training, and one-on-one meetings.

**Requirements Gathering and Implementation:*** Work closely with stakeholders to gather emerging business requirements and translate them into functional specifications for financial system configurations and customizations.
* Advise internal stakeholders on system limitations and alternate solutions to achieve business objectives.
* Maintain existing workflows, business rules, and administrative functions within the financial systems.
* Document and maintain financial system data process flows and related documentation.

**Change Management:*** Facilitate the adoption of new processes and system changes by effectively communicating with stakeholders, managing user expectations, and ensuring a smooth transition.
* Evaluate solutions to address internal client requirements and develop recommendations.
* Assist internal clients to create selection criteria and manage selection processes.
* Design and implement user-acceptance-testing programs for new or enhanced processes and systems.

**Continuous Improvement:*** Stay updated on NetSuite's latest features and enhancements.
* Proactively identify opportunities for process enhancements and system optimizations.
* Partner with internal stakeholders to determine the best usage for identified improvement opportunities to maximize ROI.
* Regularly check with internal stakeholders that delivered projects met stated requirements.

  


Qualifications:
* Bachelor’s degree in related area required, Master’s degree preferred.
* 6-10 years of experience (at least 3 years each in Accounting/Finance and Financial Systems)
* Financial Systems experience related to NetSuite, NSPB, and Power BI.
* Proven experience working with NetSuite financial modules and NSPB for order to cash, procure to pay, record to report, multi-book accounting, and financial planning activities.
* Experience working in a matrixed environment and within multifunctional teams.
* Strong knowledge of accounting and financial planning concepts.
* The ability to motivate and inspire a team.


Benefits:

We offer our employees a comprehensive benefits package that focuses on what matters to you – health and well-being, personal finances, professional development, and a healthy work/life balance:

* Competitive salary plus bonus scheme
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance options
* 401(k) plan with employer match
* Flexible paid time off program + 10 paid holidays
* Flexible spending accounts for health and dependent care
* Health savings account option with employer contribution
* Employee Assistance Program
* Paid short-term and long-term disability coverage
* Company-paid life insurance coverage at 1.5x annual salary
* Paid parental leave and more

  


-:
*Employees can expect to be paid a salary between $135,000-$150,000 The salary range is merely an estimate and may vary based on an applicant’s location, skills, prior experience, professional qualifications, and other relevant factors.*

title: Vehicle Appraiser Expert for Total Loss and Diminished Value Report Software
description:
We have developed a software that can generate a Diminished Value Report and a Fair Market Value Report in 1-5 minutes.

It includes Kelley Blue Book integration, a thorough market analysis of comparable vehicles, and an automated Repair Estimate analysis.

It is a tool being used by Attorneys and Body Shops.

We're looking for an appraiser to work with who we could use as a go-to source and expert witness.

Here is a sample report, which was used to turn an initial $1,100 offer from the insurance company into a $5,700 settlement.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1AcnriBtZYUnK4fs9AT5yZSWljSr\\_dFuX/view

Here's a sample Fair Market Value report:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/194Q1i8udFye\\_tEXFBeYR-M\\_Bdd\\_oDaTe/view

We're also open to explaining in detail to you and adjusting it, if needed, to ensure you could back it up.

Our website for Attorneys can be seen here:

https://trueclaims.io

You can also see the LinkedIn of the creator here:

https://www.linkedin.com/in/jeffzigman/

---  
We are looking for an Expert Appraiser (possibly several). It will be essential to have:

* A strong background as an expert appraiser
* Experience as an expert witness testifying in court
* An entrepreneurial mindset with an excitement for software/tech in the vehicle damage space

Benefits

* Flexible schedule
* High level of independence
* Strong support

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

Salary: $50,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Expected hours: 20 – 40 per week

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* How many years have you been a vehicle appraiser?
* How many vehicles have you assessed over your career? (roughly)
* How many times have you appeared in court as an expert witness?

Work Location: Remote

title: HubSpot Specialist
description:
**JOB TITLE**: HubSpot Specialist  

**DEPARTMENT**: IT  

**REPORTS TO**: Chief Commercial Officer  

**APPROVED BY**: Chief Commercial Officer  

**LOCATION/ENTITY**: Remote/MEA Pescadero, LLC  

**SALARY:** $65,000-$85,000 DOE  

**START DATE:** April 1, 2024  

  

**COMPANY OVERVIEW:**  

MEA, named by *The New York Times* as "the world's first midlife wisdom school," provides 5-day workshops and online courses where participants, together with a team of MEA facilitators explore the topics of navigating transitions, finding purpose, and owning wisdom. MEA believes that wisdom is shared, not taught, so the interactions between students are an important element of the MEA experience. During workshops, participants spend their time in a combination of classroom and experiential modules, on a campus with upscale accommodations that one could expect from a luxury boutique hotel. MEA has a campus in Baja, Mexico and is opening a new campus in Santa Fe, New Mexico in April 2024.  

  

**JOB SUMMARY:**  

We are looking for a dynamic and experienced HubSpot Specialist to join our team. This role is pivotal in enhancing our marketing and sales strategies through the effective use of HubSpot. As a key member of our team, you will be responsible for owning HubSpot within the organization, ensuring it is fully leveraged to meet our business goals.  

  

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Integration Mastery: Develop and maintain robust integrations between HubSpot and various applications and systems used by our organization to ensure seamless data flow and functionality.
* Data Integrity Champion: Monitor and ensure the accuracy, cleanliness, and completeness of data within HubSpot, implementing best practices in data management to support decision-making processes.
* Sales Pipeline Management: Oversee the entire sales pipeline in HubSpot, from lead generation to closing. You will be instrumental in optimizing processes to improve conversion rates and sales efficiency.
* Email Marketing Strategist: Plan, execute, and manage all outbound email marketing campaigns, including segmentation, personalization, and performance analysis to maximize engagement and ROI.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with various departments, including sales, marketing, and customer service, to ensure HubSpot aligns with their needs and enhances their operational efficiency.

**SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Proven experience in managing and optimizing HubSpot CRM and Marketing Hub.
* Strong understanding of integration platforms and APIs to connect HubSpot with other systems and tools.
* Expertise in data management principles, with a keen eye for detail to ensure high data quality and integrity.
* Experience in managing sales pipelines and understanding the nuances of sales processes within HubSpot.
* Proficiency in designing and executing successful email marketing campaigns, with a solid grasp of best practices in email marketing.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work cross-functionally to understand departmental needs and implement effective solutions.
* Strong communication and project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.
* HubSpot certifications are highly preferred.
* This is a full time position, and you must be available between the hours of 9am-5pm PST.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORK ENVIRONMENT:**  

Physical demands and work environment described here are representative of those that must be met by a team member to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  

  

The person in this position may have to sit for long periods for eight (8) hours per day, as well as have the ability to work in a variety of environments and to stand, walk, and climb as needed.  

  

The position is remote. The team member is expected to work 40 hours a week. The team member may expect calls or emails outside of scheduled working hours. Occasional travel may be required for learning opportunities, team meetings, or other events.  

  

**CONTACT LEVELS:**

* Face-to-face/in person: Moderate level of interaction with team, vendors, and customers.
* Telephone interaction: Moderate level of interaction with team, customers, vendors.
* Computer interactions: Heavy level of interactions with customers, medium with team, moderate with vendors.
* Please submit your resume and a cover letter explaining why you are the perfect fit for the HubSpot Specialist. Include examples of your experience with HubSpot and how you have used it to drive business results.

title: Customer Support Specialist
description:
Brightree is a wholly owned subsidiary of ResMed (NYSE: RMD, ASX: RMD).
When you work at Brightree, it’s more than just a job. You’ll be part of a team that’s driving innovation and leading the way in cloud-based patient management software.
The technology allows us to provide the tools for better outcomes but at our heart, we’re really about people. We strive to positively impact our customers’ businesses and the lives of patients every single day.
Let's talk about the team:
The Customer Support Representative is responsible for identifying the customer issue and providing a solution to resolve the case. The Representative’s primary objective is to provide consultative responses to the many types of technical and non-technical questions raised by our customers and maintain a high level of customer satisfaction.
The ideal shift hours for this role is: Monday - Friday 10am - 7pm Eastern Time.  

Let’s talk about the role:* Answer questions regarding the Brightree application and its extended services in a friendly, effective, and efficient manner.
* Diagnose and resolve complex customer questions or problems over the telephone or through electronic communication in the areas of system configuration/setup, product functionality, and bugs/enhancements.
* Interact with customers to troubleshoot and resolve customer issues that may not have standard documented solutions.
* Track and document inbound support requests and ensure proper notation of customer problems and issues.
* Work closely with customers to ensure we are providing solutions that meet their needs.
* Reproduce and document issues that require escalation, including critical issues.
* Identify parent cases and incidents. Document according to standard operating procedures, including using Salesforce Chatter.
* Communicate with team, cross-functional teams and management to research and provide awareness and updates to issues that require escalation, including critical issues.
* Communicate effectively with business partners, vendors and cross-functional teams for issue identification and resolution.
* Confirm, document, and escalate release issues.
* Identify critical issues that may impact all clients, provide proactive communication, technical details, status, and subsequent updates.
* Mentor and train new staff members.
* Assist teammates by helping them triage/resolve cases.
* Ensure all cases are documented according to standard operating procedures, including those escalated by CSRs.
* Mentor/lead by example, with positivity and professionalism.
* Document new issues, FAQs, and resolutions to continuously build a robust knowledge base – including reviewing, publishing, and keeping all knowledge articles up to date.
* Stay abreast of current technology in products, design changes, and new products offered. Share knowledge with other team members.
* Stay abreast of software releases and new features. Share knowledge with other team members.

  

Let’s talk about you:* Minimum of 3 years experience in application support, SaaS customer support, or call center environment, providing software support to external customers.
* Minimum of 3 years experience using Salesforce, or similar, to manage and escalate support cases.
* Extensive knowledge of customer support best practices.
* Subject matter expert with multiple Brightree applications and extended services.
* Strong interpersonal, communication, and customer service skills with the ability to resolve challenging issues promptly while mentoring peers.
* Customer experience mindset and focus.
* Technical aptitude and troubleshooting skills to tackle a problem using a logical, systematic sequential approach.
* Proven ability to resolve challenging issues in a timely manner.
* Quick learner, self-directed and motivated.
* Dedication and commitment level to the tasks at hand.
* Proven ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with the ability to own areas of the product with minimal supervision.
* Great attitude, willingness to learn and continuous improvement mindset.
* Proven ability to deescalate customer concerns and escalations.
* Deep understanding and experience in HME/DME, medical billing, Home Health and/or healthcare industry.
* Experience working in a remote workforce.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, and Excel)
* Proficiency with Web Browsers (Explorer, Firefox, Chrome, and Safari)
* Bachelor’s degree in finance, business, healthcare, technology, or a relevant field strongly preferred; equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.
* Experience with Salesforce
* Experience with supporting hardware, API integrations, and reading log files
* Working knowledge of the software development life cycle

*We are shaping the future at ResMed, and we recognize the need to build on and broaden our existing skills and continue to attract and retain the world’s best talent. We work hard to offer holistic benefits packages, provide flexible work arrangements, cultivate a workforce culture that allows employees to grow personally and professionally, and deliver competitive salaries to our team members. Employees scheduled to work 30 or more hours per week are eligible for benefits. This position qualifies for the following benefits package: comprehensive medical, vision, dental, and life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability insurance, sleep care management, Health Savings Account (HSA), Flexible Spending Account (FSA), commuter benefits, 401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), Employee Assistance Program (EAP), and tuition assistance. Employees accrue fifteen days Paid Time Off (PTO) in their first year of employment, receive 11 paid holidays plus 3 floating days and are eligible for 14 weeks of primary caregiver or two weeks of secondary caregiver leave when welcoming new family members.** *Individual pay decisions are based on a variety of factors, such as the candidate’s geographic work location, relevant qualifications, work experience, and skills.*
* *At ResMed, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current base range for this position is:* *$26.00 - 39.12 USD Hourly*
* *For remote positions located outside of the US, pay will be determined based the candidate’s geographic work location, relevant qualifications, work experience, and skills.*

*#LI-REMOTE*
Joining us is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. If this sounds like the workplace for you, apply now! We commit to respond to every applicant.

title: Administrative Specialist
description:
Overview:

Join AIR as an **Admi****nistrative Specialist** with our **Health** team. Our Health team works collaboratively to unravel the intertwined challenges of health care quality, costs, and access. Our team of experts – nurses, physicians, psychologists, economists, sociologists, data scientists, and public health experts – advance evidence and save lives by leading rigorous research and evaluation; results-driven technical assistance and training; and leading-edge data science and technology tools.  

Use your experience, knowledge, and education to help us deliver on our mission: to contribute to a better, more equitable world.  

Candidates hired for the position may work remotely within the United States (U.S.) or from one of our U.S. office locations. This does not include U.S. territories. **About AIR:**  

Established in 1946, with headquarters in Arlington, Virginia, AIR is a nonpartisan, not-for-profit institution that conducts behavioral and social science research and delivers technical assistance to solve some of the most urgent challenges in the U.S. and around the world. We advance evidence in the areas of education, health, the workforce, human services, and international development to create a better, more equitable world.  

AIR’s commitment to diversity goes beyond legal compliance to its full integration in our strategy, operations, and work environment. At AIR, we define diversity broadly, considering everyone’s unique life and community experiences. We believe that embracing diverse perspectives, abilities/disabilities, racial/ethnic and cultural backgrounds, styles, ages, genders, gender identities and expressions, education backgrounds, and life stories drives innovation and employee engagement. Learn more about AIR's Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Strategy and hear from our staff by clicking here.
Responsibilities:

The responsibilities for the position include:* Provides administrative support to senior staff including scheduling meetings, making meeting/travel arrangements, maintaining schedules and team calendars, note taking for internal meetings, and disseminating meeting materials as needed.
* Develops, implements, and utilizes planning, scheduling, and tracking systems, processes and procedures to provide effective administrative support services for the Health Division and its VP.
* Manages distribution lists and ensures accuracy for communication to the entire Division.
* Supports Health projects, budgets, and schedules.
* Maintains VP calendar and coordinates meetings with staff as necessary.
* Maintains and ensures confidentiality of all written and verbal communications initiated by VP.
* Gains familiarity with Health projects and activities to answer questions and/or refer questions to appropriate staff.
* Utilizes knowledge of, and advocate compliance with, corporate policies when interacting with staff.
* Coordinates all activities relating to conferences, meetings, and staff events, as requested by the VP. This includes reserving conference rooms, formatting presentations, coordinating booth materials, ensuring conference sponsorship is paid, food vendor coordination and setup, and assisting staff with meeting registration and travel as necessary.
* Supports internal hiring process including posting open positions in Staffing Connector, collecting resumes, and scheduling interviews and debrief meetings.
* Updates and maintains content for the Health Intranet site, collaborating with staff as necessary.
* Coordinates contracts and invoicing for Health-related consultants and contracts.
* Promotes staff engagement by welcoming new hires, celebrating anniversaries, and assisting with other employee engagement initiatives.
* Other related tasks and projects as they arise.


Qualifications:
**Education, Knowledge, and Experience:**

* Minimum of High School Diploma with a minimum of 5 years of experience **or**bachelor’s degree with 4 a minimum of years of prior administrative experience.
* Experience working collaboratively with teams across multicultural contexts.
* Experience working independently and effectively while demonstrating initiative and resourcefulness in a fast-paced environment.
* Experience in event planning or event coordination.
* Experience providing administrative support to senior level staff is preferred but not required.


**Skills:**

* Excellent interpersonal skills to ensure effective communication and ability to effectively work with and respond to inquiries from internal staff members at all levels as well as external partners.
* Excellent organizational skills to manage multiple activities with tact and diplomacy.
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint), Adobe Acrobat, Teams, Zoom, and other web platforms.
* Ability to handle multiple priorities and ensure timely follow-up.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to work efficiently in a virtual work environment.

**Disclosures:**

  

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the U.S. on a full-time basis. Employment-based visa sponsorship (including H-1B sponsorship) is not available for this position. Depending on project work, qualified candidates may need to meet certain residency requirements.

  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

  

AIR adheres to strict child safeguarding principles. All selected candidates will be expected to adhere to these standards and principles and will therefore undergo reference and background checks.

  

AIR’s Total Rewards Program, is designed to reward our staff competitively and motivate them to achieve our critical mission. This position offers an anticipated rate of $26.00 - $33.00 per hour. Salary offers are made based on internal equity within the institution and external equity with competitive markets. Please note this is the hourly rate range for candidates that are based in the United States.

  

AIR maintains a drug-free work environment.

 **Fraudulent Job Scams Warning & Disclaimer:**  

AIR is aware of individuals falsely presenting themselves as AIR representatives. Fraudulent job scams seek to extract sensitive information or money from victims. To protect yourself, please be aware that AIR recruitment will only email you from an “@air.org” domain. Please take extra caution while examining the email address, for example jdoe**@air.org** is correct and jdoe**@aircareers.org** is not a legitimate AIR email address**.** If you are unsure of the legitimacy of a communication you have received, please reach out to recruitment@air.org.  

If you see a job scam, or lose money to one, report it to the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) at ReportFraud.ftc.gov. You can also report it to your state attorney general. Find out more about how to avoid scams at ftc.gov/scams.  

#LI-DC1 #LI-Remote

title: Customer Data Specialist
description:
**COMPANY DESCRIPTION**


At AirLife, we are dedicated to improving the quality of every breath. *Excellence with Every Breath* is not just a tag line, but the way we work and take care of our customers. With a mindset to evolve, innovate, and grow, we are a premier manufacturer of the highest-quality and market-leading breathing consumables. This growth philosophy has positioned us to increase our global footprint and business reach, impacting even more people around the world. Our expanding family of the most trusted brands offers a product portfolio that spans the continuum of care from first responder to home care, with safety, patient comfort, and clinical performance in mind. Collective expertise allows us to provide quality products and experiences to our patients, customers, and our people. Our values of Customer first, Differentiate with our People, Bias for Action, Continuous Improvement and Accountability define who we are and how we work. Join us!

**POSITION SUMMARY**


As a Customer Data Specialist, you will be responsible for the maintenance of GPO membership data including member tier connections and accurate IDN assignments.


This position will continually contribute to the evolution and adoption of standard procedures, utilizing systems and tools effectively, and practice sound analytical judgement to drive efficient and accurate membership and compliance to optimize results and mitigate financial risk.


We are looking for a detail-oriented individual who can clearly analyze transactional data, resolve issues collaboratively with internal and external partners, and be a contributor to positive change and innovation within the Commercial Data team as the Company works collectively to improve patient outcomes and increase the value we bring to our customers.

**POSITION QUALIFICATIONS**


The specific minimum competencies needed to perform the essential duties of the job include knowledge, skills, abilities, level of education, and experience necessary for successful performance. These competencies are generally demonstrated through specific service, education, or training.

**Knowledge: The following skills are preferred but not required:**

* Knowledge of GPO/IDN segment of healthcare industry
* Prior experience in Medical Device or Pharmaceutical Industry
* Understanding of commercial contract operations management

**Skills & Abilities:**

* Strong analytical skills.
* Possess strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to plan, organize, and manage a variable workload and meet schedules with accurate results
* Be a self-motivated, independent worker with the ability to learn new systems quickly.
* Sense of urgency and commitment; demonstrated ability to meet individual and team goals
* Ability to successfully work with cross-functional teams and with all levels of the organization

**Level of Experience:**

* 1-3 years analytical experience
* 2+ years of relevant work experience in Finance, Healthcare Management or related field preferred

**Level of Education:**

* Bachelor's (BA/BS) degree

**Travel:** None

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* The core tasks, duties, and responsibilities that must be performed on the job.
* Conduct regular review of membership lists published by group purchasing organizations (GPOs) and drive harmonization of key data (roster demographics, GLN, Hospital IDN, HINs, parent system as appropriate) in Airlife system to support customer pricing parity, compliance, & reporting
* Extract, prepare and load GPO roster and pricing files on a scheduled cadence
* Process membership additions and deletions identified on published lists and via letters of commitment following a schedule to review each major GPO list according to standard operating procedures
* Respond to inquiries from internal and external parties to resolve membership questions and discrepancies
* Understand and contribute to team performance for KPI’s (key performance indicators) and SLA’s (service level agreements)
* Monitor and update membership tools and third-party resources, adapting to evolving business and contracting needs
* Support GPO contract compliance management realigning customers with appropriate tier levels and validating compliance/spend
* Maintain regular interaction with other teams within Pricing and GPO Contracting, Account Management, Customer Support, Sales Teams, Finance and IT
* Collaborate with GPO partners to initiate business process continuous improvement activities, conduct root cause analysis and determine error prevention solutions
* Provide subject matter expertise and drive the design and application of business process and system integration across Airlife
* Identify and understand key areas of change management with the ability to recognize and communicate the impact of change to GPO admin fee processing and assigned tasks
* Support GPO specific compliance program review. Review performance data/metrics and partner with Health Systems and Sales team address non-compliance
* Perform other related activities as assigned

**OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Focus on achieving our Company mission.
* Demonstrate accuracy and thoroughness in daily work; look for ways to improve and promote quality & safety.
* Inspire the trust of others; treat people with respect and dignity and embrace the value of diversity.
* Use time efficiently; perform job accurately, thoroughly, and conserve Company resources to improve profits.
* Contribute to building and maintaining a positive team environment.
* Assure all policies and guidelines are implemented and followed.

**QUALITY POLICY**


At AirLife, Quality is our promise. It is our commitment to customer satisfaction and our dedication to product excellence in an evolving global healthcare market. This promise is kept through a continuously improving and effective Quality Management System and compliance to Regulatory Requirements.

**DEIA STATEMENT**


At AirLife, we are committed to building a diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace that reflects the communities and customers we serve. We believe our philosophy on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Advancement (DEIA) encourages excellence and equips us to serve an evolving global marketplace.

title: Integration Specialist (Remote)
description:
RainFocus, one of the most innovative software companies in the heart of Utah's Silicon Slopes, is in search of an exceptional Integration Specialist.**About RainFocus**
RainFocus cares about its employees, customers, and the world in which we live. Our rapidly growing team serves Fortune 500 companies like Adobe, Cisco, IBM, Oracle, VMware, and others to prepare and execute in-person, virtual, and hybrid events, across the world. Those events are delivered through our industry-disrupting software platform, with groundbreaking business intelligence, to elevate the attendee experience, streamline event operations, and accelerate marketing results. We are well-funded, growing fast, and building a company that is changing the market — it will be challenging, fun and exciting.**About the Role**
An Integration Specialist is responsible for the implementation of the integration product. Integrations can either use our API’s to extract data from RainFocus’ platform or the customer’s may have their own API’s to send us data. The integrations may include data transfers with third party vendors such as Zoom and other media platforms. Integrations Specialists will also support Single Sign On through client’s web sites.
### **Primary Duties and Responsibilities**

* As part of the Global Integration Team, you will work with a variety of members including implementation teams and the integration team to provide delivery and support of integration requirements for the RainFocus Products.
* Ability to communicate clearly to peers and clients
* Work closely with Project Managers and Solution Consultants, communicating and understanding goals required to complete required tasks on time and budget
* Work closely with Project Managers and Solution Consultants, communicating and understanding goals required to complete required tasks on time and budget
* Ability to assess, design, and develop integration meeting customer requirements
* Ability to assist Services teams with integration discovery and scoping
* Must be comfortable working within a cloud-based environmentLead internal and external meetings with customers and vendors
* Manage integration timelines including but not limited to notifying clients of changes to task dates or assigned resourcesLead requirements sessions to discover integration needs, architect integrations and complete the integration build.
* Provide direct technical client supportCreation of design documents, test cases & unit testing
* Document integration elements prior to transitioning the integration to support Available for After Hours Support, when needed

### **Required Skills & Experience**

* 1+ year of experience working with enterprise clients
* 2+ years of experience working with REST API’s and familiar with JSON1
* 3 years of experience in a Professional Services consulting environment
* Experience with Integrations with Salesforce and Adobe Analytics
* Familiarity with API tools such as Postman, Swagger and SSO
* Familiarity with Google Chrome development tools
* Understanding of web analytics and the ability to comprehend JavaScript
* Ability to work on multiple projects at once, set priorities, work independently, problem solve, improvise, and function as part of a team
* Technical ability to understand platforms and understand how they can and should work together
* Experience working with technical and non-technical teams
* Superior communications skills, both written and verbal
* Ability to tackle obscure problems using outside the box thinking when there may be limited resources on custom integrations
* Experience with Integrations with Salesforce and Adobe Analytics

### **Preferred Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field or equivalent professional experience
* SalesForce, Adobe Marketing Cloud, Marketo, SSO, and other marketing and events platform expertise/certifications a plus

**Location/Travel**
Remote opportunity. Total travel could be up to 15%. The nature of the travel is being onsite at client events, which may include weekends, as well as postmortem and client-driven meetings. **Why work at RainFocus?**
At RainFocus we delight millions of attendees at large-scale events by delivering better insights, experiences, and marketing. We were able to pivot our product and services offering in 2020 to continue growing and serving new clients and events.  

As a member of the RainFocus team, you will have the opportunity to experience first-hand the impact of our platform at events around the world. Additionally, RainFocus offers competitive salaries, competitive benefits, 401k, generous PTO, and countless other team building activities.  

What are you waiting for? Apply today! *We need more talented, hard-working, fun-loving team members just like yourself!*

title: Finance Implementation Specialist
description:
Are you ready to be the linchpin in transforming financial processes and driving efficiency within a dynamic and growing organization? METCOR/LSI is on the lookout for a **Finance Implementation Specialist** that will do just that.


As a **Finance Implementation Specialist,** you will hold the key to unlocking the full potential of our financial systems, particularly in the implementation, integration, and testing of the **Deltek CostPoint** account software. Picture this - your expertise will be the catalyst, preventing inefficiencies, boosting productivity, and curbing unnecessary costs caused by system downtime and user frustration.

  

In this pivotal, **Independent Contractor** role, you'll have the chance to be a driving force in our Contracts and Finance Department, ensuring compliance with General Acceptable Accounting Practices [GAAP], industry best practices, and making substantial improvements.  



  

The responsibilities and duties for the Finance Implementation Specialist will include, but are not limited to:


Implementation:


* Research the existing Deltek CostPoint [CP] contract and document the currently purchased modules/components in written narrative for review.
* Create a master project plan, detailing:
	+ Scope Statement
	+ Deliverables o Work Breakdown Structure/Tasks
	+ Schedule
	+ Budget
		- Estimates
		- Costs
		- Payment Terms
	+ Quality Assurance
	+ Human Resources Plan
	+ Major Milestones
* Assist in data recording, data input, and data acquisition for installing the customized CP with all necessary and new components.
* Creating a weekly report and monthly report that details:
	+ Objectives
	+ Project status
	+ Metrics and/or KPIs as applicable
	+ Progress made in the prior month
	+ Planned activities for the upcoming month
	+ Potential risks or hurdles that require intervention from senior leadership
	Accomplishments  
	+

  

Education & Training:


* Bachelor's degree in finance, Accounting, or Business Administration (desired)
* Training: None
* Certifications: None

Skills/Experience:


* Six to eight [6 to 8] years of work experience, with a minimum of four [4] years in an aligned discipline (i.e., bookkeeping, finance, accounting, etc.)
* Working experience within a Government Contracting company highly preferred
* Computer proficiency in MS Office Applications (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, SharePoint, Visio), and internet
* Working knowledge of Deltek CostPoint required
* Excellent interpersonal, communication and project management skills
* Strict adherence to confidentiality, privacy, rules and regulations

**Rate & Project Duration**:

* $40-$45 per hour
* 6-8 months

title: Customer Success Specialist
description:
**About Voovio Technologies**  

  

Voovio Technologies serves the biggest petrochemical, refining and manufacturing companies in the world. A growing software company with a patented technology and a Knowledge Automation platform for field operations. Thanks to Voovio, industrial manufacturing customers increase profitability with an effective knowledge transfer system, reducing equipment downtime, boosting operator productivity, and accelerating onboarding.  

  

The Customer Success Specialist will work directly with our Customer Success team to support customers as they transition from sales prospects to active users of our products; focused on customer loyalty and building close, long-term client relationships. The Customer Success Specialist will be heavily involved with onboarding new customers and ensuring all customers reap the maximum value out of Voovio by working closely with our Operations, Sales and Production teams.  

  

**Location**: Looking for candidates based in Louisiana or surrounding gulf coast region. Regular travel to customer sites.  

**Travel**: 20-30%  

  

**Responsibilities**:* Interact with existing customers on a regular basis (virtual and face to face).
* Understand customer challenges and assist with implementing policies and procedures to enhance customer satisfaction.
* Design and provide group and 1:1 training sessions (virtual or face to face) for customers on how to use Voovio’s tools and features.
* Document and track operator performance on simulation modules as well as collect other performance data for customer champions.
* Assist our operations team, including but not limited to:
	+ Document and review customer performance.
	+ Help obtain, analyze, and present business case data.
	+ Attend customer meetings and help demonstrate our Enhanced Reality tools.
* Establish and maintain positive long-term relationships with key client accounts and key strategic partners.
* Ensure customers get fast and successful responses to issues and questions.
* Support customers with IT challenges.
* Collect and communicate customer feedback to our Development team to enhance our product line.
* Support integration of Voovio into customer’s existing systems.
* Create customer resources such as videos, documents, charts, analytics, etc.
* Liaise closely with our U.S. Sales & Operations teams on project development and identify new opportunities with customers.
* Quickly learn new features and updates to our product suites and demonstrate to our Sales team and existing customers.

  

**Skills and qualities**:  

* Knowledge of the downstream industry. Ideal candidates will have experience of working in a refinery or chemical plant.
* Ability to problem solve and adapt to challenges quickly.
* Strong communication skills both oral and written.
* Confident and proven record of using software applications (must be a fast learner).
* Must be team-oriented, working with customer and Voovio personnel at varying levels of responsibility.
* Drive to listen and seek to understand different perspectives.
* Ability to work remotely and independently.
* Self-starter and results focused.
* Possess high ethical standards.
* Detail oriented.

  

**Qualifications**:  

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or similar discipline.
* Manufacturing or process industry related experience preferred.
* Must be computer literate and familiar with standard software tools.
* Candidates must have a valid US passport and legal status to work in the U.S.
* Must have a vehicle.

  

**Compensation**:  

* Salary: Competitive
* Health: Competitive company plans available
* 401k Plan available
* Mileage reimbursement
