title: Graphic Designer/ Multimedia Specialist
description:
**Title:** Graphic Designer / Multimedia Specialist

  


**Location:** Remote

  


**Role:** The Graphic Designer / Multimedia Specialist is a member of a multidisciplinary team creating or updating online, in-class, and hybrid courses for US Air Force personnel serving in the civil engineering career field. The supported customer is the Air Force Civil Engineer Center at Tyndall Air Force Base in Panama City, FL. If you are looking for work that will challenge and grow your talents in new ways, this role is meant for you.

  


**Duties:**


* Works as a member of a project team to create or update courses used for web-based, classroom, and hybrid delivery.
* Uses modern computer graphics software to develop and edit graphic sketches, designs, 2D/3D animations, photographs, and video content for integration into courses.
* Assists with testing of draft course materials and/or eLearning courseware modules.
* Provides expertise to improve project quality control and mitigate common course development risks.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

  


**Technical:**


* Demonstrates expertise using modern graphic creation/editing software.
* Comfortable with MS Office products including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.

  


**Education:**


* Bachelor’s Degree required, or associates degree with 5 or more years of experience

  


**Certifications:**


* None required, but certifications or evidence of advanced training in relevant skills are a plus.

  


**Experience:**


* Three (3) or more years as a Graphic Designer / Multimedia Specialist and able to provide a portfolio of products you have created.
* Experience in photography and/or videography are a plus but are not required.
* Experience in support of federal government contracts is a plus but is not a requirement.

**Company Background:**

Since its founding in 2007, APV's portfolio of clients has grown significantly. As a well-established, woman-owned, Small Business Association-certified 8(a) company, APV has become a small business leader in supporting a multitude of clients, from more than 15 federal and state agencies, including the Department of Defense, to civilian organizations. As of , APV has executed 70 plus prime contracts and received exceptional performance and client service ratings. APV is currently working on more than 30 government projects.


APV is a mature company dedicated to quality and exceptional delivery to meet its clients’ missions. We believe that the highest quality consultants are an essential part of this. We hire the best and take care of the people who come to work for us. We continue to maintain 96% employee satisfaction and have a high retention rate, well above the industry average for our small business peers. We do this by offering a competitive compensation plan and providing leadership that is dedicated to employee growth and advancement.



Candidates must meet the minimum qualifications to receive further consideration.

title: Customer Data Specialist
description:
**COMPANY DESCRIPTION**

At AirLife, we are dedicated to improving the quality of every breath. *Excellence with Every Breath* is not just a tag line, but the way we work and take care of our customers. With a mindset to evolve, innovate, and grow, we are a premier manufacturer of the highest-quality and market-leading breathing consumables. This growth philosophy has positioned us to increase our global footprint and business reach, impacting even more people around the world. Our expanding family of the most trusted brands offers a product portfolio that spans the continuum of care from first responder to home care, with safety, patient comfort, and clinical performance in mind. Collective expertise allows us to provide quality products and experiences to our patients, customers, and our people. Our values of Customer first, Differentiate with our People, Bias for Action, Continuous Improvement and Accountability define who we are and how we work. Join us!


**POSITION SUMMARY**

As a Customer Data Specialist, you will be responsible for the maintenance of GPO membership data including member tier connections and accurate IDN assignments.


This position will continually contribute to the evolution and adoption of standard procedures, utilizing systems and tools effectively, and practice sound analytical judgement to drive efficient and accurate membership and compliance to optimize results and mitigate financial risk.


We are looking for a detail-oriented individual who can clearly analyze transactional data, resolve issues collaboratively with internal and external partners, and be a contributor to positive change and innovation within the Commercial Data team as the Company works collectively to improve patient outcomes and increase the value we bring to our customers.


**POSITION QUALIFICATIONS**

The specific minimum competencies needed to perform the essential duties of the job include knowledge, skills, abilities, level of education, and experience necessary for successful performance. These competencies are generally demonstrated through specific service, education, or training.


**Knowledge: The following skills are preferred but not required:**

* Knowledge of GPO/IDN segment of healthcare industry
* Prior experience in Medical Device or Pharmaceutical Industry
* Understanding of commercial contract operations management

**Skills & Abilities:**

* Strong analytical skills.
* Possess strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to plan, organize, and manage a variable workload and meet schedules with accurate results
* Be a self-motivated, independent worker with the ability to learn new systems quickly.
* Sense of urgency and commitment; demonstrated ability to meet individual and team goals
* Ability to successfully work with cross-functional teams and with all levels of the organization

**Level of Experience:**

* 1-3 years analytical experience
* 2+ years of relevant work experience in Finance, Healthcare Management or related field preferred

**Level of Education:**

* Bachelor's (BA/BS) degree

**Travel:** None


**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* The core tasks, duties, and responsibilities that must be performed on the job.
* Conduct regular review of membership lists published by group purchasing organizations (GPOs) and drive harmonization of key data (roster demographics, GLN, Hospital IDN, HINs, parent system as appropriate) in Airlife system to support customer pricing parity, compliance, & reporting
* Extract, prepare and load GPO roster and pricing files on a scheduled cadence
* Process membership additions and deletions identified on published lists and via letters of commitment following a schedule to review each major GPO list according to standard operating procedures
* Respond to inquiries from internal and external parties to resolve membership questions and discrepancies
* Understand and contribute to team performance for KPI’s (key performance indicators) and SLA’s (service level agreements)
* Monitor and update membership tools and third-party resources, adapting to evolving business and contracting needs
* Support GPO contract compliance management realigning customers with appropriate tier levels and validating compliance/spend
* Maintain regular interaction with other teams within Pricing and GPO Contracting, Account Management, Customer Support, Sales Teams, Finance and IT
* Collaborate with GPO partners to initiate business process continuous improvement activities, conduct root cause analysis and determine error prevention solutions
* Provide subject matter expertise and drive the design and application of business process and system integration across Airlife
* Identify and understand key areas of change management with the ability to recognize and communicate the impact of change to GPO admin fee processing and assigned tasks
* Support GPO specific compliance program review. Review performance data/metrics and partner with Health Systems and Sales team address non-compliance
* Perform other related activities as assigned

**OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Focus on achieving our Company mission.
* Demonstrate accuracy and thoroughness in daily work; look for ways to improve and promote quality & safety.
* Inspire the trust of others; treat people with respect and dignity and embrace the value of diversity.
* Use time efficiently; perform job accurately, thoroughly, and conserve Company resources to improve profits.
* Contribute to building and maintaining a positive team environment.
* Assure all policies and guidelines are implemented and followed.

**QUALITY POLICY**

At AirLife, Quality is our promise. It is our commitment to customer satisfaction and our dedication to product excellence in an evolving global healthcare market. This promise is kept through a continuously improving and effective Quality Management System and compliance to Regulatory Requirements.


**DEIA STATEMENT**

At AirLife, we are committed to building a diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace that reflects the communities and customers we serve. We believe our philosophy on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Advancement (DEIA) encourages excellence and equips us to serve an evolving global marketplace.

title: IT Support Specialist
description:
At First Advantage, people are at the heart of everything we do. This mindset spans from our customers and partners, to our greatest strength: our team members. Join us if you want to say “hello” to a rewarding career, and pave the way as an industry leader in mission-critical background screening solutions to some of the most recognized Fortune 100 and Global 500 brands.

**Who We Are**


We are on the frontline of the Great Onboarding, empowering organizations to Hire Smarter. Onboard Faster™. First Advantage (Nasdaq: FA) is an HR Tech company that delivers innovative solutions and insights to enable our clients to manage risk and hire the best talent. Leveraging an advanced global technology platform, First Advantage builds fully scalable, configurable screening programs that meet the unique needs of over 33,000 clients across the world. Headquartered in Atlanta, GA and with a globally distributed workforce spanning 28 locations with 5,500+ employees, First Advantage performs over 93 million screens in over 200 countries and territories annually.

**Who You Are**


We are looking for a team member who considers themselves:

* Self-motivated – you love to lead others but are also ready to “roll up your sleeves." You can spearhead a project and see it through from start to completion.
* A team player – you navigate cross-functional teams and work well with team members across groups toward a common goal. While you are an independent contributor, you appreciate the value in collaboration.
* An innovator – you see gaps in current processes or workflows as an opportunity to improve and try something new.
* A lifelong learner – you seek opportunities to learn and upskill, you understand the importance of thorough and secure screenings, and are interested in the Human Capital sector and the confluence of people, process, and technology.

**What You'll Do**


Our IT Support Specialist will act as a single point of contact while providing the highest level of customer service, the Service Desk works to get answers for all IT and non-IT queries. To resolve many requests, they follow troubleshooting steps or reference Knowledge Base (KB) articles. Otherwise, gathering all the information required and route the request on the users’ behalf to the right support person or team within First Advantage to complete the customer’s request. Additionally, the Technical Support team will help monitor the users support request until completion. More specifically, the team member in this position will:

* Provide end user support in person, via phone or electronically.
* Diagnose and resolve issues using available knowledgebase and other resources.
* Ensure ticket logging and proper documentation for all issues. Conduct daily follow ups on pending tickets to facilitate closure with adherence to SLAs.
* Set up and configure desktops, printers, fingerprint scanners, and other peripherals.
* Handle escalations and ensure they are quickly resolved. Escalate issues to appropriate teams when required.
* Develop relationships with points of contact across the organization. May support basic training efforts for junior engineers and help in development of team.
* administration to include but not limited to account and group creation/management.
* Ensure proper documentation of ticket and ticket logging for all issues reported.
* Coordinate issue resolution with third parties as needed. Monitor uptime of servers. Become familiar with support policies and procedures.
* Develop daily reports to track team performance and update managers. Become familiar with other internal departments, their systems and applications.

**What You May Need to be Successful**

* Associate’s Degree or equivalent experience preferred (technical or analytical field a plus)
* 1+ years specializing in remote desktop support, systems administration, or IT Operations in a Windows environment
* Familiarity with ITIL processes (TIL V3 certification is an added advantage)
* Systems Architecture and integration experience preferred (specifying hardware, network configuration, etc.)
* Microsoft Office 2013 and above
* Outlook 2013 and above
* Knowledge of TCP/IP networking, and related network services (i.e. DNS, SMTP, DHCP, etc)
* Previous work experience in a corporate environment
* Experience supporting Outlook in a Microsoft Exchange environment
* Experience supporting a variety of WiFi-enabled devices
* Experience supporting remote users
* Basic knowledge of thin client systems, network printers, citrix, terminal servers

**Other Knowledge, Skills, Abilities or Certifications:**

* Excellent communication skills and experience working in a global setup
* Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to non-technical people
* Ability to recognize, analyze, and effectively solve problems in a timely and organized manner using industry best practices and procedures
* Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment

**Why First Advantage is Your Next Big Career Move**


First Advantage is going through a technology transformation! We are looking for experts who are excited to work with advanced technologies and provide best-in-class user experiences, drive the development and deployment of scalable solutions, and smoothly guide our agile teams and clients through meaningful changes as we continue to expand our impact.

**Additional benefits offered to our eligible people include:**

* Hybrid work model: most roles are remote with occasional business travel
* Competitive leave and time off policies
* Access to internal career opportunities and Global Talent mobility programs
* Custom soft skills programs on topics like mentoring, managing, and more
* Continuous learning and development opportunities via e-learning platforms
* Training and Certification reimbursement programs
* Medical Insurance options for employees, with parental insurance benefits available, plus ongoing Employee Wellness programs
* Recurring Reward and Recognition programs to celebrate top performers
* Other attractive allowances for weekend working, holiday pay, relocation assistance, Maternity bonus, Creche allowance, and more

**More About Our Values Code**

* Honor Honesty, Consistency, Responsibility: Do the right thing
* Cultivate an environment of dignity: Show respect for the individual
* Take an Outside-In approach: Put the client first
* Think out-of-the-box: Innovate and create
* Stay Team-Oriented: Collaborate and appreciate each other

**What Are You Waiting For? Apply Today!**


You have learned a little about us today – we want to learn about you! If you think this position and our company are a great fit for your areas of interest and expertise, tell us about you by applying now!


United States Equal Opportunity Employment:


First Advantage is proud to be a global leader in removing barriers and supporting our community members to ensure the changing demographics of the workforce are reflected in our hiring and employment practices. We value all of our candidates, employees, and clients, and place great emphasis on hiring and supporting qualified individuals in each role. We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other area protected by applicable law.

title: Support Specialist, Integration
description:
Restaurant365 is a SaaS company disrupting the restaurant industry! Our cloud-based platform provides a unique, centralized solution for accounting and back-office operations for restaurants. Restaurant365’s culture is focused on empowering team members to produce top-notch results while elevating their skills. We’re constantly evolving and improving to make sure we are and always will be “Best in Class” ... and we want that for you too!  

The Support Specialist, Integration is responsible for helping R365 customers with all R365 software (non-POS) integrations functions, including payroll, direct bank connection, and vendor invoice upload, keyed entry, and payment. They manage pertinent customer communications through tickets, live chats, and phone calls.
### **How you'll add value:**

+ Prompt customers for information necessary to troubleshoot problem reports
+ Identify solutions to problem reports and deliver them to customers
+ Help customers understand R365 Non-POS integrations functions
+ Route non-integrations customer issues to appropriate teams and team members

+ Train and mentor new team members at the request of Support management

+ Strong understanding of general business principles
+ Excellent problem-solving skills
+ Strong customer service skills
+ Clear and effective oral and written communication

The actual salary may vary based upon several factors, including, but not limited to, relevant skills/experience, time in the role, business line, and geographic location. Restaurant365 focuses on equitable pay for our team and aims for transparency with our pay practices.
+ Comprehensive medical benefits, 100% paid for employee

#BI-Remote
$25 - $31 an hour

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
**About Appriss Retail**


Appriss Retail provides real-time decisions and active risk monitoring to enable our customers to maximize profitability while managing risk. Our solutions are continually adapting to changing market conditions.


We bring 20+ years of retail data science expertise and experience. We serve a global base of leading commerce partners, representing 1/3 of all US omnichannel retail sales activity across 150,000 retail locations across specialty, apparel, department store, hard goods, big box, grocery, pharmacy, and hospitality businesses in 45 countries on six continents.


The company provides compelling, relevant, and profitable collective intelligence to operations, finance, marketing, and loss prevention. Appriss Retail’s performance-improvement solutions yield measurable results with significant return on investment.

**About the role**


The Digital Marketing Specialist is an integral member of Appriss Retail’s marketing team, helping to develop, execute, and maintain the company’s digital marketing campaigns. The ideal candidate will have a strong creative background, using Canva to create assets for email campaigns, ads, landing pages, and events. The Digital Marketing Specialist will be responsible for managing our email campaigns, including monthly digests, campaign emails, product-related emails, and event emails. The Specialist will also work closely with subject matter experts to create engaging blog content that is optimized for search engines and helps reinforce Appriss Retail’s position as an industry leader in retail fraud and abuse prevention.**What you'll do**

* Create and schedule posts in HubSpot for our social media channels that are engaging and offer a unique mix of topics and content, with the intent of increasing engagement, followers, and MQLs.
* Create and schedule emails in HubSpot for marketing campaigns, digests, product updates, and events.
* Work alongside our agency to publish two blogs a month, including topic research, building an outline with SMEs, SEO keyword research, finalizing the blog, photo selection, publishing it on our website, and creating social media posts and emails to promote them.
* Use strong creative skills to design images and videos for emails, landing pages, events, and organic and paid social media.
* Assist in writing content for the Appriss Retail blog, emails, and social media.
* Assist in editing the website in WordPress.
* Collaborate with other departments and stakeholders to ensure alignment and integration of digital marketing efforts with overall business objectives and brand identity.

**Qualifications**

* 1-3 years of experience building comprehensive digital marketing campaigns using a CMS or marketing automation platform (HubSpot preferred).
* Strong creative skills (Canva or Photoshop preferred) for creating branded social media posts, ad campaigns, and videos.
* Strong understanding of social media platforms, particularly LinkedIn.
* Strong content writing skills.
* Excellent writing and communication skills.
* Working knowledge of email, landing page, and website design best practices.
* Working knowledge of WordPress and Salesforce.
* Working knowledge of email marketing best practices and CAN-SPAM compliance.
* Must be able to work independently and within a team.
* Skilled in PowerPoint.
* Basic knowledge of HTML.
* Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in SEO.

**Physical Demands -**Sedentary **Benefits**  

Appriss Retail offers competitive benefits including medical, dental, and vision coverage. We offer an immediate vesting 401(k) plan with employer matching, unlimited paid time off for salaried employees, and well-being support including gym reimbursements, a subscription to Calm – Meditation and Sleep app, and paid leave for new parents and family care. As a hybrid global community, we also offer a remote work-first environment empowering our people to work wherever suits their lifestyle.
The pay range for this role is:
55,000 - 65,000 USD per year (Remote - United States)

title: Sales Operations Specialist
description:
Bloomerang combines the best tools, resources, and people to provide a world-class experience for tens of thousands of nonprofits, allowing them to raise more money and do more good in the world. Our powerful software and stellar customer service have made us one of the highest rated fundraising/donor CRMs on the market.



In addition to creating thriving nonprofits, we're also in the business of creating thriving employees*.* At Bloomerang, you'll be a part of a mission-driven culture built on the core values of Empathy, Unity, and Transparency. We know the key to our success is our people, and we're proud to be home to some of the most innovative and skilled employees in the workforce today.

  



The Role



As a Sales Operations Specialist, you will be a part of the Revenue Operations team working to support the growth and integration efforts of the company to enhance sales operations efficiency. You'll interpret sales data, ensuring accuracy in reporting and creating actionable insights to facilitate cross-departmental collaboration and to drive overall business success.

  



What You Will Do


* Manage and administer various systems used by the sales team, including CRM platforms and sales engagement platforms
* Collaborate with stakeholders to develop and maintain reports and dashboards that provide insights into sales performance and key metrics
* Provide support (and occasionally some training) to sales team members on using sales systems effectively, troubleshooting issues, and optimizing workflows
* Handle tickets related to Revenue Operations (RevOps) issues, addressing them in a timely manner and escalating as needed to ensure resolution
* Collaborate with leaders from various departments to understand their needs and initiatives related to sales operations, providing support and alignment where necessary

  



What You Need to Succeed


* Administration experience with a CRM
* Sales engagement platform experience
* Ability to collaborate
* Problem solving skills
* Prioritize effectively and meet deadlines


Nice to Haves But Not Required


* Administration experience with Salesforce
* Experience using Outreach
* Experience using Excel or similar spreadsheet software for data processing and analysis

  



Benefits



Health + Wellness  

You'll have access to generous health, vision, and dental insurance options, as well as a free subscription to Bright, a wellness platform that offers live and on-demand fitness, meditation, mindfulness, and nutrition classes.

  

Time Off



You'll get a competitive PTO package that includes 20 PTO days, 3 flex days, 4 optional volunteer Days, 12 paid holidays, as well as paid parental leave.

  

401k



You'll receive a 401k match to help invest in your future.

  



Equipment



Everything you need to be successful, shipped right to your door.

  



Compensation



The salary range for this position is: $59,500 - $80,500. You may also be eligible for a discretionary bonus. Actual compensation within the range will be dependent on your skills, experience, qualifications, and location, as well as applicable employment laws.

  



Location



This is a permanent, full-time, fully remote position. Employees living in Indianapolis, IN are welcome to work from our company headquarters. We do not offer Visa sponsorship or relocation assistance at this time.

  



Accommodations



Applicants who require accommodations may contact careers@bloomerang.com to request an accommodation in completing an application.

  



Bloomerang is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Individuals seeking employment at Bloomerang are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.

title: Resource Operations Specialist
description:
Advanced Systems Group, LLC enables creativity through better technology and operations for media creatives and content owners. From acquisition to delivery, on-premises or in the cloud, ASG ensures our clients’ success through tailored solutions. One of North America’s largest Media and Entertainment Technology and Operations suppliers, we provide engineering services, physical and cloud integration, training, support, and managed services. Our Managed Services deliver customized operations and services for all phases of media production, including creative and engineering. Founded in 1997, and providing nationwide services, ASG has teams based in Northern California, Los Angeles, the New York Tri-State Area, the Southeastern US, and the Rocky Mountain Region.

**We are looking for:** The **Resource Operations Specialist** plays a crucial role in ensuring the seamless integration of new employees into Managed Services while maintaining strong relationships with clients and stakeholders, serving as the primary POC for all client-related account, provisioning, or access needs. They also drive process improvements, data analysis, and employee engagement initiatives to enhance the overall onboarding experience and foster a positive workplace culture.





Job Responsibilities:

**Onboarding and Orientation:**

* Lead cross-functional projects for efficient onboarding and offboarding processes in the Managed Services department.
* Foster partnerships with Account and Resource Managers to ensure smooth onboarding for Managed Services employees.
* Communicate comprehensive SOPs and workflows for optimized onboarding.

**New Hire Announcements:**

* Create and distribute new hire announcements in a newsletter-style format.
* Collaborate with Resource Managers to gather information about new hires.

**Training and Development:**

* Collaborate with Learning and Development Manager to deliver training programs for Account and Resource Managers.
* Provide 'white-glove' service experience for clients, employees, and stakeholders.

**Provisioning:**

* Oversee IT provisioning processes, managing access, equipment, data audits, compliance, and client communication.
* Handle team notifications within Managed Services for terms, new hires, and promotions.

**Metrics and Reporting:**

* Generate metrics and reports, analyze data to identify trends and areas for improvement in Managed Services.

**Employee Engagement:**

* Conduct engagement surveys, analyze feedback, and develop action plans to enhance employee satisfaction and retention.
* Foster a positive workplace culture, promoting teamwork and collaboration.

**Process and Standards Management:**

* Support in creating processes and standards guides for onboarding new team members and performance reviews.
* Perform other related duties as assigned.
  

Qualifications & Experience:

* Excellent organizational and documentation skills, with the ability to manage multiple simultaneous projects and requests
* Excellent written communication and collaboration skills
* Demonstrated ability to build relationships across departments
* Experience managing client relationships
* A proactive approach to problem-solving with a hands-on, adaptable mindset
* Team-player mentality, with an enthusiastic willingness to jump in wherever needed
* Ability to learn complex systems and databases to problem solve challenging client needs
* Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information
* Strong attention to detail
* Ability to perform at a fast pace with high standards
* High critical thinking skills, with the ability to solve problems proactively
* Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information
* Associate degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Operations Management or a similar field preferred
* 2+ years of experience in operations, human resources or resource management required; OR,
* Any equivalent combination of experience and/or education from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been achieved.

**Position type and Work Environment:**

* Full time, 40+ hours/week
* 90% remote with potential site visits and travel required
* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and listen.
* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* This is a remote position so the environment will depend on the individual. The employee will routinely operate typical business office equipment, including computer hardware.
* Occasional travel required.

 **Compensation and Benefits:**


This regular full-time role is paid an annual salary of $70,000 - 90,000 depending on experience.


ASG LLC offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, 401k, paid time off, and more. Applicants from the state of Washington may contact recruiting@asgllc.com to request a full disclosure of the benefits offerings.

Advanced Systems Group LLC provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Ecommerce Product Listing Specialist
description:
Overview:


We are seeking a meticulous and detail-oriented Data Entry and Listing Building Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have excellent proficiency in Excel and a strong understanding of marketplaces such as Amazon, eBay, Walmart, Target, among others. The primary responsibility of this role will be to efficiently enter and manage data while building product listings across various online platforms. Additionally, this role will involve managing offshore virtual assistants to ensure smooth operations and task completion.


* Responsibilities:
* Perform accurate and efficient product data entry tasks using Excel to manage product information, pricing, and inventory levels.
* Create and optimize product listings on various online marketplaces including Amazon, eBay, Walmart, Target, etc., ensuring adherence to platform guidelines and best practices.
* Research and gather product data from multiple sources to ensure completeness and accuracy in listings.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Sales, Marketing, and Operations to ensure seamless integration of product data and listings.
* Monitor and update product listings regularly to reflect changes in pricing, availability, and promotions.
* Conduct quality checks on listings to ensure consistency and compliance with branding and style guidelines.
* Utilize analytical tools and reports to track performance metrics and identify opportunities for improvement in listing optimization.
* Provide guidance and instructions to offshore virtual assistants, delegating tasks effectively and ensuring timely completion of assignments.
* Train virtual assistants on data entry processes, marketplace guidelines, and listing optimization techniques.
* Maintain communication channels with offshore virtual assistants to address questions, provide feedback, and resolve issues as they arise.
* Coordinate with offshore teams to streamline workflows and optimize productivity.
* Stay updated on marketplace trends, policies, and algorithms to adapt strategies accordingly and maximize visibility and sales.
* Provide support for other data-related tasks and projects as needed.


Requirements:


* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field preferred.
* Proven experience in data entry and listing building, preferably in an e-commerce or retail environment.
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including formulas, functions, and data manipulation techniques.
* Familiarity with online marketplaces such as Amazon, eBay, Walmart, Target, etc., and understanding of their listing requirements and policies.
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy with the ability to maintain data integrity.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively and meet deadlines.
* Solid analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and derive actionable insights.
* Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to collaborate cross-functionally.
* Experience managing offshore virtual assistants is highly desirable.
* Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and dynamic work environment, demonstrating flexibility and resilience.
* Experience with product data management systems or listing tools is a plus.
* on site or hybrid preferred; willing to accommodate remote for the right candidate

  

This is an excellent opportunity for individuals who thrive in a data-driven and collaborative environment, with a passion for e-commerce and online marketplace management. If you meet the requirements and are eager to contribute to our team's success, we encourage you to apply.

title: Payroll Specialist
description:
**PaceMate™ Payroll Specialist (full-time, remote)**

*Primary Location: All U.S. Locations (remote)*

***Why work at PaceMate?***


Recognized as a Top 100 Healthcare Technology Company by Healthcare Technology Report, PaceMate is one of the nation’s fastest-growing companies in cardiac rhythm management software and remote monitoring. Combining the most technologically advanced cloud-native software, research-grade data, and seamless integrations, PaceMateLIVE™, the company’s flagship remote monitoring software platform, is enabling many of the nation’s most renowned electrophysiologists, device clinics, and healthcare systems to effectively manage their device patient populations. With PaceMate, healthcare organizations can experience comprehensive interoperability and secure data exchange—significantly improving patient outcomes, reimbursements, and productivity.

***JOIN OUR TEAM***


Joining the PaceMate™ Team means becoming a vital part of a group that is dedicated to using technology to benefit patients, caregivers, and hospital administrators while driving healthy turnkey solutions that identify lost revenues and inefficiencies.


We are currently seeking a Remote full-time professional Payroll Specialist who will be responsible for planning, processing, and coordinating all payroll functions, to maintain high standards of quality in accordance with Company policies and procedures, state and federal laws and regulations. **CANDIDATE MUST HAVE EXPERIENCE WITH PROCESSING A COMPLET PAYROLL CYCLE FROM VALIDATING** **TIMECARDS** **THROUGH SUBMITTING PAYROLL FOR PROCESSING AND PAYMENT.**


PaceMate offers those employees working full-time a robust compensation and benefit package to include Health and Prescription coverage, Dental, Vision, Long-Term Disability, Short-Term Disability, AD&D, Flexible Spending Account, Healthcare Savings Account, 401k Retirement Savings, Discount Program, Employee Assistance Program, Financial Wellness Program, Paid Time Off, Legal Insurance, Hospital Indemnity, Critical Illness, and Accident Coverage.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Collaborating with employees to gather important payment information and update payroll records by entering any changes to employee information or benefits as provided from Employee Status Change Forms. Assisting in administration of garnishments, liens, and support orders.
* Processing employee paychecks by collecting their payroll data and timesheets. This includes verifying employee work hours and payment via the payroll system, issuing deductions, earnings, and other statements to employees. Processing of all bonuses, commission payments, and expense reimbursements.
* Reviewing of employee expense reports for reasonableness, supporting documentation and compliance with company policies. This includes reaching out to employees for missing support and asking questions about expenses submitted when needed. Use system-assisted, record keeping, preventing duplicate expense reimbursements and maintain a record of expense report violations. Assisting with preparation of payroll-related and expense report journal entries and prepare reports which include summaries of earnings, tax deductions, leave, and non-taxable wages.
* Assisting with the completion of verifications of employment, such as mortgage verifications, with request for YTD wages and the like.
* Investigating and resolving payroll discrepancies and answering any employee payroll inquiries.
* Maintaining all payroll operations according to company policies and procedures.
* Processing and issuing W-2 forms to employees and Form 1099s to contractors
* Serve as a backup to the AP function of maintaining contractor payment and collection of required documentation.
* Maintaining appropriate levels of current knowledge related to accounting, payroll, and employment law. Maintaining knowledge of payroll tax compliance and applicable filings.
* Evaluating the effectiveness of payroll software and supporting database as well as internal control systems.
* Developing and monitoring business performance metrics. Overseeing regulatory reporting, frequently including tax compliance.
* Maintaining basic knowledge of PaceMate products and services.
* Assisting in special projects, including assisting in the annual budget process, 401k, and SOC audits. Serve as backup for the Controller, mainly in the areas of payroll and expense reimbursements.
* Assisting in ensuring consistency in practices and PaceMate Mission, Vision, and Customer Service standards are met. Adhering to the Code of Conduct and all Company Policies and Procedures.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

 **I****ndividuals** **must have experience processing entire payroll cycle, from validating**  

**timecards** **through submitting payroll for processing and payment. Must show recent experience with processing the entire workflow from start to finish****.**

 **EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND EXPERIENCE**

* Undergraduate in finance or accounting preferred, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Three or more years of payroll experience; healthcare experience preferred.
* Must possess knowledge of all accounting applications, data processing functions and internal control requirements for accounting department.
* Must possess knowledge of and ability to operate computerized payroll accounting software, personal computer, Microsoft Excel, ten-key calculator, and phone.
* Must possess written and oral communication skills.
* Thorough understanding of supporting a remote or virtual workforce, with multi-State experience preferred.
* Ability to keep information confidential.
* Ability to work independently in a time-sensitive environment required. Knowledge of wage withholding orders.
* Accurate data entry skills with great attention to detail.
* Experience with Teams, Slack, DocuSign, Paychex, ADP, Concur, and NetSuite a strong plus.

**LICENSURE/CERTIFICATION** FPC or CPP a strong plus.


**REQUIRED EQUIPMENT**

* Must have access to stable, reliable internet access.

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**


An individual must be able to perform each Essential Function of the job satisfactorily.


Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities,


who are otherwise qualified, to perform the essential functions. Nothing within this job


description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to


this job at any time.


While performing the duties of this job, the employee is consistently required to remain in a


stationary position, constantly operate a computer or other office equipment, and frequently.


communicate with customers and employees. Must be able to exchange accurate information,


with the ability to effectively, utilize voice over internet protocol; and repetitive motions using.


fingers and forearms in data entry.

 **About PaceMate**  

Recognized as a Top 100 Healthcare Technology Company by Healthcare Technology Report, PaceMate offers the most comprehensive remote cardiac monitoring solution in the industry. PaceMateLIVE is the only clinical dashboard with user-friendly integrations for all implantable cardiac devices, ambulatory monitors, consumer ECGs, and heart failure products. PaceMate’s Auto-Triage™ prioritizes patients based on clinician-customized standards—not device alerts—resulting in a substantial reduction in alert burden. With the most live connections through EHR-partnered integrations across Epic, Cerner, and athenahealth, PaceMate offers a true, vetted, and validated industry-leading solution for interoperability: ensuring bi-directional data transfer for more accurate reporting, streamlined workflows, and one-click billing. PaceMate’s software-only, concierge on-demand, and full-service offerings deliver a flexible, customized solution for cardiac practices. Visit PaceMate.com to learn how one platform is transforming the future of digital health.

title: Distance Learning Digital Specialist (Remote)
description:
**Position Summary:**


This position requires understanding of online instruction and digital instructional design. Responsibilities include leveraging online education expertise to assist customers with the implementation of online science classes. As a subject matter expert (SME), developing new labs and investigations is imperative to assisting customers with lab design and course development.

 **Primary Responsibilities:**


1. Collaborate with the Distance Learning team to develop and recommend lab courses that support customers’ learning outcomes.


2. Create digital components for existing labs as supplements or replacements for lab course content.


3. Write, film, edit, and publish DL videos.


4. Create digital labs for missing content in product line.


5. Work closely with customers assisting with the implementation of online science courses. 6. Troubleshoot LTI integration issues with instructors or school’s LMS admin.


7. Manage DL content on CSO, and distribution of content to customers. Maintain records of virtual kit contents and virtual kits. Generate LTI codes and HTML passwords for virtual labs each semester.


8. Provide guidance and support to instructors as needed to ensure successful digital and hands-on lab experience for online students.


9. Performs Quality and User Acceptance Testing of new digital products.


10. Stays on top of digital trends in education including LMS and devices and identifies how Carolina can integrate with trends.


11. Develop a deep understanding of the college distance learning market.


12. Maintains relationships with educators, universities, and associations to enhance company credibility and identify new opportunities for the sales team.


13. Works with the Digital Manager and other stakeholders to evaluate and integrate digital resources for DL products.


14. Provide technical support for internal and external customers. Provide necessary tools, content, and training across departmental teams to ensure that customer touch points are consistent and impactful.

 **Secondary Responsibilities:**


1. Prepares for and attends appropriate industry events.


2. Performs other administrative duties as required.

 **Qualifications:**

**Education—**


Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field is required. Relevant fields include computer science, information systems, or instructional design. An additional degree in science or related content expertise is highly preferred.

 **Experience—**


3-5 years of experience with Microsoft Office suite, Adobe Acrobat and Premiere Rush, and web files (HTML, CSS, CSV, and JSON specifically) required. One year experience with Higher Ed LMS (Blackboard, Canvas, D2L, Moodle) required. Experience with LMS as an admin a plus. Agile development experience and leadership highly preferred. Articulate Storyline experience a plus.

 **Specialized Training/Skills/Certificates/Licenses—**


Project Management training/experience a plus. Ability to effectively plan, implement, and monitor self-directed and group projects. Must possess good written and oral communication skills. Strong content knowledge of subject area is necessary.

title: Revenue Operations Specialist (Remote Job, may be based anywhere in the US)
description:
**Job Title:** Revenue Operations Specialist (Remote Job, may be based anywhere in the US)

**Overview:** 

Inkling is looking for highly capable Revenue Operations Specialist to ensure that we capitalize on the benefits offered by our Salesforce CRM, Gainsight customer success platform, Sales & Marketing tech stack, and all the applications they integrate with. As a member of the Revenue Operations team, you’ll be instrumental in supporting our quickly growing marketing, customer success, and sales teams and building out the systems and processes that will drive Inkling to the next level. Every day will bring new challenges and require cross-functional collaboration to solve problems like owning and improving our overall tech stack, CRM system logic, reporting/data quality, and improving marketing, customer success and sales processes. Success will be measured by user adoption and overall internal and external customer satisfaction.

The Revenue Operations Specialist reports directly to the Senior Vice President of Marketing & Revenue Operations. This person will work with sales, marketing, customer success, and finance to develop and administer the company's worldwide sales and renewals forecasts, administer the company's CRM tool, and calculate variable sales compensation plans. In addition, they will track and manage the performance analysis and metrics of the sales, customer success, and marketing organization using dashboards and reporting tools.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* As a Company administrator, manage our instance of Salesforce, Gainsight, and marketing systems, ensuring optimal performance of these business systems, as well as any integrated applications and software that feed into or out of them.
* Create Salesforce reports and dashboards for business stakeholders and executive team members, including but not limited to weekly reporting packages, period performance, quarterly business reviews, and board meeting materials.
* Own the build of variable compensation plans and commission payouts within CaptivateIQ and work with Finance team to calculate
* Manage the sales forecast and renewals forecast calls agenda and reporting.
* Work collaboratively across the sales, marketing, and customer success teams as a servant-leader.
* Manage escalations as needed from key stakeholders and business users, and work collaboratively to foster marketing, customer success and sales enablement.
* Maintain rigorous documentation processes, as well as provide training and end-user support.
* Act as a resident subject matter expert on our RevOps Tech Stack, which includes: LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Gainsight, Gong.io, MixMax, Hubspot, Salesforce, and CaptivateIQ

**Candidate Qualifications:**

* Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills to help translate business cases into technical solutions.
* Ability to communicate technical topics in a clear and concise manner using written, visual and oral communications.
* Ability to execute: can juggle multiple projects, fulfill priorities and meet deadlines.
* Strong organizational skills, with the ability to work independently as well as in a highly collaborative, team-based environment.
* Shared passion on documentation - enabling others in technical knowledge and processes.
* Familiarity with sales and marketing cycles (from lead gen to close) is preferred, but not required.
* 1 - 2 years of SFDC experience is preferred, but not required.
* Familiarity with the following Sales Tech Stack is preferred, but not required: LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Gainsight, Gong.io, MixMax, Hubspot, Salesforce

**Expectations once you’re on the Inkling Team:**

**Within 1 month…**

* Complete Inkling’s onboarding program designed to get you up to speed on our business, vision and team and gain an understanding about how your role fits into Inking's broader organization.
* Onboard with the Revenue Operations team to learn about our instance of Salesforce, our automated processes and workflows, and how our coverage model works. You’ll use this knowledge in your day to day work to make recommendations on process improvements.
* Learn about all the business applications that integrate with our CRM and marketing systems.
* Meet Inkblots through a series of 1:1s so you gain depth within our business processes and systems.

**Within 3 months…**

* Work towards becoming a CRM expert on existing workflows, process builders, integrations, change/case management approach.
* Build custom reports and dashboards in Salesforce to monitor efficiency across revenue operations.
* Own the execution of adhoc day to day CRM user escalations, feature requests, and other administrative requests.
* Participate in key Revenue Operations project initiatives with existing subject matter experts to learn and help drive successful change.

**Within 6 months…**

* Partner with key project management stakeholders to own and drive critical projects across our revenue operation.
* Maintain technical documentation across entire CRM and business processes.
* Work cross-functionally with our Customer, Finance, Marketing, and Sales teams to build rigor and strong communication around change management.
* Implement technical engagement metrics to ensure we are utilizing all tools to their full potential.
* Become a subject matter expert across our entire tech stack and be a point of contact for knowledge transfer.
* Make recommendations on reducing technical debt and setting up processes and systems to align with our overall business strategy.
* Start Trailhead SFDC path as outlined by manager to work towards earning SFDC badges and developing basic understanding of Salesforce functions and Revenue Operations
* Start studying for Gainsight NXT Associate Admin Certificate through Gainsight University

**Within 12 months…**

* Own the management and improvement of our entire revenue operations tech stack.
* Continuously improve our change management process to ensure communication up and down the organization is effective and optimized.
* Update system road maps that summarize upgrades and new feature additions that are needed to achieve business goals.
* Finish Trailhead SFDC path as outlined by manager to work towards earning SFDC badges and developing basic understanding of Salesforce functions and Revenue Operations
* Finish studying for Gainsight NXT Associate Admin Certificate through Gainsight University and sit for the exam
* Continuously evolve your initiatives to meet the ever-changing needs of Inkling’s business and customer base.

**What Benefits & Perks Does Inkling Offer?:**

* Flexible PTO, 12 Paid Holidays + ½ Day Fun Fridays
* Medical, Dental and Vision Benefits
* Short and long-term disability insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid parental leave, and parental & caregiver benefits
* Monthly Wellness Reimbursement
* Monthly Cell Phone and Data/Internet Reimbursement
* Stipend to setup your home office
* Annual Learning & Development stipend
* 401(k) Program
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Pet insurance and other corporate discounts
* Employee resource groups for diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging
* A chance to work with a talented, smart and creative team!

**EEO Statement:** 

Inkling is an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply.

**Compensation Information:** 

Targeted salary range for this role is $55,000 - $70,000 annually.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid parental leave
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift

Work setting:

* Remote

Work Location: Remote

title: EDI Support Specialist
description:
**Who We are:**


SureCost is the leading provider of pharmacy purchasing and inventory management solutions. Our SaaS platform empowers pharmacies across the nation to streamline their operations, reduce costs, and stay compliant in an increasingly complex and competitive landscape. We are committed to delivering innovative solutions to pharmacies so they can simplify their daily activities and focus on providing the best patient care possible.


At SureCost, we think work/lifebalance should have, well, balance. With team members across the United States, we value the freedom of fully remote work, flex hours, and unlimited PTO.  

  

**What You’ll Do:**


We’re seeking an EDI Support Specialist to manage and support SureCost’s B2B EDI (electronic data interchange) processes between our organization and external trading partners (wholesalers, distributors, manufacturers, pharmacy management systems, accounting systems, etc.), with a particular focus on utilizing SureCost, our pharmaceutical procurement and spend management solution. This role involves ensuring the efficient and accurate exchange of electronic documents, troubleshooting and resolving EDI-related issues, maintaining strong relationships with vendors and customers, and maintaining comprehensive documentation of EDI processes and configurations, including those related to SureCost and its trading partners.

* Mastering SureCost features, internal tools, and EDI requirements for various trading partners
* Collaborating with internal teams and trading partners to swiftly resolve communication issues
* Efficiently handling and documenting EDI-related support tickets using standardized procedures
* Liaising with internal and external teams to resolve complex EDI issues and ensuring customer satisfaction
* Providing comprehensive support to internal staff on EDI processes, troubleshooting, and SureCost integrations
* Monitoring EDI files to resolve unidentified accounts and process EDI termination requests
* Contributing to the internal knowledge base for the team's benefit
* Proactively engaging with current trading partners for updated information exchange
* Maintaining meticulous documentation of EDI processes and configurations, especially related to SureCost
* Developing content for customer help center articles related to SureCost integration
* Providing support for B2B Mailbox and handling EDI communication channel updates, queries, and issues
* Sharing responsibilities for weekend and nightly on-call duties for B2B communication support

**What You’ll Need:**

* 2-5 years of EDI or similar technical/software support experience
* Knowledge of EDI standards and protocols, including ANSI X12
* Experience working remotely, self-managing multiple applications and priorities
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a knack for building interpersonal relationships
* Detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
* Previous experience in the pharmaceutical supply chain industry is a plus!

**Perks and Benefits:**


We are proud to offer generous benefits including:

* Fully Remote
* Unlimited PTO (Highly suggested 3-week minimum)
* Flex Hours
* 100% healthcare premiums covered for employees
* 70% healthcare premiums covered for dependents
* Low cost-to-employee vision and dental
* Automatic 3% employer addition to 401k
* 12 weeks of fully paid Parental Leave
* Technology stipend to cover the equipment you need to set up your home office
* Professional development reimbursement

*SureCost is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.*

*We are required by federal law to verify the identity and employment eligibility of all persons hired to work in the United States. We participate in E-Verify (Employment Verification). We will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with the information from each new employee's Form I-9 to confirm work authorization.*

*Please be advised that, if selected for this position, a background check may be conducted as a condition of employment upon acceptance of a contingent job offer.*

title: Benefits Implementation Specialist
description:
***Note: Open to remote opportunities - candidates that reside within Twin Cities MN preferred. This position may be required to travel up to 25-30% within the Southeastern region, including but not limited to TX, FL, GA, NC, SC.***


At Procare HR, we're on a mission to transform workforce outcomes for care providers through our industry-focused HR services model. We offer comprehensive HR services, including payroll processing, benefits administration, workers compensation management, and general HR support. Our core values drive our culture, emphasizing positivity, curiosity, accountability, gratitude, and growth.

**Who We Are - Core Values**

* *We strike the gong* – Actions have a ripple effect. Every engagement is an opportunity to have a positive impact on our clients and team.
* *We laugh* – Laughter is contagious. Keep it light when things are tough. Life is short, celebrate.
* *We explore* – Individual curiosity and resourcefulness lead us to better solutions.
* *We show up* – Sense of duty and accountability is part of our DNA. How we show up matters.
* *We are grateful* – We are grateful for our clients and for each other, and approach all situations with humility. We appreciate the experiences that have shaped us.
* *We grow* - We embrace the struggle that comes with personal growth so that we can better ourselves and our team.

**About The Role**  

This role serves as part of the *“new client welcome committee”* and will be responsible for coordinating and implementing employee benefit programs for our clients who utilize our PEO services. This position serves as the primary point of contact for clients during the implementation process, ensuring a smooth transition and successful integration of benefits programs. Our ideal candidate has strong project management skills, a deep understanding of benefits administration, excellent communication abilities with PEO or Shared Services experience, and a passion for helping others. We also value integrity, team spirit, and strong organizational skills.  

  

**Responsibilities**  

**Benefits Implementation**


* Act as primary benefits contact for new benefit clients and client conversions through first 1 to 2 payroll cycles post benefits change
* Coordinate with client stakeholders and internal teams, such as Implementation, Benefit Operations, Payroll, and Workforce Technology to project manage the timely and accurate setup of new client master and client-sponsored benefit plans
* Setup and assign client benefits, ACA profiles, and S-Corps
* Gather and clean client-sponsored data and benefit deductions for Benefit Operations to import
* Plan and manage internal system and internal and client user testing.
* Partner with Benefits Operations to research, problem-solve, and resolve benefit setup issues
* Manage carrier access – credentials, testing, visibility, transition to Benefits Operations, etc
* Collaborate with Payroll and Workforce Technology to resolve benefit deduction issues
* Document and handoff benefit management requirements to Benefits Administrators and Benefits Operations team
* Participate in benefits implementation discovery calls when needed, review setup requirements and demo functionality with new client (as needed
* Responsible for meticulously updating, diligently maintaining, and tracking activities in the Asana platform
* Identify, communicate, and mitigate benefits implementation project risks
* Provide a high-level of customer service during set-up and implementation
* Plan and revise standardized user testing/auditing, training, forms, and processes in partnership with Benefits Operations system testing
* Serve as the backup for benefits HRIS administration functions

**Open Enrollment (OE)*** Assist in project managing the open enrollment process for new and existing clients during major annual enrollment periods, excluding one-off existing client OEs
* Draft and send employee communications
* Develop benefit and eligibility guides

**Benefits Consulting*** Assist Implementation in gathering all necessary client information and documentation required for benefits program implementation
* Support benefits comparison analysis and development of presentations
* Support employee benefit education
* Troubleshoot enrollment issues, address billing discrepancies, and resolve employee inquiries
* Approve enrollments and complete manual carrier file uploads
* Coordinate with Benefits Ops to ensure client data is added to any necessary file feeds
* Conduct enrollment audits and reconciliation to ensure accurate and compliant enrollment data, resolving any discrepancies or issues

**This Role is a Good Fit if You**

* Have a bachelor's degree in Human Resources or relevant work experience
* Possess 3+ years of experience in Human Resources and Benefits Compliance
* Possess 3+ years of HRIS knowledge and experience, UKG Ready preferred
* Preferably have experience in the PEO or HR Shared Services industry

title: Virtual Alarm Technical Support Specialist
description:
**Company Overview:**  

ADT has been in the business of helping save lives since 1874. As the #1 smart home security provider in the U.S., we help protect and connect families, businesses and larger commercial customer every day. Our continuous innovation, advanced technology and strategic partnerships deliver products and services that help protect life and valuables, whether at home, your business or on the go. And as times change, so do we.Above all, our mission is clear: we help save lives for a living. Looking for a career where you can make a real impact? Join our team today and put purpose behind your paycheck. #WeAreADT
*Check out more about life at ADT* here.
Check out more about life at ADT here.


**Position Summary:**  

Provide assistance installing and troubleshooting both new and existing ADT products while working directly with Customers and Field Branches; correcting issues to prevent unnecessary truck rolls.



This ultimately allows our current and future customers to receive top notch service virtually for any of their ADT products and improves overall customer experience. Must possess strong ability to interact with customers remotely in order to negotiate spending time on the phone, working through the alarm issue remotely vs. receiving service within home or business. Strong communication skills and ability to empathize with customer, breaking down problems into understandable/common terms is also necessary. Basic technical knowledge and understanding of how various systems interact with each other and provide sound/consistent installation. Understanding and utilization of various applications and tools such as Alarm.com, Alarmnet.com, 3PS, IT3, Pulse Admin, Informix, MasterMind, NICAD, Signal On Demand, and Geo Link systems is required to install.


**Major Responsibilities:**


* Answering incoming and placing outbound calls to existing customers to help answer technical assistance questions and providing solutions.
* Troubleshooting ADT products and services and enhancing the customer experience through excellent communication of complex situations and solutions.
* Demonstrate a strong knowledge of ADT products and services to help enhance the ADT customer experience.
* Installation of ADT products and enhancing the customer experience through excellent communication of services offered and provide solutions to situations.
* Closely working with local ADT offices to schedule service appointments or other system maintenance to help protect customers.
	+ Landline Communication Failures
	+ Cell/Radio Failures
	+ Pulse Gateway offline
	+ Command Panels, Nanos
	+ Doorbells, Thermostats
	+ Garage Door controls
	+ Wifi extenders
	+ Camera’s (offline, not recording, black screens, clips not saving)
	+ Pulse/Command Apps
	+ Zwaves, Programming issues

**Schedules:**



Mid and Second Shift in Eastern Standard Time.


**Qualifications**

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**


* Technical aptitude, problem solving skills and ability to prioritize multiple items at once
* A minimum of one (1) year of technical customer service experience
* High school diploma or equivalent
* Some college credits: degree preferred


Other:


* Paid virtual training – some in-person attendance may be required based on business needs.
	+ At least 10 mbps broadband internet connection with the ability to hardwire via ethernet from cable modem to your PC
		- If you do not meet these requirements, you will be able to train in the center and does not disqualify you from the position.
* Casual, yet energetic and engaging work environment
* A culture of coaching, development, and career growth opportunities


**Pay and Benefits Disclosure:**

The pay range for this role is $16.01- $21.23 an hour, and is based on experience and qualifications. We offer employees access to healthcare benefits, a 401(k) plan and company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, wellbeing benefits and paid time off among others. Employees accrue up to 120 hours in their first year. Your accrual rate increases after your first year. We also offer 6 paid holidays.



Anticipated application end date will be on 3/10/2024.

  

  

***ADT is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building an inclusive team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. ADT strives to ensure every employee and applicant feels valued. Visit us at jobs.adt.com/diversity to learn more.***

title: Product Specialist (Remote)
description:
**Product Specialist**

**NativePath** seeks an experienced **Product Specialist** to join our **Product Development Team**! This person will be responsible for all aspects of the product development process. This role will ensure the successful launch and support of all wellness supplements and paleo-based food products, including but not limited to coordinating the design and development of new products and changes to existing products. This position will provide cross-functional execution and support that drives business performance and optimizes business processes between multiple departments (Finance, Operations, Supply Chain, Demand/Production Planning, Product Development, and Brand Marketing) to ensure all aspects of the product development process are timely and accurately managed in accordance with the company’s internal and external customers. If you are goal-oriented, organized, and health-conscious, we invite you to contribute your expertise to our mission of guiding people on the path to eating, moving, and living in harmony with their biology.

### **Who are we:**
We’re firm believers that the Standard American Diet is the pitfall to several of the preventable health conditions arising in our society today (including heart disease, diabetes, and neurological disorders). That’s why we created NativePath—a health & wellness company that blends Ancestral Wisdom with Modern Science to offer over 30 different supplements, monthly wellness challenges, and free courses to restore and reset people's health. Since 2017, over 1 million people have gotten “On The Path” with us and, by doing so, have reversed pain, renewed energy, and aged more gracefully.

  

We provide a rewarding, collaborative, and exciting work environment that is focused on personal growth, with weekly company-wide culture calls hosted by our leaders designed to foster team spirit, encourage movement, and build our community. This year, the entire company was flown to a ranch in Tucson, AZ, for team-building activities and had a blast while doing it!

### 
If the above resonates with you, we’d love to hear from you!

**Responsibilities:**

* Assist in optimizing processes between Operations, Product Development, Supply Chain, and demand planning.
* Plan, manage, and execute trial runs with Product Development
* Manage projects according to marketing calendar timelines and deliverables
* Prioritize and support product development initiatives, ensuring that processes and data are comprehensive, accurate, and consistent.
* Work closely with the Product Development team to streamline workflows and optimize research outputs.
* Collaborate with the Quality and Food Safety Departments to validate and ensure the accuracy of information related to product development.
* Implement measures to guarantee adherence to regulatory standards and industry best practices.
* Identify opportunities for process improvements and participate in developing and implementing corrective actions.
* Anticipate and mitigate potential process or product failures by working closely with Operations.
* Work closely with the manufacturing network on work orders, specifications, and SOPs to ensure quality outcomes

**Qualifications**:

* Strong project management capabilities, with experience using Monday.com or other similar software.
* Proven experience in commercialization and product development integration within the health/wellness supplements and food industries.
* Thorough knowledge of quality standards, food safety, and regulatory requirements.
* Familiarity with the stage gate process is strongly preferred.
* Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including production, research and development, and regulatory affairs.
* Strong computer literacy and math proficiency; ability to work with conversions, percentages, fractions, and convert units of measure.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills to convey quality-related information clearly and concisely.
* Able to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, effectively adapting to changes and challenges.

**Job Type:**
-------------

* Full-Time

 **Work Location & Schedule:**

* 100% Remote
* Monday-Friday (time and time zone, or flexible)

**Compensation, Benefits, & Perks:**
------------------------------------

* $55,000 - $80,000/yr salary **DOE**, and discretionary end-of-year bonus opportunity.
* Free NativePath products each month because our employee’s well-being is always top of mind.
* PTO and 8 paid holidays to recharge your batteries and be your best self.
* Jumpstart your week with our Monday Culture Call and develop deeper connections with the entire team, gain further knowledge of NativePath’s wellness philosophies, and participate in light movement sessions!
* Competitive benefits package, including health, dental, vision, and more.
* Access our 401K program to help secure your future as you grow with NativePath.
* 100% remote workplace because we know our best work happens when we’re in our natural habitats.
* Multi-level coaching and mentoring programs to expand your knowledge, skills, and perspectives.
* All-company events at incredible locations to bond with your colleagues (and have a little fun)

**Technology:**


We are a bring-your-own-device company. All team members must supply their own:

* Computer - PC or MAC with broadband internet and at least 8GB of RAM.
* Broadband Internet - minimum of 20 Mbps.

**Company Website & Social Media Links:**
-----------------------------------------

* www.nativepath.com
* www.facebook.com/nativepath
* https://www.instagram.com/nativepath/?hl=en
* https://www.linkedin.com/company/nativepath
* https://www.pinterest.com/NativePath/
* https://www.tiktok.com/@nativepath

title: Manhattan Integration Specialist
description:
Manhattan Integration/Configuration Specialist We are currently seeking a skilled and experienced Manhattan Integration/Configuration Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have expertise in Manhattan Integration Framework, with hands-on experience in webMethods, as well as proficiency in Manhattan TMS (Transportation Management System), particularly with MATM (Manhattan Active Transportation Management), including knowledge of the cloud version. Responsibilities:Design, develop, configure, and implement integrations using the Manhattan Integration Framework.  
Utilize web Methods to create and maintain integration solutions that connect various systems and applications.  
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather integration requirements and translate them into technical specifications.  
Configure and customize Manhattan TMS (Transportation Management System) to meet business needs and improve operational efficiency.  
Provide expertise in MATM (Manhattan Active Transportation Management), particularly with the cloud version, including configuration, optimization, and troubleshooting.  
Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration between Manhattan TMS and other enterprise systems.  
Develop and maintain documentation related to integration processes, configurations, and technical specifications.  
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in integration technologies and transportation management solutions.  
Provide technical support and guidance to internal teams and end-users as needed.  
Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.  
Proven experience working with Manhattan Integration Framework and webMethods.  
Hands-on experience with Manhattan TMS (Transportation Management System), preferably with MATM.  
Knowledge of cloud-based solutions and experience with MATM cloud version is highly desirable.  
Strong understanding of integration concepts, protocols, and technologies.  
Proficiency in XML, SOAP, REST, and other web services protocols.  
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.  
Effective communication and interpersonal skills.  
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.  
Relevant certifications in Manhattan Associates products are a plus.

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $50.00 per hour

Experience level:

* 7 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Manhattan Integration Specialist: 5 years (Preferred)
* Manhattan: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote
