title: EMR Integration Specialist - Prenatal
description:
**Do you want to join one of the fastest-growing molecular diagnostics companies to help transform prenatal and oncology diagnostics that can affect millions of patient lives?**


**BillionToOne**, ranked at the top 5% of Y Combinator companies with $300M+ in funding from prominent VC firms, has developed a DNA molecular counter that increases cfDNA diagnostic resolution by over 1,000 fold. BillionToOne's first product, UNITY™ is the first and only non-invasive prenatal test that can directly screen an unborn baby and assess its risk for common and severe recessive gene disorders and chromosomal abnormalities, as well as fetal sex and fetal antigens, from a single tube of blood from the pregnant mother without paternal testing.



In 2023, BillionToOne launched two liquid biopsy products that will markedly improve oncology treatment and care. With Northstar Select™, clinicians will be able to select cancer therapies that will be most effective to each patient based on their individual genetic makeup. Northstar Response™ will enable clinicians to monitor a patient's early response to these cancer therapies, by measuring minute changes in their ctDNA, which can reduce ineffective treatments and unwanted toxicity, lower costs, and substantially improve clinical outcomes.



BillionToOne is looking to hire its first **EMR Integration Specialist**, to act as a liaison between our prenatal sales representatives and healthcare providers. You will drive successful implementation of EMR integration and ensure healthcare providers' offices can easily access UNITY. You will collaborate with healthcare providers & hospital/systems IT departments to integrate with BillionToOne's products, and allow for a seamless end-to-end ordering process. This position offers an exciting opportunity to collaborate across a dynamic team and contribute to the advancement of highly innovative technology. This position is remote and will report to an Area Director, Prenatal.

**Responsibilities:**
* Develop and maintain expertise of all BillionToOne EMR solutions; consistently optimize solution offerings and implementation processes
* Collaborate with healthcare providers/systems and their IT teams to develop and execute implementation plans, ensuring on-time and on-budget delivery with the highest level of customer satisfaction
* Lead key activities such as workflow assessment, roll-out planning, training plans, change management, Go-Live Support, Post Go-Live Support planning, coordination of legal agreements
* Coordinate internal and client teams to complete Data Migration, Content Development, Interfaces, Enrollment, and Billing Configuration work streams
* Provide end-user training
* Post-integration, own the live customer relationship and act as main point of contact for any integration issues, changes, etc.
* Educate BTO sales teams and external clients on EMR Integration
* Navigate and champion IT project requests
* Work closely with sales representatives to continuously evaluate and enhance the onboarding experience.

**Requirements:**
* Minimum 3+ years of experience implementing EMR systems, electronic health records, or patient/provider portals, ideally at a diagnostic company or CLIA lab
* Strong understanding of CLIA labs, healthcare organizations, and the end-to-end EMR integration process, and how to bridge together all 3
* Proven healthcare project management experience with successful track record of managing deadlines, customers, and schedules
* Strong ability to build effective relationships with clients and staff at all levels
* Very tech-savvy – previous experience in a technical role is a plus
* Ability to work cohesively with cross-functional teams, both internally and externally, and effectively manage expectations
* Willingness to travel up to 50% throughout the US

**Nice to Haves:**
* Experience with HL7 FHIR
* Existing IT contacts at health systems/IDNs


**Benefits And Perks:**


* Working with a team of 'rockstars' who bring out the best in everyone
* Open, transparent culture that includes weekly Town Hall meetings
* The ability to indirectly or directly change the lives of hundreds of thousand patients
* Multiple medical benefit options; employee premiums paid 100% of select plans, dependents covered at 80%
* Extremely generous Family Bonding Leave for new parents (16 weeks, paid at 100%)
* Retirement savings program including a 4% Company match
* Free daily on-site lunches provided from top eateries
* Latest and greatest hardware (laptop, lab equipment, facilities)
* A variety of perks on campus (state of the art gym, restaurant)
* Free on-site EV charging (compatible with all EVs, including Tesla)


At BillionToOne, we are proud to offer a combination of a (1) base pay (2) generous equity options offering, on top of (3) industry leading company benefits (free healthcare options, 401k match, very generous fully paid parental leave etc.).



This position offers a starting package of a base of $115,000 & total compensation of $165,000 with commissions, if at plan. Commissions potential is uncapped and can be significant.


*BillionToOne is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*

title: Procurement Specialist
description:
The Procurement Specialist role will support the implementation of CAF’s procurement operating framework work at the Chef Ann Foundation, ensuring that this critical piece of support increases School Food Authorities sustainable procurement and integration of local ingredients in scratch cook operations.

  

**About the Chef Ann Foundation**



Founded in 2009, the Chef Ann Foundation (CAF) believes that all children should have equal access to fresh, healthy, delicious food providing them the foundation to thrive and meet their true potential. We ensure that school food professionals have the resources, funding and support they need to provide cook-from-scratch meals that support the health of children and our planet. To date, we’ve reached over 14,100 schools and over 3.4 million children in all 50 states.


**Job Description**



This position provides technical and administrative support for the day-to-day operation of CAF’s procurement program and will be responsible for troubleshooting and resolving technical issues, ensuring smooth operation of systems and processes. This position resides on our School Food Operations team and reports to the Senior Procurement Specialist. This role will primarily support the Healthy School Food Pathway program, Get Schools Cooking, and specialized programming, where they will support and complete assessments of school food service departments' purchasing, bid processes, clean label initiatives, and menus. Additionally, they may provide technical assistance to food service professionals based on areas of expertise. It is expected that this role will play a critical part in evolving the purchasing power of school food programs and creating connections and relationships with local growers, farmers and producers.


* Healthy School Food Pathway is a work-based learning program that aims to prepare individuals for job opportunities in healthy, scratch-cook school food programs through hands-on and virtual learning.
* Get Schools Cooking (GSC) is an intensive 3-year assessment and strategic planning program that provides public k-12 schools with the operational knowledge to transition from a heat & serve to scratch cook operational model.
* Specialized Programming presents a unique opportunity for a district or multiple districts to receive individualized and direct support for improving their meal programs, including Virginia Food for Virginia Kids, Arizona’s Creating Your Kitchen, and implementation work in California districts as well as other states.

  


**Key Responsibilities**


* Support the Senior Procurement Specialist in the development and execution of CAF’s procurement operating framework and subsequent programing across the organization.
* Responsible for teaching our partner districts how to connect their operations to regenerative farms, local products, and high-quality protein producers.
	+ In regions where CAF works identify local and sustainable sources of top agricultural commodities and/or artisan products and facilitate connections between distributors, producers and SFAs with the goal of empowering SFAs to begin local sourcing programs and
	+ Others to be determined.
* Supports the development and dissemination of tools, guidance and the facilitation of place-based gatherings at a regional, statewide and national level to promote the awareness of, availability of and purchase of locally grown, Organic, climate smart and clean label ingredients for use by K12 food service department
	+ Assist with hosting CAF procurement webinars,
	+ Assist with drafting CAF procurement newsletter and
	+ Others to be determined.
* Provides technical assistance to School Food Authorities participating in CAF programming (such as HSFP, Get School Cooking, PLANTS, etc.)
	+ Performs data collection and analyze as it relates to school food purchases,
	+ Support the CAF team and Sr. Procurement Specialist to perform district assessments,
	+ Work with School Food Authorities in drafting procurement plans and/or strategies to optimize and increase the number of local procurements conducted and
	+ Others to be determined.
* Other duties as assigned.


**Position Requirements**


* Ability to travel for work, up to 30% of the time.
* Strong project management skills, including time management and clear communication.
* Ability to balance and prioritize competing timelines/deliverables.
* Knowledge of and/or work experience in school food preferred.
* Knowledge of and/or work experience in sustainable food systems and food production preferred.
* Bachelor’s Degree preferred.
* Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office and GSuite platforms, especially on Mac OS.
* Ability to work independently virtually.
* A minimum of 5 years’ experience of procurement related work with food.

  


**Essential Traits**


* Ability to outreach and connect with new farmers, food vendors and school districts.
* A passion for food systems and a strong interest in childhood health and wellness.
* Strong professional relationship cultivation and management skills that translate into building strong partnerships.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Flexible mindset and innovative thinker.
* Willingness to engage in continuous learning and training.

  


**Compensation**



Compensation ranges between $65,100 - $86,100 per year and will be commensurate with the candidate’s previous experience and credentials. This is a limited-term position with funding guaranteed until December 2025. Future funding to be determined in quarter two of 2025. The Chef Ann Foundation is a great place to work and provides its staff with a competitive benefits package, including medical, pharmacy, dental, vision, short term disability, long term disability, group life insurance, 403(b) retirement plan with a match & Paid Time Off. We are a fully-remote organization whose headquarters are located in Boulder, CO, with team members spread across the US. This position is remote.



Posting will close on March 15, 2024



At the Chef Ann Foundation, our work to ensure access to fresh, healthy school food for all is built on the idea of equity. We support and celebrate differences, and our team and community are stronger with every new voice. CAF is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. CAF is committed to the incorporation of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) throughout our organization, including increased efforts to hire, support, and engage BIPOC, LGBTQ+ and other historically marginalized groups.

title: Customer Application Specialist
description:
**Job Description**

We are seeking a skilled Aspen Customization Developer to join our team. This position involves collaborating with Aspen customers to gather requirements, document specifications, and develop custom reports, imports, exports, and other functionalities tailored to their needs. As a key liaison between our Implementation team and clients, you will play a crucial role in understanding customer requirements, translating them into technical solutions, and delivering high-quality deliverables within specified timelines.

**Responsibilities**

- Engage with customers to understand their requirements for custom reports, imports, exports, and other Aspen functionalities.  
- Document customer requirements thoroughly and accurately.  
- Develop acceptance criteria in collaboration with stakeholders.  
- Create custom reports, imports, exports, and other Aspen customizations using Java programming language.  
- Provide deliverables to customers for feedback and iterate based on their input.  
- Estimate project timelines and work efforts, and manage time effectively to meet deadlines.  
- Collaborate with internal teams to ensure seamless integration of custom solutions.  
- Maintain clear and concise communication with customers throughout the development lifecycle.

**Requirements**

- Proficiency in Java programming language.  
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  
- Ability to understand and translate customer requirements into technical specifications.  
- Experience with estimating work efforts and managing project timelines.  
- Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.  
- Familiarity with JavaScript, JasperSoft iReport, CSS, HTML, and XML is a plus.  
- Prior experience in a developer/analyst role preferred.

**Nice to Have**

- Experience with JavaScript, JasperSoft iReport, CSS, HTML, and XML.  
- Familiarity with Aspen systems and processes.  
- Previous experience in a customer-facing role.

If you are a motivated individual with a passion for customer facing software development and a strong desire to deliver exceptional solutions to our customers, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $40,552.29 - $48,837.16 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 1 year

Shift:

* 8 hour shift

Weekly day range:

* Monday to Friday

Work setting:

* Remote

Work Location: Remote

title: Technical Support Specialist
description:
Are you a **Technical Support Specialist** with Docupace Experience? If so, we have a role for you!


Docupace is seeking a Technical Support Specialist. You must have (Docupace or Fintech experience); this role is 100% REMOTE!

**Who We Are:**


Docupace is an award-winning technology company built for the financial services and wealth management industry. For over 20 years, we’ve dedicated our resources to solving the most frustrating and time-consuming problems that advisors, broker-dealers, and RIAs face daily.


From our headquarters in Culver City, CA and, our team is built from a diverse set of talents: software developers, technology leaders, compliance and security specialists, mathematicians, management experts, financial professionals, client services geniuses—they all come together to make us the leading universal workflow and document management automation software choice for financial service and wealth management firms and their advisors everywhere.

**Summary of Position:**


The Technical Support Specialist provides the best guidance, support, and product experience for the Customer Care Team and Docupace clients. As a Technical Support Specialist, you will provide technical guidance, information, and procedural advice on complex service issues requiring knowledge of our Docupace Platform, financial services, and internal business processes. The technical support specialist will handle all escalated support issues that Customer Support Specialists do not resolve. You will be responsible for managing the issue to completion, even if it is assigned to other contributors. While reporting to the Support Manager, this is a more technical position. You will be working in a team environment across all internal departments, along with some external client interaction and third-party vendors.


At Docupace, we measure our success by our customers’ success. We collaborate with our customers to help them leverage their use of our products for maximum impact. We ensure that all our customers are satisfied and advocate for our products. Our teammates are crucial to providing observations and insightful customer feedback so we can continuously improve the user experience and make it one that consistently exceeds expectations.

**Essential Duties/Responsibilities:**

* Technical Support: Respond to support tickets on time, troubleshoot software issues, and provide solutions.
* Work with Jira to manage and track issues effectively.
* Respond promptly to support requests based on the SLAs provided. Work within the SLA boundaries and escalate when the SLA is not met.
* Use product training and technical skills to investigate and resolve issues.
* Provide advanced assistance to users and tier 1 support for complex issues, delivering clear and understandable guidance to non-technical personnel.
* Develop and conduct user training sessions to improve their proficiency with company software and systems.
* Proactively maintain and enhance the company's Wiki/knowledge base for future reference. Regularly review and update technical documentation to ensure accuracy and comprehensiveness. Identify potential or actual technical problems and escalate them to appropriate higher-level professionals when necessary.
* Support API-related issues and guide the integration of external APIs with internal systems. Work closely with development teams to troubleshoot and resolve API connectivity and performance issues.
* On complex issues unable to be resolved without additional technical resources, flag for a retrospective on what would be required for them to be able to resolve
* Work with Customer-level support to gather the necessary details to reproduce and investigate.
* Communicate with Technical Support Specialist – Engineering, SRE, Developers, and others when unable to resolve for additional guidance.
* Own issues from start to finish and report to the Customer Support Specialist with updates.
* Additional Support responsibilities may be assigned.

**Minimum Education, Skills, and Experience:**

* 2+ years of customer support experience
* A logical approach to troubleshooting and deductive reasoning
* Understanding of how to read and write SQL.
* Basic understanding of databases
* Strong knowledge and experience with RESTful and SOAP APIs, including understanding web services and the ability to troubleshoot and consume APIs effectively.
* Understanding of IT principles
* Good communication skills in English
* Good writing skills in English
* Experience with Excel and Word
* Minimal programming experience in a programming language is a plus.
* Prior experience using the Docupace platform and working in financial services is a plus.

**Physical Demands and Working Conditions:**

* Sit – Frequent
* Stand- Occasional
* Walk - Frequently
* Lift/Carry 0-20 pounds – Occasional
* Kneel/crouch, bend and /or stoop repeatedly - Occasional

**Reasonable Accommodations:**


Applicants and employees who require reasonable accommodation to complete the duties and responsibilities described above should notify Human Resources.

title: Operations Specialist, Strategic Initiatives (Remote)
description:
**Who You Are:**  

You are a detail-oriented and support-driven professional, passionate about contributing to the success of internal high impact strategic initiatives. This is a unique opportunity to contribute to our company's growth and efficiency while working in a collaborative and forward-thinking environment.  

  

**About The Role:**  

As an Operations Specialist, Strategic Initiatives, you will play a crucial role in the Services Operations team, focusing on converting our strategy into action with impact to our clients and employees. Tasked with transforming strategic objectives into effective business solutions, you will be responsible for comprehensive requirements gathering, and strategic process improvement for key initiatives. Collaborating seamlessly with cross-functional teams, you will utilize your exceptional organizational and communication skills to coordinate resources, create action plans, and facilitate discussions with key stakeholders.


**Additional Responsibilities:**


* Business Process Optimization: Collaborate with key stakeholders to identify, analyze, and streamline existing business processes. Develop and implement strategies to enhance efficiency, reduce redundancies, and improve overall operational effectiveness and client experience.
* Project Coordination: Lead and coordinate strategic initiatives aimed at optimizing business processes. Develop comprehensive project plans, ensuring alignment with organizational goals, and oversee the execution of initiatives from conception to completion.
* Process Improvement: Apply industry best practice principles to analyze and enhance business processes. Utilize a data-driven approach to identify and eliminate defects, ensuring optimal performance and quality.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, define project scopes, and ensure seamless integration of optimized processes across various departments. Foster effective communication and collaboration to achieve shared objectives.
* Automation Requirements: Identify opportunities for process automation, ensuring that requirements are translated into efficient and effective automated solutions.
* Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of business processes, changes, and improvements. Prepare and present regular reports on the status and impact of implemented process optimizations to key stakeholders.
* Continuous Improvement: Proactively identify opportunities for ongoing improvement in business processes. Stay informed about industry best practices, emerging trends, and technological advancements, and apply this knowledge to drive continuous enhancement within the organization.
* Change Management: Develop strategies to manage and mitigate challenges during the implementation of process improvements. Foster a positive, agile and adaptive culture within the organization.
* Quality Assurance: Develop and implement quality control measures and systems to ensure that optimized processes meet established standards and contribute positively to overall operational efficiency.
* Security Compliance: Adhere to ongoing security protocols and training, maintaining alignment with company policies.
* Other duties as assigned.


**Desired Skills and Experience:**


* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, or a related field or equivalent experience
* 2 to 4 years proven experience in process improvement roles
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Exceptional organizational and communication skills
* Six Sigma Green Belt or Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) certification strongly preferred
* Experience gathering requirements and implementing automation solutions
* Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams
* Familiarity with project management methodologies and tools
* Detail-oriented and able to manage multiple tasks effectively
* Knowledge of change management principles is a plus


**A Little About Us**



Our mission is to challenge and enable our employees to achieve great things.


**We live and breathe our core values:**


* **We Before Me:** We demonstrate empathy through our actions and solicit diverse voices and opinions. We put ourselves in each other's shoes, readily admit our mistakes, and generously share our time and knowledge.
* **Dare To Be Great:** We are big-picture thinkers who focus on solutions to problems. We solicit and offer actionable feedback to others without hesitation. We embrace opportunities to improve ourselves, our teams, and our work. We aim to be the best of the best.
* **Own It:** We set clear expectations, communicate proactively, and follow through on our commitments. We take pride in the experiences we create and the outcomes we deliver. We are personally invested in the success of our team and our clients. We iterate to deliver ever better results.


We are consistently listed among Inc & Crain's "Best Places to Work" and we're proud of our accessible & engaged executive team. We believe in cultivating an atmosphere of inclusion and providing an environment that enables every employee to work to the best of their ability.


**Some of Our Benefits**


* Unlimited Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Paid Parental Leave
* Company-funded 401k contributions
* 100% employer covered individual & family health insurance plans provided
* Transparent, candid culture with 1:1 coaching, performance reviews, and a consistent feedback loop
* Quirky, diverse, respectful, high-performing coworkers you'll want to achieve greatness with!


Must be based in the United States.



Pursuant to the NYC Pay Transparency Law, the base salary range in New York City for this position is $65,000 - $75,000 plus opportunities for bonus and/or commission programs. Compensation in other geographies may vary.



Myriad360 is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Equity Program Specialist (Remote)
description:
**Equity Program Specialist (Remote)**
At Salas O’Brien we tell our clients that we’re engineered for impact. This passion for making a difference applies just as much to our team as it does to our projects. That’s why we’re committed to living our values every day: inspiring, achieving, and connecting as shared owners of our success with a focus on a sustainable future.
Building for the long-term means that all of our team members can expect to work on amazing projects with a people-first approach to problem solving. It also means that each member of our team has truly limitless potential to build a unique, meaningful, and high-impact career—and they’ll receive great total rewards along the way.
**About Us:**
Founded in 1975, Salas O’Brien is an employee-owned engineering and professional services firm focused on achieving impact for our clients, our team, and the world. We know that tomorrow’s requirements are today’s opportunities, and we are here to design lasting solutions for pressing challenges.
We work across a variety of industries providing integrated engineering and consulting services. Our specialized experience includes design for data centers, healthcare, science and technology, high-rise buildings, clean energy, education, and other building types as well as structural and building sciences, infrastructure asset management, advanced robotics, and more.
Our technical expertise is paired with an exceptional team of business development, human resources, finance and accounting, information technology, and marketing professionals, all of whom play a key role in bringing our commitments to life every day.
**Job Summary:**
The Equity Program Specialist will lead the development and implementation of a comprehensive process for managing the company’s private equity program within the United States and Canada. This position will be responsible to foster awareness, understanding, and engagement with eligible team members by creating educational materials and communications in support of the equity programs. The Equity Program Specialist will partner with Finance, executives, and external partners to ensure the successful execution and adherence to the equity program guidelines. This role must demonstrate technical expertise, regulatory knowledge, and interpersonal skills to ensure the effective management and communication of the company’s equity programs.
**In this role, you will be responsible for the following areas:**
* Manage the US and Canadian equity programs, including equity grants, stock options, restricted stock units (RSUs), deferred stock units (DSUs), synthetic equity, and other equity-based awards.
* Maintain accurate records and databases related to equity grants, participant information, vesting schedules, and transactions.
* Lead the creation of educational materials, including trainings, workshops, presentations, and written resources, to promote awareness and understanding of equity programs.
* Serve as the primary point of contact for team members with equity compensation related questions.
* Communicate equity program details, changes, and updates to team members and stakeholders.
* Provide guidance to team members on equity compensation, including tax implications, vesting schedules, and exercising options.
* Maintains the equity management system including records of vesting schedules, exercise history, and processing.
* Collaborate with finance, legal, and other departments to ensure seamless integration and alignment of equity programs with company policies and objectives.
* Partner with external vendors, consultants, and legal counsel as needed for plan administration and compliance.
* Identify opportunities for process enhancements and implement best practices to streamline equity program administration.
* Develop and maintain documentation, policies, and procedures related to equity program administration.
* Support Ad-hoc projects related to equity management as required.


**You will be a great fit if:**
* You have high energy, high empathy, and enjoy solution-oriented problem-solving in a dynamic environment.
* You are comfortable navigating ambiguity and can manage day to day responsibilities while building for the future.
* You are a genuine collaborator, an empathetic listener, and an excellent decision-maker with sound judgment.
* You have strong project coordination skills and are able to map out projects successfully.
* You can build rapport with stakeholders across all functions and levels of seniority, establishing yourself as a go-to business partner and trusted advisor.
* You have a proven track record of taking initiative and driving results, showcasing a proactive and outcome-oriented approach.
* You have the ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team, fostering a cooperative and productive work environment.


**Qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree in human resources, business administration, finance or a related field.
* Demonstrated experience (5+ years) in private stock equity compensation administration or a related field.
* Strong understanding of private stock equity compensation plans, stock option agreements, RSUs and synthetic equity
* Experience with equity management software/systems such as Carta
* Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and compliance.
* Effective prioritization of tasks and time management to handle multiple responsibilities concurrently
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities to effectively collaborate and engage with internal and external stakeholders and senior leadership
* Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills
* Ability to summarize complex analysis and develop recommendations for an executive audience.
* Extremely proficient in Microsoft Office Suite; advanced skills required: Excel and PowerPoint
* Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.


  

**Location**: REMOTE
**Travel**: minimal
**Equal Opportunity Employment Statement**
Salas O’Brien provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state/provincial, or local laws. Salas O’Brien will accommodate the disability-related needs of applicants as required by law.
#LI-REMOTE

title: Platform Operations Specialist (Remote)
description:
#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.
About the Role:
CrowdStrike Services is seeking a Platform Operations Specialist who would be responsible for the planning, deployment, field and operational support of the CrowdStrike platform and related applications. The Platform/Operations Specialist (Platform Specialist) will have responsibility for all aspects of the deployment from the initial customer engagement, planning, installation, optimization/utility and follow on customer support for the CrowdStrike platform & applications.
What You’ll Do:* Deployment and Operations activities may include:
* Providing technical implementation, configuration, and troubleshooting assistance with the deployment of the CrowdStrike platform and associated applications
* Troubleshoot customer deployment issues across small to large enterprises
* Utilize and engineer native and 3rd party software deployment technologies
* Install CrowdStrike software both remotely and physically
* Develop scripts and processes around software deployment
* Plan and report software deployment status
* Work closely and collaboratively with customer information technology teams
* Leveraging CrowdStrike applications (Spotlight and Discover as an example) provide support to customers in vulnerability and asset management
* Assist customers with the integration of CrowdStrike into existing tools
* Ability to travel up to 50-60% of the time


What You’ll Need:* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or related discipline, and 5 years of experience performing IT deployments or in an end user/customer environment, as well as experience with the following:
* Deep understanding of software deployment technologies
* Highly knowledgeable on Windows, Mac, and Linux platforms
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications, Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, etc.
* Good communication and collaboration skills
* Broad experience in computer and network systems security
* Solid analytical/problem solving skills with capability to identify solutions to unusual and complex problems
* High level of motivation; self-starter; results driven
* Potential for extensive travel and assignment work exists (i.e. 3 month rotation at client site).


Preferred Experience:* Operating Systems: Windows, Linux, Mac
* Software Deployment: SCCM, Group Policy, McAfee EPO, IBM BigFix, Puppet, Chef, Citrix, PDQ, PsExec
* Scripting: PowerShell, Python, Perl, Bash, Batch


#LI-DL1
#LI-Remote
This role may require the candidate to periodically undergo and pass alcohol and/or drug test(s) during the course of employment.
Benefits of Working at CrowdStrike:* Remote-first culture
* Market leader in compensation and equity awards
* Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements
* Comprehensive and inclusive health benefits
* Physical and mental wellness programs
* Paid parental leave, including adoption
* A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities
* Offices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaboration


We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve.
CrowdStrike is committed to maintaining an environment of Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action. If you need reasonable accommodation to access the information provided on this website, please contact Recruiting@crowdstrike.com, for further assistance.
CrowdStrike participates in the E-Verify program.
Notice of E-Verify Participation
Right to Work
CrowdStrike, Inc. is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The base salary range for this position in the U.S. is $85,000 - $130,000 per year + variable/incentive compensation + equity + benefits. A candidate’s salary is determined by various factors including, but not limited to, relevant work experience, skills, certifications and location.
Expected Close Date of Job Posting is:04-09-2024

title: Integration Specialist, Point of Sales
description:
**About Us:**


Nationwide Marketing Group works on behalf of thousands of Independent appliance, furniture, bedding, electronics, specialty electronics, custom installation and rent-to-own dealers, helping them grow their businesses and thrive on their own terms. With more than 5,000 Members operating some 14,000 storefronts, Nationwide Marketing Group is the largest buying, marketing, and business support organization of its kind, representing billions in combined annual sales across the membership. For 50 years, the organization has remained committed to the independent channel, empowering Members with the scale, sophistication, and efficiencies they need to compete while delivering the unmatched business intelligence, tools and resources required to win in an ever-changing business environment. To learn more, visit our website at nationwidegroup.org or Nationwide Marketing Group LinkedIn

**Job Location: Open to US Remote** **Candidates**

**Job Summary:**


As an integral member of our business intelligence team, the Integration Specialist will play a pivotal role in orchestrating the harmonious experience for our members during the onboarding process. This role effectively establishes, maintains, builds and manages the onboarding pipeline for newly signed members. You understand the unique challenges that clients may face and are skilled at tailoring support to their specific needs. You will manage the customer experience, data intake, integrity and validity for data shared from third-party vendors and customers, monitor the process, and help us transform their data into information.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Engage with members, understand their needs, and guide them through the enrollment process
* Centralized point-of-contact and SME for the onboarding process; provides recommendations to internal staff to improve adoption and alignment into the program.
* Verify the accuracy and completeness of provided data, ensuring compliance with standards
* Maintain organized records of member information for reference and auditing purposes
* Intake and audit data from current and new data sources; ensuring efficient data integrity
* Performing data analysis of key problem areas to assist in the root cause analysis
* Performing data reconciliation to identify data irregularities
* Cross-referencing multiple systems to validate and document information
* Retaining adequate supporting documents for operational functions


**Job Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology or related field preferred or equivalent experience
* Minimum 1-2 years of customer management related experience and managing data intake / data analysis
* Proficient in Microsoft Office.
* Advanced level with Microsoft Excel; experience with Power Query, VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables and other Formulas
* Ability to combine analytics and project management skills for successful client conversions.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with clear attention to detail.
* Fast learner, able to master new concepts, theories, ideas, and processes with ease.
* Basic SQL querying knowledge is a plus
* Ability to prioritize and work under tight deadlines.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.

**Job Competencies:**

* Analytical
* Attention to detail
* Eager to learn
* Great communication skills


**Work Environment:**


Must be able to read, write, and communicate both verbally and in written form to express and exchange ideas. While performing the responsibilities of this job, the employee must be able to access all components of workstation and other office equipment. Frequent typing, writing, bending, and twisting. Must be able to lift up to 10 pounds.


General office environment with moderate noise. This position is mostly sedentary, involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time. A busy environment with many unscheduled interruptions. Frequent computer use at workstation for extended periods of time. Public contact position requiring appropriate business apparel.

title: SQL Specialist - Remote Work
description:
Who We are



BairesDev is proud to be the fastest-growing company in America. With people in five continents and world-class clients, we are only as strong as the multicultural teams at the heart of our business. To consistently deliver the highest quality solutions to our clients, we only hire the Top 1% of the best talents and nurture their professional growth on exciting projects.

title: Global Trade Compliance (GTC) Integration Specialist
description:
Rockwell Automation is a global technology leader focused on helping the world’s manufacturers be more productive, sustainable, and agile. With more than 28,000 employees who make the world better every day, we know we have something special. Behind our customers - amazing companies that help feed the world, provide life-saving medicine on a global scale, and focus on clean water and green mobility - our people are energized problem solvers that take pride in how the work we do changes the world for the better.
We welcome all makers, forward thinkers, and problem solvers who are looking for a place to do their best work. And if that’s you we would love to have you join us!
Job Description
The role reports to the GTC Global Export Manager and closely collaborates with multiple functions and leadership to develop and implement processes and strategic plans with the goal of aligning new businesses to Rockwell's Global Trade Compliance Program. This position can be remote. As the GTC Integration Specialist, you will develop and implement adoption strategies and will work with stakeholders to ensure understanding and support adoption plans.
Main Responsibilities:* Develop a strong understanding of the organization's trade compliance program and processes.
* Develop a deep understanding of mergers & acquisitions (M&A) new business models and assess the target's compliance programs, tools, platforms/systems and processes.
* Define, document, and deliver or facilitate deployment of new and existing import/export compliance processes, training, and tools.
* Develop and implement comprehensive adoption strategies and plans.
* Collaborate with M&A integration leader and other internal stakeholders to develop detailed project plans & integration plans for M&A activities, operationalizing and prioritizing trade compliance deliverables.
* Communicate with all levels within and outside of the GTC organization on progress for process deliverables, presentations, progress reports, risk assessments.
* Work with internal partners to provide strategic input into the Technology Roadmap, ensuring trade compliance needs are identified and funded.
* Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure adoption progress.
* Build a framework to provide ongoing support and assistance and maintain documentation of adoption plans, training materials, and resources.
* Deliver training to equip internal customers with the necessary knowledge for successful alignment to import/export processes.
* Main point for escalation of issues involving dependencies between GTC and the business unit through the execution of projects.
* Ensure and monitor GTC engagement with business functions and integration managers.


The Essentials- you will have:* Bachelor's degree
* Legal authorization to work in the US is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening


The Preferred- you might also have:* Trade Compliance background with expertise in export controls and sanctions
* Bachelors degree in international business or equivalent relevant experience
* Program/project management experience and coordination of activities.
* Oversee multiple programs simultaneously
* This role must be able to apply skills required to lead, influence, motivate and resolve conflict within a team environment to meet program goals efficiently.
* Influence teams and individuals without direct reporting relationship
* Work with large cross functional teams, at times remotely through audio and video conferencing
* Adjust working schedule, if needed, to manage working with teams in different time zones
* Experience with mergers & acquisitions (planning and integration processes)
* Experience managing, creating, planning and executing global trade programs.
* Project management or continuous improvement certification
* Ability to adapt quickly to new technologies and changing business requirements.
* Solid problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and critical thinking abilities
* Excellent understanding of business complexity and project interdependencies
* Ability to partner with multiple stakeholders and influence project decisions.
* Strong teamwork, customer service and organizational skills
* Excellent communication, influencing, and leadership skills.
* Collaborative style, which can create agreement across indirect reporting lines and peer groups.

* *This position is part of a job family. Experience will be the determining factor.*


What We Offer:* Health Insurance including Medical, Dental and Vision
* 401k
* Paid Time off
* Parental and Caregiver Leave
* Flexible Work Schedule where you will work with your manager to enjoy a work schedule that work with your personal life.
* To learn more about our benefits package, please visit at www.raquickfind.com.

*We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.**At Rockwell Automation we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right person for this or other roles.*
#LI-SW11
#LI-REMOTE
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer including disability and veterans.
If you are an individual with a disability and you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation during the application process, please contact our services team at +1 (844) 404-7247.

title: Email Marketing Specialist
description:
We’re looking for a self-driven, entrepreneurial-minded individual to be a member of a content creator operations team that’s responsible for scaling and expanding a portfolio of services and offerings across our network of content creators.


The Email Marketing Specialist will be focused on email capture and engagement, will provide technical support and troubleshooting for our network of publishers, work within email capture tools and ESPs to build engagement tactics and create optimized user journeys, and be the point person for the ongoing technical needs of our clients.

**What you'll be doing:**

* Execute implementation of email capture and engagement tactics using a variety of Email Service Providers (ESPs) and email capture tools
* Implement email capture tools such as pop-ups/forms with OptinMonster or similar platforms on creators’ sites
* Set up, implementation, audience targeting, and testing of lead generation tools
* Extensive QA of all tactics prior to deployment
* Set up workflows and audience targeting to ensure all tactics are optimized within ESP’s (Mailchimp, Convertkit, ActiveCampaign, Klaviyo, etc.)
* Work closely with the email account managers & design teams on timing, assets, engagement, and optimization
* Effectively manage multiple projects with attention to detail and time management
* Build a foundation for high-quality technical support and production of email capture and engagement tactics
* Go-to resource for technical troubleshooting and recommendations
* Research ways to expand creator campaign offerings as email service scales
* Document processes to create efficiencies

**The skills and experience you bring to the job:**

* Experience working with Email Service Providers (ESPs) and email capture tools including: setting up automated email campaigns, audience segmentation and targeting specific audiences, creating popups/forms, and ensuring integration between platforms (Mailchimp, Convertkit, ActiveCampaign, Sailthru, and OptinMonster experience preferred)
* Experience with project management software, specifically beneficial if you have experience using Monday.com
* Strong competence in the Wordpress CMS platform, including HTML & CSS editing, themes & plugin management, and content creation.
* Experience with design software such as Photoshop and Figma.
* Basic knowledge of Google Analytics and the Google Suite
* Familiarity with Zapier as a middleware.
* Excellent time management skills in a remote environment and the ability to juggle multiple processes and deadlines
* Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and with a team
* Proactive, eager, and able to take responsibility for scheduled and spontaneous projects
* Strict attention to detail
* Self-driven problem-solving skills, including working with customer support for various marketing technology platforms.

**About Raptive**


Raptive’s mission is to power creator independence. We’re a creator company that provides revenue, audience, business solutions, and much more for creators and enterprise publishers. Since the very beginning of digital content creation, we’ve been allies and advocates for every kind of creator and charted the uncharted to help creators grow their businesses through it all.


Today we are the catalyst for 5,000+ of the world’s most premium creators on the open web and rank as the tenth-largest digital property in the U.S. Creators who choose Raptive are premium content creators, trendsetters, iconic brands, and charismatic personalities, captivating more than 78% of U.S. audiences on their sites alone with the power to move and disrupt culture. They collectively rank #1 in Food, Family, Home, and Lifestyle-with a reach of more than 182M monthly unique visitors and more than half a billion followers across social platforms.


Creators are the future of media. And together, the future is ours to create.


The base salary range for this position is $55,000-$70,000 The range provided is Raptive’s reasonable estimate of the annualized base compensation for this role. The actual amount may be higher or lower, based on non-discriminatory factors such as experience, geographic location, knowledge, skills and abilities. This role is eligible for additional incentive compensation that isn’t included in the posted range.  

  

For more information, visit www.Raptive.com or follow us on LinkedIn or Instagram.

*Raptive is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We believe we are most impactful when people with a wide range of backgrounds, experiences, and identities come together with a common purpose. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Raptive is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please reach out to a member of our recruiting team.*

title: Subject Matter Expert
description:
**Role: Subject Matter Expert with Federal**

**Project: DHS**

**Type: Full-time**

**Location: Remote**

The Subject Matter Expert shall analyze user needs to develop requirements for IT products and services including specifications, feasibility studies, requirement analysis, etc.

The expert shall gather requirements, document processes, and develop/update requirements documentation.

The expert shall work with engineers on systems integration.

The expert shall use various methods to identify requirements including workshops, interviews, process modeling, surveys, and research.

The expert must possess knowledge and experience in elicitation, requirements management and communication, requirements analysis, solution assessment and validation.

**Required Skills/Experience:**

* **Experience with DHS/ICE needed.**
* Five (5) or more years of relevant experience in an Enterprise IT environment:
* Project Management Institute (PMI) Professional In Business Analysis (PBA) certification
* Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) certification
* Certified Scrum Master (CSM) certification
* Experience with requirements tools and tracking (e.g. JIRA, Version One)
* Experience facilitating Joint Application Development (JAD) requirements workshops
* Experience developing user stories, including facilitation, prioritization, and negotiation with business sponsors, stakeholders, project sponsors, product owners, and development teams
* Experience creating and maintaining requirements documentation, including business process flows, functional specifications, use cases, test plans, and supplementary specifications
* Experience leading UAT, including successful outcomes of achieving completed user stories and associated test criteria.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Work Location: Remote

title: Customer Success Specialist
description:
**Job Title:** Customer Success Specialist
**FLSA Status:** Exempt
**Reports To:** Director of Customer Success
**POSITION SUMMARY:**The Customer Success Specialist is a key role within Smart's organization. This is a high-level customer service role at the centralized level responsible for being a liaison between the customer, all internal departments, and the warehouses. Daily duties may include customer support via email, phone call, inventory management, data entry, system maintenance, reporting, and much more. We are looking for customer focused individuals with a high sense of urgency and excellent attention to detail.


**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Manages inbound and outbound shipments across several warehouses and regions to support strategic customer and supplier demands.
* Works with field support and customer service to ensure that customer requirements are met.
* Anticipates and reacts quickly and appropriately to logistical disruptions with the Replenishment Manager making decisions or engaging leadership when escalated issues arise.
* Works closely with the warehouses across the nation on the overall supply chain process to ensure service levels and customer targets are met
* Serves as the first point of contact for our customers, offering a high level of service and operational support.
* Maintains an open line of communication with customers and is continually engaged with their business products and needs.
* Customer interaction encompasses consistent phone and e-mail correspondence and would include the resolution of orders or billing problems in relation to the assigned warehouse.
* Research shipment tracking requests and provides feedback, including resolution of misplaced orders and/or shipments.
* Internally communicates with the business development, sales, integrations, and other internal workstreams as needed.
* Works closely with the internal IT department to support resolving customer issues.
* Reviews and administers the order process within the warehouse.
* Keys data into our proprietary system (SWIMS) and maintains order and customer data as directed.
* Guides communication resolution to customer
* Performs operations issues research for service failures and identify root cause
* Identifies operations improvement opportunities


**"THE PERSON" | MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:**


* Bachelor's degree or equivalent education and work experience combined.
* 2 or more years of experience in logistics, project management, transportation, routing, or similar business experience
* Proficient in Microsoft Office (Work, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook)
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Experience in supply chain or 3PL preferred


**KEY ATTRIBUTES:**


* Detail oriented and able to manage a multitude of projects and tasks at one time
* Must be well organized
* Ability to learn quickly and work in a fluid environment

*Smart Warehousing is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment, and do not discriminate based on race, age, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, status as a protected veteran, or status as an individual with a disability as well as all other characteristics and qualities protected by federal, state, or local law.*


*Smart Warehousing LLC collects personal online information. To read our Privacy Policy, click* *here**.*

title: Technical Support Engineer
description:
Location


Remote
Type


Full time
Department


Customer Success
Compensation


Base Salary Range: $100K – $120K • Offers Equity



The base salary range represents the minimum and maximum of the salary range for this position based at our San Francisco headquarters. The actual base salary offered for this position will depend on numerous factors, including individual proficiency, anticipated performance, and the location of the selected candidate. Our base salary is just one component of Ironclad’s competitive total rewards package, which also includes equity awards (a new hire grant, along with opportunities for additional awards throughout your tenure), competitive health and wellness benefits, and a commitment to career growth and development.
  
Ironclad is the #1 contract lifecycle management platform for innovative companies. Every company, in every country, in every industry runs on contracts, but managing these contracts slows companies down and costs them millions of dollars. L’Oréal, Staples, Mastercard, and other leading innovators use Ironclad to collaborate and negotiate on contracts, accelerate contracting while maintaining compliance, and turn contracts into critical carriers of operational business intelligence. It’s the only platform flexible enough to handle every type of contract workflow, whether a sales agreement, an HR agreement or a complex NDA.  

Ironclad is writing the narrative that shows how beautiful and functional contracting will change business. We’re a leader in the Forrester Wave for Contract Lifecycle Management. We have been recognized as a Fortune Great Place to Work for four consecutive years. Our innovation and work culture have been recognized by Glassdoor's Best Places to Work 2023, Forbes’ 50 Most Promising AI Companies, Wing Venture Capital's Enterprise Tech 30, and Gartner's Magic Quadrant. We work in a highly collaborative environment, and strive to foster a positive, inclusive culture. We’re backed by leading investors like Accel, Y Combinator, Sequoia, and BOND. For more information, visit www.ironcladapp.com or follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

  

Our Customer Success team is at the center of our mission to power the world’s contracts. Working cross-functionally, and with our Customers, this team ensures we’re building a product legal team’s love. Technical Support Engineers are primarily responsible for customer support/satisfaction and will be the point of contact for all technical support questions from Ironclad customers. You would be expected to have deep product knowledge and empathy to drive problem resolution with our customers. We’re looking for a team player who is customer-centric, creative and acts with a sense of urgency and ownership.


What You Will Be Doing:

* Provide responsive and exceptional support to new and existing customers via email and phone.
* Evaluate, troubleshoot, replicate and document product bugs for further escalation to Engineering.
* Work cross-functionally with Customer Success Managers and Legal Engineers to create an exceptional post-deployment customer experience.
* Identify and author knowledge base articles for product features and FAQ's and how-to.
* Leverage your customer interactions to help improve product roadmap and customer experience.
* Develop and document best practices for support process improvements and triaging of product feedback and enhancements.


Key Skills:

* 2+ years of experience in a customer service and/or technical support role.
* Strong technical aptitude and exceptional communication skills (written and verbal).
* An empathetic mindset with the drive to advocate for our customers.
* Ability to appropriately prioritize and escalate customer issues.
* Excellent troubleshooting and deep analytical skills.
* Experience and desire to work cross-functionally.
* Team and goal-oriented. High output; low ego.
* Live chat experience.
* Basic knowledge of ServiceCloud or other customer service software.

 **Benefits:**

* Health, dental, and vision insurance
* 401k
* Wellness reimbursement
* Take what you need vacation policy
* Generous parental leave for both primary and secondary caregivers

**Base Salary Range: $100,000 - $120,000**


The base salary range represents the minimum and maximum of the salary range for this position based at our San Francisco headquarters. The actual base salary offered for this position will depend on numerous factors, including individual proficiency, anticipated performance, and the location of the selected candidate. Our base salary is just one component of Ironclad’s competitive total rewards package, which also includes equity awards (a new hire grant, along with opportunities for additional awards throughout your tenure), competitive health and wellness benefits, and a commitment to career growth and development.


Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Nonprofit Client Solutions Specialist
description:
**\\*Prior nonprofit experience is essential for consideration for this position.**

**Job Summary**

Are you ready to take the lead in driving technological innovations for some of the world's most impactful nonprofit organizations? Join Togetherwork, where we pride ourselves on delivering cutting-edge solutions across diverse industries. We are on the lookout for a dynamic and passionate full-time Project Manager to work remotely within the U.S. and collaborate with our talented team on transformative technical solutions.

As a Project Manager with us, you'll be instrumental in revolutionizing digital fundraising and advocacy programs for organizations like the ASPCA, International Rescue Committee, Drug Policy Alliance, and the ACLU. We're seeking someone with superior client service skills, a knack for breaking down complex software projects, and a genuine curiosity for all things technical. Former developers/producers are more than welcome!

**Responsibilities**

* Be the lead point of contact for clients, overseeing large-scale software implementations, system integrations, and other tech consulting projects.
* Collaborate with design firms, CRM consultants, and ESP specialists to deliver comprehensive solutions to clients.
* Develop internal and client-facing project timelines, milestones, budget reports, technical requirements, and user documentation.
* Guide clients in making complex technical decisions aligned with business goals and strategic objectives.
* Manage and inspire a team of developers and producers to ensure timely and budget-friendly project delivery.
* Provide clients with top-notch customer service throughout the project life cycle.
* Ensure projects align with SOW deliverables and budget.

**Requirements** 

* Experience working for a nonprofit organization
* Knowledge of fundraising, online marketing, & social media strategies.
* Experience with development and implementation of new projects, including Salesforce and internal system integrations.
* Ability to manage multiple client engagements simultaneously while delivering exceptional customer service.
* Proficiency in CMS, eCRM, Blogs, fundraising, ESPs, and advocacy software.
* Strong attention to detail, organization, and ability to lead multi-functional teams.
* Independence and discipline for remote work.
* Creative thinking and problem-solving skills.

**Preferred, but not required**

* Project management experience in client-facing software implementation/delivery across all SDLC levels.
* Comfort and confidence in configuring and navigating CMS platforms like Drupal.
* Salesforce implementation/administration experience, especially with Non-Profit Success Pack (NPSP) or NGOC.
* Familiarity with Microsoft 365 tools.

**The Company offers a comprehensive employee benefits program, including:**

* Medical, dental, and vision insurance options
* 100% Employer paid short/long term disability
* Basic Life
* 401(k) option with 100% company match
* Flexible paid personal/vacation time built on mutual trust and accountability

Togetherwork does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, age, ethnic or national origin, or any other basis protected by all local, state or federal laws.

Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on factors including, but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Togetherwork's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include discretionary bonuses, long term incentives, a flexible paid vacation/personal time policy, 6 weeks paid parental leave and more.*

***Salary Range***

Togetherwork provides integrated software and financial solutions to a wide range of communities and organizations including associations, camps, unions, fraternities & sororities, gyms, dance studios, religious congregations, pet services, and more.

Our mission-critical tools help our customers manage and grow their communities, and enhance the depth and breadth of their member engagement. Our team is united in its desire to help our clients better serve and empower their communities.

title: Entry Level Tech Support 100% WORK FROM HOME + Benefits
description:
Hey there, are you looking for an awesome **100% work-from-home**opportunity? Look no further because OneSupport is hiring Technical Support Representatives!



As part of our team, you'll enjoy lots of perks! Starting from day one of training, you will earn $12/hour. And after 90 days, you will have the opportunity to use Paid Time Off (PTO) - **which starts accruing on day one**.



There's also plenty of room for growth in our organization. We're committed to **promoting exclusively from within**, meaning that if you're the kind of person who's willing to work hard and go the extra mile, you'll have ample opportunities to advance your career and take on new challenges.



We offer benefits too! Depending on your employment status, you may qualify for medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and **even 401k with matching**.



Plus, we'll provide you with the **paid training** you need to succeed in your new role.



What exactly will you be doing in this new role, you ask? As a member of our technical support team, you'll have the opportunity to provide troubleshooting assistance for both residential and business customers, helping them overcome issues like slow internet speeds, outages, and email support. It's a challenging role, but one that's incredibly rewarding - **you'll be making a genuine difference in the lives of people who rely on our services every day.**



To be considered for this position, you'll need a computer running an authentic/validated/native copy of Windows 10, 11, or the most current macOS (Macs cannot be more than 5 years old), a USB headset and webcam, and at least one 15" or larger monitor. Your internet speed should be at least 2 Mbps download and 1 Mbps upload, and a direct Ethernet connection is preferred.



In addition to having tech and customer service skills, you'll also need to be able to sit for extended periods of time, have manual dexterity, and type at a rate of 40 WPM with 80% accuracy. A job like this also requires a quiet and distraction-free workspace.



Currently, we can only hire applicants who are located in the beautiful states of Alabama, Arkansas, Florida, Idaho, Kansas, Kentucky, Mississippi, Missouri, Montana, Nevada, New Mexico (excluding Santa Fe County), North Carolina, Ohio, South Carolina, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Virginia, and Wisconsin. If you call one of these states home, we would love to hear from you.



Come join the OneSupport team and **start a new career from the comfort of your own home**! Discover just how far your passion and determination can take you!
